  4936                                  ;BREAK <AbsDRD, AbsDWRT -- INT int_disk_read, int_disk_write handlers>>
  4937                                  
  4938                                  ;   AbsSetup - setup for abs disk functions
  4939                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4940                                  
  4941                                  AbsSetup:
  4942                                  	; 02/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1, Retro DOS 5.0)
  4943                                  	;;;
  4944                                  	;
  4945 000004DA 1E                      	push	ds ; *
  4946 000004DB 16                      	push	ss
  4947 000004DC 1F                      	pop	ds
  4948                                  	;
  4949 000004DD 8826[E20A]              	mov	[absdrw_extd],ah
  4950                                  	;mov	[ss:absdrw_extd],ah	; Extended ABS Disk Read/Write flag
  4951                                  					; (AH=1 for INT 21h ax=7305h function)
  4952 000004E1 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  4953 000004E3 7508                    	jnz	short AbsSetup1		; INT 21h AX=7305h
  4954                                  
  4955                                  	; INT 25h
  4956 000004E5 FE06[DF13]              	inc	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
  4957                                  	;inc	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]	; Windows DOSBOX's INDOS flag ?
  4958                                  	;;;
  4959 000004E9 FE06[2103]              	inc	byte [INDOS]
  4960                                  	;INC	byte [SS:INDOS]		; SS override
  4961                                  AbsSetup1:
  4962 000004ED FB                      	STI
  4963 000004EE FC                      	CLD
  4964                                  	; 02/01/2024
  4965                                  	;PUSH	DS
  4966                                  	;push	ss
  4967                                  	;pop	ds
  4968 000004EF E83A01                  	CALL	GETBP
  4969                                  	; 02/01/2024
  4970 000004F2 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
  4971 000004F3 7229                    	JC	short errdriv 		; PM. error drive ;AN000;
  4972                                  	
  4973                                  	; 02/01/2024
  4974                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh]

  4976                                  ;errdriv:

  4978                                  	;jnc	short AbsSetup2
  4979                                  ;AbsSetup_retn:
  4980                                  	;retn
  4981                                  
  4982                                  AbsSetup2:
  4983                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4984                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  4985                                  					; SS override
  4986 000004F5 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 ;>32mb	from API		;AN000;
  4987 000004FC E8BF04                  	CALL	RW32_CONVERT		;>32mb convert 32bit format to 16bit ;AN000;
  4988                                  	;jc	short AbsSetup_retn
  4989                                  	;call	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS 	;LB. set up SC parms		;AN000;
  4990                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4991 000004FF 721D                    	jc	short errdriv
  4992                                  	;call	null_sub ; retn	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
  4993

  4995 00000501 1E                      	PUSH	DS

  4997 00000503 50                      	PUSH	AX
  4998                                  
  4999 00000504 16                      	push	ss
  5000 00000505 1F                      	pop	ds

  5002 00000506 BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF
  5003 00000509 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL
  5004 0000050B 800441                  	ADD	BYTE [SI],"A"
  5005 0000050E C744013A00              	MOV	WORD [SI+1],003AH ; ":",0
  5006 00000513 B80003                  	MOV	AX,0300H
  5007 00000516 F8                      	CLC
  5008 00000517 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM ; int 2Ah	; Will set carry if shared
  5009

  5011                                  		; (INT 2Ah - AX = 0300h)
  5012                                  		; Microsoft Networks - CHECK DIRECT I/O
  5013                                  		; DS:SI -> ASCIIZ disk device name (may be full path or
  5014                                  		;    only drive specifier--must include the colon)
  5015                                  		; Return: CF clear if absolute disk access allowed
  5016                                  
  5017 00000519 58                      	POP	AX
  5018 0000051A 5E                      	POP	SI
  5019 0000051B 1F                      	POP	DS
  5020 0000051C 730E                    	jnc	short AbsSetup_retn
  5021

  5033                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5034                                  ;
  5035                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDRD
  5036                                  ;
  5037                                  ; Interrupt 25 handler. Performs absolute disk read.
  5038                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5039                                  ;		DS:BX point to destination buffer
  5040                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to read
  5041                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5042                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5043                                  ;		Carry set
  5044                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5045                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5046                                  ;
  5047                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5048                                          ;procedure   ABSDRD,FAR
  5049                                  ABSDRD:
  5050                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5051                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:42E5h)
  5052                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5053                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:42D8h)
  5054                                  
  5055                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5056                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:43C4h
  5057                                  	
  5058                                  	;;;
  5059 0000052D 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 25h handler (ah=0)
  5060 0000052F 31F6                    	xor     si,si	; si=0		; clear read/write mode flags
  5061                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5062                                  FAT32_ABSDRD:	; ah=1 si=0 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5063 00000531 FA                      	cli
  5064                                  	;clc ; not necessary
  5065                                  				; INT 21h
  5066                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5067                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5068                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5069                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5070                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5071                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5072                                  				;
  5073                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5074                                  				;
  5075                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5076                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5077                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5078                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5079                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5080                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5081                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5082                                  				;		11 file data
  5083                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5084                                  				;
  5085                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5086                                  				;
  5087                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5088                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5089                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5090                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5091                                  				;
  5092                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5093                                  	;;;
  5094                                  absdrd_1:
  5095                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5096                                  	;CLI
  5097                                  	
  5098                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5099                                  
  5100 00000532 50                      	push	ax			; preserve AX value
  5101 00000533 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; store DS value in AX
  5102                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5103 00000535 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5104 0000053A A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax		; store DS value in TEMPSEG
  5105 0000053D 58                      	pop	ax			; restore AX value
  5106                                  
  5107                                  	; M072:
  5108                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5109                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5110                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5111                                  
  5112 0000053E 06                      	push	es  ; ****		; M072
  5113                                  
  5114                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5115                                  	;;;
  5116                                  	; 02/01/2024
  5117 0000053F 9C                      	pushf	; !*!
  5118 00000540 7300                    	jnc	short absdrd_2		; (not jumped from ABSDWRT) absolute disk read
  5119                                  	
  5120                                  	;(jumped from ABSDRWT)
  5121                                  	; 02/01/2023 ; (!*!)
  5122                                  	;or	ah,ah
  5123                                  	;stc				; absolute disk write
  5124                                  	;jmp	short absdrd_3
  5125                                  absdrd_2:
  5126 00000542 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5127                                  absdrd_3:
  5128 00000544 7510                    	jnz	short absdrd_4		; EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5129                                  	;;;
  5130                                  
  5131 00000546 8C16[1B06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5132 0000054A 8926[1D06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5133                                  
  5134                                  ; 	set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5135                                  ;
  5136                                  ; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the ROMDOS
  5137                                  ; version of the getdseg macro with the SS register! An interrupt will
  5138                                  ; sneak through.
  5139                                  
  5140                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5141                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5142                                  
  5143 0000054E 2E8E16[0700]            	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5144                                  
  5145                                  ;else

  5177                                  	; Here is a gross temporary fix to get around a serious design flaw in
  5178                                  	;  the secondary cache. The secondary cache does not check for media
  5179                                  	;  changed (it should). Hence, you can change disks, do an absolute
  5180                                  	;  read, and get data from the previous disk. To get around this,
  5181                                  	;  we just won't use the secondary cache for absolute disk reads.
  5182                                  	;                                                      -mw 8/5/88

  5198                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
  5199                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5200                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5201                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
  5202                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5203                                  ;
  5204                                  ;	The Buffer Queue must now be scanned: the contents of any dirty
  5205                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
  5206                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.

  5283                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5284                                  ;
  5285                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDWRT
  5286                                  ;
  5287                                  ; Interrupt 26 handler. Performs absolute disk write.
  5288                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5289                                  ;		DS:BX point to source buffer
  5290                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to write
  5291                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5292                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5293                                  ;		Carry set
  5294                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5295                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5296                                  ;
  5297                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5298                                          ;procedure   ABSDWRT,FAR
  5299                                  ABSDWRT:
  5300                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5301                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:436Ch)
  5302                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5303                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:435Fh)
  5304                                  
  5305                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5306                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4477h
  5307                                  
  5308                                  	;;;
  5309 000005DC 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 26h handler (ah=0)
  5310 000005DE BE0100                  	mov	si,1			; set direction flag/bit to write
  5311                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5312                                  FAT32_ABSDWRT:	; ah=1 si=1 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5313                                  
  5314                                  				; INT 21h
  5315                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5316                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5317                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5318                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5319                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5320                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5321                                  				;
  5322                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5323                                  				;
  5324                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5325                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5326                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5327                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5328                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5329                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5330                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5331                                  				;		11 file data
  5332                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5333                                  				;
  5334                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5335                                  				;
  5336                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5337                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5338                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5339                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5340                                  				;
  5341                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5342 000005E1 3C02                    	cmp	al,2
  5343 000005E3 7220                    	jb	short absdrwt_2	; floppy disk
  5344                                  	; hard disk
  5345 000005E5 53                      	push	bx
  5346 000005E6 1E                      	push	ds
  5347 000005E7 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5348 000005EC 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
  5349 000005EE 88C3                    	mov	bl,al			;
  5350                                  					; NOTE: PCDOS 7.1 kernel does not set
  5351                                  					; DOS_FLAG bit 6 or drive_flags bit 7
  5352                                  					; (It appears that these bits are set
  5353                                  					; by Windows or a system utility or
  5354                                  					; driver that knows the addresses of
  5355                                  					; these FLAGs in the DOSDATA segment.)
  5356                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/01/2024
  5357                                  					;
  5358 000005F0 F687[2F14]80            	test	byte [drive_flags+bx],80h 
  5359                                  					; test bit 7 (locked bit) ; 29/01/2024
  5360 000005F5 7505                    	jnz	short absdwrt_1		; locked (logical drive) -allowed to abs write-
  5361                                  					; NOTE: lock/unlock are MSDOS/PCDOS 7 extd functions
  5362 000005F7 F606[8600]40            	test	byte [DOS_FLAG],40h	; test bit 6 (large disk support -windows- bit?)
  5363                                  					; NOTE: Retro DOS v5 kernel must set this bit.

  5389                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5390                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5391                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5392                                  
  5393                                  	push	es ; ****		; M072
  5394                                  
  5395                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5396                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5397                                  
  5398                                  	; set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5399                                  	;
  5400                                  	; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the 
  5401                                  	; ROMDOS version of the getdseg macro with the SS register!
  5402                                  	; An interrupt will sneak through.
  5403                                  
  5404                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5405                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5406                                  	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5407                                  ;else
  5408                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5409                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5410                                  ;

  5412                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5413                                  ;
  5414                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

  5416                                  	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK
  5417                                  		; we are now switched to DOS's disk stack

  5420

  5425                                  	PUSH	ES ; **
  5426                                  %endif

  5450                                  ;M039
  5451                                  ;       DS:BX = transfer address (source data address).
  5452                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
  5453                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5454                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5455                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5456                                  ;       [CURSC_DRIVE] = -1 (invalid drive).
  5457                                  ;
  5458                                  ;       Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
  5459                                  ;       written. Note that all the above registers are preserved for
  5460                                  ;       DSKWRITE.

  5473                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5474                                  ;
  5475                                  ; Procedure Name : GETBP
  5476                                  ;
  5477                                  ; Inputs:
  5478                                  ;	AL = Logical unit number (A = 0)
  5479                                  ; Function:
  5480                                  ;	Find Drive Parameter Block
  5481                                  ; Outputs:
  5482                                  ;	ES:BP points to DPB
  5483                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
  5484                                  ;	Carry set if unit number bad or unit is a NET device.
  5485                                  ;		Later case sets extended error error_I24_not_supported
  5486                                  ; No other registers alteredjjj
  5487                                  ;
  5488                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5489                                  
  5490                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  5491                                  	; 04/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5492                                  	; PCDOS 76.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:44C7h
  5493                                  GETBP:
  5494                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5495                                  	; 11/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  5496 0000062C 50                      	PUSH	AX

  5502 00000636 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			;DCR. ax= error code 	;AN000;
  5503 00000638 83F81A                  	CMP	AX,error_not_DOS_disk	;DCR. is unknown media ? ;AN000;
  5504 0000063B 740A                    	JZ	SHORT SKIPGET 		;DCR. yes, let it go 	;AN000;
  5505 0000063D F9                      	STC				;DCR.			;AN000;
  5506 0000063E A3[2403]                	MOV	[EXTERR],AX	;PM. invalid drive or Non DOS drive ;AN000;
  5507 00000641 C706[080E]0102          	MOV	WORD [AbsDskErr],201h
  5508                                  SKIPGET:
  5509 00000647 58                      	POP	AX
  5510 00000648 7212                    	JC	SHORT GETBP_RETN ; 15/12/2022

  5512                                  	;jnc	short getbp_t

  5520                                  	;TEST	WORD [ES:BP+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; Clears carry

  5524 0000065B F9                      	STC
  5525                                  GETBP_RETN:
  5526 0000065C C3                      	RETN
  5527                                  
  5528                                  GETBP_CDS:

  5547                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5548                                  ;
  5549                                  ; Procedure Name : SYS_RETURN
  5550                                  ;
  5551                                  ; These are the general system call exit mechanisms. All internal system
  5552                                  ; calls will transfer (jump) to one of these at the end. Their sole purpose
  5553                                  ; is to set the user's flags and set his AX register for return.
  5554                                  ;
  5555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5556                                  
  5557                                          ;procedure   SYS_RETURN,NEAR
  5558                                  SYS_RETURN:        
  5559                                          ;entry	SYS_RET_OK
  5560                                  SYS_RET_OK:   
  5561 00000670 E804FE                  	call    Get_User_Stack
  5562                                  		; turn off user's carry flag
  5563                                  SYS_RET_OK_clc: ; 25/06/2019 
  5564                                          ;;and	word [SI+16h],0FFFEh 
  5565                                  	;and	word [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry 
  5566                                          ; 25/06/2019
  5567 00000673 806416FE                	and	byte [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry ; 0FEh
  5568                                  	; 04/01/2024
  5569                                  	;JMP	SHORT DO_RET
  5570                                  DO_RET:
  5571                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX ; Really only sets AH
  5572 00000677 8904                    	MOV	[SI],AX
  5573 00000679 C3                      	RETN
  5574                                  
  5575                                          ;entry   SYS_RET_ERR
  5576                                  SYS_RET_ERR:        
  5577 0000067A 30E4                    	XOR     AH,AH 		; hack to allow for smaller error rets
  5578 0000067C E86B00                  	call	ETAB_LK 	; Make sure code is OK, EXTERR gets set

  5581                                  	;entry	From_GetSet
  5582                                  From_GetSet:

  5586                                  	;OR	word [SI+user_env.user_F],f_Carry
  5587                                  	; 25/06/2019

  5590                                  	; 04/01/2024

  5593                                  	;;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX ; Really only sets AH
  5594                                  	;MOV	[SI],AX

  5597                                  	;entry	FCB_RET_OK

  5953                                  ; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5954                                  
  5955                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5956                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5957                                  ;
  5958                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5959                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5960                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.
  5961                                  ; DOSMGR query 	- for this, we need to indicate that instance data
  5962                                  ;		  has already been handled. this is indicated by setting
  5963                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  6507                                  	; chain as instance data. Currently, we let the WIN386 DOSMGR handle
  6508                                  	; this by returning a status of not previously instanced. The basic
  6509                                  	; structure of these things have not changed and so the current 
  6510                                  	; DOSMGR code should be able to work it out
  6511                                  
  6512                                  	xor	dx,dx			; make sure dx has a not done value
  6513                                  	jmp	short PopIret		; skip done indication
  6514                                  %endif
  6515                                  
  6516                                  	; 15/12/2022
  6517                                  ;win386_done:
  6518                                  ;	mov	ax,WIN_OP_DONE		; 0B97Ch
  6519                                  ;	mov	dx,DOSMGR_OP_DONE	; 0A2ABh
  6520                                  ;PopIret:
  6521                                  ;	pop	ds
  6522                                  ;	iret				; return back up the chain
  6523                                  
  6524                                  	; 15/12/2022
  6525                                  ;win_nexti2f:
  6526                                  	;pop	ds
  6527                                  	;jmp	next_i2f		; go to BIOS i2f handler
  6528                                  
  6529                                  ;End WIN386 support
  6530                                  
  6531                                  ; 15/05/2019
  6532                                  
  6533                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6534                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6535                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6536                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6537                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6538                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6539                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6540                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6541                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6542                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6543                                  
  6544                                  getwinlast:
  6545                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6546 00000961 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6547 00000965 4E                      	dec	si
  6548 00000966 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6549 00000968 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6550 0000096D C3                      	retn
  6551                                  
  6552                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6553                                  %if 0
  6554                                  winold_swap:
  6555                                  	push	ds
  6556                                  	push	es
  6557                                  	push	si
  6558                                  	push	di
  6559                                  	push	cx
  6560                                  
  6561                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6562                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6563                                  
  6564                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6565                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6566                                  	call	getwinlast
  6567                                  	push	ds
  6568                                  	pop	es
  6569                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6570                                  	xor	si,si
  6571                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6572                                  	mov	cx,8
  6573                                  	cld
  6574                                  	push	cx
  6575                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6576                                  	pop	cx
  6577                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6578                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6579                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6580                                  swapin:
  6581                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6582                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6583                                  	call	getwinlast
  6584                                  	mov	es,si
  6585                                  	xor	di,di
  6586                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6587                                  	mov	cx,8
  6588                                  	cld
  6589                                  	push	cx
  6590                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6591                                  	pop	cx
  6592                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6593                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6594                                  winold_done:
  6595                                  	pop	cx
  6596                                  	pop	di
  6597                                  	pop	si
  6598                                  	pop	es
  6599                                  	pop	ds
  6600                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6601                                  
  6602                                  %endif
  6603                                  
  6604                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6605                                  
  6606                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  6607                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS)
  6608                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4811h
  6609                                  
  6610                                  	; INT 2Fh AX=1231h
  6611                                  	; Windows95 - SET/CLEAR "REPORT WINDOWS TO DOS PROGRAMS" FLAG
  6612                                  	; 			(Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List)
  6613                                  int_2Fh_1231h:
  6614 0000096E 1E                      	push	ds
  6615 0000096F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6616 00000974 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
  6617 00000976 08D2                    	or	dl,dl
  6618 00000978 7507                    	jnz	short not_1231_dl_0
  6619 0000097A C606[A210]01            	mov	byte [IsWin386+1],1	; set byte after "IsWIN386" to 01h
  6620 0000097F EB1A                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6621                                  
  6622                                  	;nop
  6623                                  
  6624                                  not_1231_dl_0:

  6626 00000984 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_1	; clear "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6627 00000986 800E[A110]02            	or	byte [IsWin386],2	; set "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6628 0000098B EB0E                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6629                                  
  6630                                  	;nop
  6631                                  
  6632                                  not_1231_dl_1:
  6633 0000098D 80FA02                  	cmp	dl,2
  6634 00000990 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_2
  6635 00000992 8026[A110]FD            	and	byte [IsWin386],0FDh	; clear bit 1
  6636 00000997 EB02                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6637                                  not_1231_dl_2:
  6638 00000999 40                      	inc	ax              	; return error, ax = 1
  6639 0000099A F9                      	stc
  6640                                  int_2f_1231h_retn:
  6641 0000099B 1F                      	pop	ds
  6642 0000099C C3                      	retn

  6720                                  	;dec	dx

  6738 000009DC F7E2                    	MUL	DX			;>32mb  dx:ax= max sector # ;AN000;

  6883                                  
  6884                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6885                                  
  6886                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6887                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6888                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6889                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6890                                  
  6891                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6892                                  CANCHAR:
  6893 00000A95 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6894                                  	
  6895                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6896                                  ESCCHAR:
  6897 00000A96 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6898                                  	
  6899                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6900                                  
  6901                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6902                                  
  6903                                  	;IF	IBM
  6904 00000A97 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6905 00000A98 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6906 00000A99 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6907 00000A9A 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6908 00000A9B 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6909 00000A9C 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6910 00000A9D 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6911 00000A9E 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6912 00000A9F 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6913 00000AA0 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6914 00000AA1 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6915 00000AA2 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6916 00000AA3 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6917 00000AA4 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6918                                  	;ENDIF
  6919                                  
  6920                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6921                                  
  6922                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6923

  6943                                  ; DOSMES.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  6944                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6945                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6946                                  
  6947                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6948                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6949                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6950                                  ;
  6951                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6952                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6953                                  ;           the following labels:
  6954                                  ;
  6955                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6956                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6957                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6958                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6959                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6960                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6961                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6962                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6963                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6964                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6965                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6966                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line
  6967                                  ;           CtrlZ       - place a ^Z into the template
  6968                                  ; Registers that are allowed to be modified by this function are:
  6969                                  ;           AX, CX, BP
  6970                                  
  6971                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6972                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6973                                  ; DOSCODE:4820h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6974                                  
  6975                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6976                                  ; -------------------------------------

  7476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7477                                  
  7478                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7479                                  ; DOSCODE:4A0Fh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7480                                  
  7481                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7482                                  ; DOSCODE:4B5Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7483                                  
  7484                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7485                                  
  7486                                  ; Inputs:
  7487                                  ;       None
  7488                                  ; Function:
  7489                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7490                                  ; Outputs:
  7491                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7492                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7493                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7494                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7495                                  
  7496                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7497                                  ;
  7498                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7499                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7500                                  ;
  7501                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7502                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7503                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7504                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7505                                  ;		 
  7506                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7507                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7508                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7509                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7510                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7511                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7512                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7513                                  
  7514                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7515 00000C9C 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7516 00000CA1 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7517                                  
  7518                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, offset 196Dh)
  7519                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7520                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)
  7521                                  
  7522 00000CA3 16                              PUSH    SS
  7523 00000CA4 1F                              POP     DS
  7524                                          
  7525                                  	; 06/01/2024
  7526                                  	;MOV	BX,[USERNUM+2]
  7527                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7528                                  
  7529                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7530                                  
  7531                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7532                                  	;DOS flags
  7533                                  
  7534 00000CA5 3C01                    	cmp	AL,1
  7535 00000CA7 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7536                                  
  7537                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7538                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7539                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7540                                  ;else
  7541 00000CA9 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7542                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7543                                  
  7544                                  Norm_Vers:
  7545                                  	;MOV	AX,[MSVERS]  ; MSDOS 3.3
  7546                                  
  7547                                          	; MSDOS 6.0	; MSVERS is a label in TABLE segment	
  7548                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7549 00000CAB 1E                      	push	ds		; Get the version number from the
  7550 00000CAC 8E1E[3003]              	mov	ds,[CurrentPDB]	; current app's PSP segment
  7551                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]
  7552 00000CB0 A14000                  	mov	ax,[PDB.Version] ; AX = DOS version number	
  7553                                  	; 07/12/2022
  7554 00000CB3 1F                      	pop	ds
  7555 00000CB4 E8C0F7                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  7556                                  				; Put values for return registers
  7557                                  				; in the proper place on the user's	 
  7558                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI
  7559                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7560                                  gdrvfspc_ret:
  7561                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  7562 00000CB7 8904                            MOV	[SI],AX
  7563                                          ;MOV	[SI+4],CX
  7564 00000CB9 894C04                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  7565                                  set_user_bx:
  7566                                  	;MOV	[SI+2],BX
  7567 00000CBC 895C02                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  7568                                  
  7569 00000CBF C3                      	RETN
  7570

  7574                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7605                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7607                                  ;
  7608                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7609                                  ;
  7610                                  ; Inputs:
  7611                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7612                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7613                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7614                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7615                                  ;	INT	21
  7616                                  ; Function:
  7617                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7618                                  ; Outputs:
  7619                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7620                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7621                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7622                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7623                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7624                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7625                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7626                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7627                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7628                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7629                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7630                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7631                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7632                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7633                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7634                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7635                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7636                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7637                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7638                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7639                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7640                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7641                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7642                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7643                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7644                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7645                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7646                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7647                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7648                                  ;	  Carry:
  7649                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7650                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7651                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7652                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7653                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7654                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7655                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7656                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7657                                  ;	  Carry:
  7658                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7659                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7660                                  
  7661                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7662                                  
  7663                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7664                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7665                                  
  7666                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7667                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7668                                  
  7669                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7670                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7671                                  
  7672                                  _$INTERNATIONAL:  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), offset 1992h
  7673                                  	 
  7674 00000CCC 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  7675 00000CCE 7404                    	JZ	short BX_HAS_CODE	; -1 means country code is in BX
  7676 00000CD0 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL			; Put AL country code in BX

  7864                                  _$ExtCountryInfo:
  7865                                  			; INT 21h, AH = 70h
  7866                                  			; GET/SET INTERNATIONALIZATION INFORMATION
  7867                                  			; ****
  7868                                  			; AL = subfunction
  7869                                  			; 00h SET general internationalization info
  7870                                  			;    CX = buffer size (up to 38 bytes)

  7932                                  ; Procedure Name : $GetExtCntry
  7933                                  ;
  7934                                  ; Inputs:
  7935                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7936                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7937                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length
  7938                                  ;	      22H    capitalize ASCIIZ string
  7939                                  ;	      23H    YES/NO check, DL=1st char DH= 2nd char (DBCS)
  7940                                  ;	      80H bit 0 = use normal upper case table
  7941                                  ;		      1 = use file upper case table

  7943                                  ;
  7944                                  ;	else
  7945                                  ;
  7946                                  ;	MOV	AH,GetExtCntry	 ; DOS 3.3
  7947                                  ;	MOV	AL,INFO_ID	( info type,-1 selects all )
  7948                                  ;	MOV	BX,CODE_PAGE	( -1 = active code page )
  7949                                  ;	MOV	DX,COUNTRY_ID	( -1 = active country )
  7950                                  ;	MOV	CX,SIZE 	( amount of data to return )
  7951                                  ;	LES	DI,COUNTRY_INFO ( buffer for returned data )
  7952                                  ;	INT	21
  7953                                  ; Function:
  7954                                  ;	give users extended country dependent information
  7955                                  ;	or capitalize chars
  7956                                  ; Outputs:
  7957                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7958                                  ;	     extended country info is succesfully returned

  7960                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7961                                  ;	     AX=0, NO	 for YES/NO CHECK

  8274                                  ;	MOV	AH,GetSetCdPg	; DOS 3.3
  8275                                  ;	MOV	AL,n		; n = 1 : get code page, n = 2 : set code page
  8276                                  ;	MOV	BX,CODE_PAGE	(set code page only)
  8277                                  ;	INT	21
  8278                                  ;
  8279                                  ;	ENTRY	(al) = n
  8280                                  ;		(bx) = code page
  8281                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear
  8282                                  ;		  global code page is set	(set global code page)
  8283                                  ;		  (BX) = active code page id	(get global code page)
  8284                                  ;		  (DX) = system code page id	(get global code page)
  8285                                  ;		'C' set
  8286                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
  8287                                  
  8288                                  ;procedure  $GetSetCdPg,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  8289                                  
  8290                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8291                                  	; DOSCODE:4BC9h
  8292                                  
  8293                                  	; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  8294                                  	; DOSCODE:4D73h
  8295

  8297                                  
  8298                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
  8299                                  	;context DS
  8300                                  
  8301 00000EB3 16                      	push	ss
  8302 00000EB4 1F                      	pop	ds
  8303                                  
  8304                                  ;hkn; COUNTRY_CDPG is in DOSDATA
  8305 00000EB5 BE[5113]                	MOV	SI,COUNTRY_CDPG	  ; (DOSDATA:122Ah for MSDOS 6.21)

  8309

  8323                                  	;mov	[si+6],dx

  8325                                  OK_RETURN:

  8327                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_OK
  8328 00000ECB E9A2F7                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
  8329                                  	; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  8330                                  	;jmp	short nono_jmp
  8331

  8333                                  ;ASSUME	DS:DOSDATA
  8334                                  
  8335                                  setglpg:
  8336 00000ECE 3C02                    	CMP	AL,2
  8337 00000ED0 752F                    	JNZ	short nomem
  8338                                  	
  8339                                  	;;mov	dx,[si+63h] ; MSDOS 3.3
  8340                                  	;mov	dx,[si+68h] ; MSDOS 6.0
  8341 00000ED2 8B5468                  	MOV	DX,[SI+DOS_CCDPG.ccDosCountry]	;smr;use ds
  8342                                  	
  8343                                  	;CallInstall NLSInstall,NLSFUNC,0 ; check if NLSFUNC in memory
  8344 00000ED5 B80014                  	mov     ax,1400h
  8345 00000ED8 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; - Multiplex - NLSFUNC.COM - INSTALLATION CHECK
  8346                                  			; Return: AL = 00h not installed, OK to install
  8347                                  			; 01h not installed, not OK
  8348                                  			; FFh installed
  8349 00000EDA 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  8350 00000EDC 7523                    	JNZ	short nomem		; not in memory
  8351

  8353 00000EDE B80114                  	mov     ax,1401h
  8354 00000EE1 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; - Multiplex - NLSFUNC.COM - CHANGE CODE PAGE
  8355                                  			; DS:SI -> internal code page structure
  8356                                  			; BX = new code page, DX = country code???

  8397                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Drive_Freespace -- Return bytes of free disk space on a drive>
  8398                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8399                                  ;**	$Get_Drive_Freespace - Return amount of drive free space
  8400                                  ;
  8401                                  ;	$Get_Drive_Freespace returns the # of free allocation units on a
  8402                                  ;		drive.
  8403                                  ;
  8404                                  ;	This call returns the same info in the same registers (except for the
  8405                                  ;	FAT pointer) as the old FAT pointer calls
  8406                                  ;
  8407                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = Drive number
  8408                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Sectors per allocation unit
  8409                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  8410                                  ;		On User Stack
  8411                                  ;		    BX = Number of free allocation units
  8412                                  ;		    DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  8413                                  ;		    CX = Sector size
  8414                                  
  8415                                  ;procedure   $GET_DRIVE_FREESPACE,NEAR
  8416                                  
  8417                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8418                                  	; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  8419                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4DC4h)
  8420                                  
  8421                                  _$GET_DRIVE_FREESPACE:
  8422                                  
  8423                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
  8424                                  	;context DS
  8425 00000F05 16                      	push	ss
  8426 00000F06 1F                      	pop	ds
  8427                                  
  8428 00000F07 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
  8429                                  	;invoke	GetThisDrv		; Get drive
  8430 00000F09 E86267                  	call	GETTHISDRV
  8431                                  SET_AX_RET:
  8432 00000F0C 721C                    	JC	short BADFDRV
  8433                                  	;invoke	DISK_INFO
  8434 00000F0E E85924                  	call	DISK_INFO
  8435                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8436                                  	;XCHG	DX,BX
  8437                                  	;;JC	short SET_AX_RET	; User FAILed to I 24
  8438                                  	; 06/01/2024
  8439 00000F11 7217                    	jc	short BADFDRV
  8440                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  8441                                  gdrvfspc_1:
  8442 00000F13 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Chuck Fat ID byte
  8443                                  	;;;
  8444 00000F15 57                      	push	di
  8445 00000F16 E80E09                  	call	TestNet
  8446 00000F19 5F                      	pop	di
  8447 00000F1A 7203                    	jc	short gdrvfspc_2
  8448 00000F1C E84F25                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  8449                                  			; if hw of total clusters (di) > 0
  8450                                  			; sectors per cluster and cluster counts
  8451                                  			; will be modified (shifted)
  8452                                  			; (but sectors per clust * clust count will be same)
  8453                                  			; /// disk size -calculation- limit = 2 GB ///
  8454                                  gdrvfspc_2:
  8455 00000F1F 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; bx = free clusters (after xchg)
  8456                                  	;;;
  8457                                  DoSt:
  8458 00000F21 E853F5                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8459                                  ;ASSUME	DS:NOTHING
  8460                                  	;mov	[si+6],dx
  8461                                  	;;mov	[si+4],cx
  8462                                  	;;mov	[si+2],bx
  8463                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8464 00000F24 895406                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],DX ; total clusters
  8465                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  8466                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  8467                                  	;;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  8468                                  	;mov	[si],ax
  8469                                  	;;return
  8470                                  	;retn
  8471                                  	; 09/01/2024
  8472 00000F27 E98DFD                  	jmp     gdrvfspc_ret	; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  8473                                  
  8474                                  BADFDRV:
  8475                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  8476                                  	;;mov	al,0Fh
  8477                                  	;mov	al,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error
  8478                                  
  8479                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8480                                  
  8481                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 3.3
  8482                                  	;invoke	FCB_RET_ERR

  8484

  8486 00000F30 EBEF                    	JMP	short DoSt
  8487

  8490                                  ;	BREAK <$Get_DMA, $Set_DMA -- Get/Set current DMA address>
  8491                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8492                                  ;**	$Get_DMA - Get Disk Transfer Address

  8523                                  ;	BREAK <$Get_Default_Drive, $Set_Default_Drive -- Set/Get default drive>

  8552                                  ;BREAK <$Get/Set_Interrupt_Vector - Get/Set interrupt vectors>
  8553                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8554                                  
  8555                                  ;**	$Get_Interrupt_Vector - Get Interrupt Vector
  8556                                  ;---------------------------------------------------
  8557                                  ;	$Get_Interrupt_Vector is the official way for user pgms to get the
  8558                                  ;	contents of an interrupt vector.
  8559                                  ;
  8560                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = interrupt number
  8561                                  ;	EXIT	(ES:BX) = current interrupt vector
  8562                                  
  8563                                  _$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR:

  8565 00000F6A 26C41F                  	LES	BX,[ES:BX]
  8566 00000F6D E807F5                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8567                                  set_user_es_bx:

  8575                                  
  8576                                  ;**	$Set_Interrupt_Vector - Set Interrupt Vector
  8577                                  ;---------------------------------------------------
  8578                                  ;	$Set_Interrupt_Vector is the official way for user pgms to set the
  8579                                  ;	contents of an interrupt vector.
  8580                                  ;
  8581                                  ;	M004, M068: Also set A20OFF_COUNT to 1 if EXECA20OFF bit has been set 
  8582                                  ;	and if A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero. See under tag M003 in inc\dossym.inc 
  8583                                  ;	for explanation.
  8584                                  ;

  8586                                  ;		(ds:dx) = desired new vector value
  8587                                  ;	EXIT	none
  8588                                  ;	USES	all
  8589                                  
  8590                                  ; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8591                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8592                                  
  8593                                  _$SET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR:
  8594 00000F76 E81F00                  	CALL	RECSET
  8595 00000F79 FA                      	CLI				; Watch out!!!!! Folks sometimes use
  8596 00000F7A 268917                  	MOV	[ES:BX],DX		;   this for hardware ints (like timer).
  8597 00000F7D 268C5F02                	MOV	[ES:BX+2],DS
  8598 00000F81 FB                      	STI
  8599                                  					; M004, M068 - Start
  8600                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

  8602                                  					; Q: was the previous call an int 21h
  8603                                  					;    exec call

  8606                                  	;retn				; N: return
  8607                                  	; 15/12/2022

  8609                                  siv_1:	
  8610 00000F8A 36803E[8500]00          	cmp	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0 ; Q: is count 0
  8611 00000F90 7505                    	jnz	short siv_2		 ; N: done 
  8612                                  	; 20/09/2023
  8613 00000F92 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]
  8614                                  	;mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],1 ; Y: set it to 1 to indicate to dos
  8615                                  					 ; dispatcher to turn A20 Off before
  8616                                  					 ; returning to user.
  8617                                  siv_2:
  8618                                  	; 07/12/2022
  8619 00000F97 C3                      	retn				; M004, M068 - End
  8620                                  	
  8621                                  RECSET:

  8623 00000F9A 8EC3                    	MOV	ES,BX
  8624 00000F9C 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL
  8625 00000F9E D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1
  8626 00000FA0 D1E3                    	SHL	BX,1
  8627 00000FA2 C3                      	retn

  8629                                  ;	BREAK <$Char_Oper - hack on paths, switches so that xenix can look like PCDOS>
  8630                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8631                                  
  8632                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8633                                  ;
  8634                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8635                                  ;
  8636                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8637                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8638                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8639                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8640                                  ;			Always returns available
  8641                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8642                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8643                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8644                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8645                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8646                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8647                                  ;
  8648                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8649                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8650                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8651                                  
  8652                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8653                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8654                                  
  8655                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8656                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8657                                  
  8658                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8659                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8660 00000FA3 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8661 00000FA5 B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8662 00000FA7 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8663 00000FA9 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8664 00000FAB B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8665 00000FAD 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8666 00000FAF C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8667                                  
  8668                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8669                                  ; value to return
  8670                                  
  8671                                  chop_1:
  8672 00000FB0 E8C4F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8673 00000FB3 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8674 00000FB6 C3                      	retn
  8675                                  
  8676                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  8677                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
  8678                                  	;push	ss
  8679                                  	;pop	ds
  8680                                  	;cmp	al,1
  8681                                  	;jb	short chop_1
  8682                                  	;jz	short chop_2
  8683                                  	;cmp	al,3

  8702                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8704                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8705                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8706                                  ;
  8707                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8708                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8709                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8710                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8711                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8712                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8713                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8714                                  
  8715                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8716                                  
  8717                                  _$GetExtendedError:
  8718 00000FB7 16                      	push	ss
  8719 00000FB8 1F                      	pop	ds
  8720 00000FB9 A1[2403]                	MOV	AX,[EXTERR]
  8721 00000FBC C43E[2803]              	LES	DI,[EXTERRPT]
  8722 00000FC0 8B1E[2603]              	MOV	BX,[EXTERR_ACTION]	; BL = Action, BH = Class
  8723 00000FC4 8A2E[2303]              	MOV	CH,[EXTERR_LOCUS]
  8724 00000FC8 E8ACF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack

  8764                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>
  8765                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8766                                  ; Inputs:
  8767                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8768                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location

  8771                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)
