  9317                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9318                                  ;
  9319                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9320                                  ;
  9321                                  ;   Modification history:
  9322                                  ;
  9323                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9324                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9325                                  ;
  9326                                  
  9327                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9328                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9329                                  ; Inputs:
  9330                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9331                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9332                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9333                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9334                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9335                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9336                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9337                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9338                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9339                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9340                                  ; Function:
  9341                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9342                                  ; Returns:
  9343                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9344                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9345                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9346                                  
  9347                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9348                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9349                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9350                                  
  9351                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9352 000012D0 E8D747                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9353 000012D3 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9354 000012D4 E8A0F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9355                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9356 000012D7 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9357 000012DA C3                      	retn
  9358                                  
  9359                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9360                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9361                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9362

  9402                                  ;
  9403                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9404                                  ;
  9405                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9406                                  ;
  9407                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9408                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9409                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9410                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9411                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9412                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9413                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9414                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9415                                  ;	USES	all
  9416                                  ;
  9417                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9418                                  ;
  9419                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9420                                  ;
  9421                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9422                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9423                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9424                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9425                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9426                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9427                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9428                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9429                                  ;	USES	all
  9430                                  ;
  9431                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9432                                  ;
  9433                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

  9462 00001309 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9463 0000130A E81A05                  	call    TestNet

  9474                                  	;;;

  9485                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9486                                  	;mov	[si+2],di

 10114                                  setend:
 10115                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10116                                  ;
 10117                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10118                                  	inc	bx
 10119                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10120                                  ;
 10121                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10122                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10123                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10124                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10125                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10126                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10127                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10128                                  ;
 10129                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10130                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10131                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10132                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10133                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10134                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10135                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10136                                  ;
 10137                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10138                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10139                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10140                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10141                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10142                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10143                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10144                                  ;
 10145                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10146                                  
 10147                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10148                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10149                                  ;	  clusters down
 10150                                  
 10151                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10152                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10153                                  
 10154                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10155                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10156                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10157                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10158                                  
 10159                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10160                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10161                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10162                                  
 10163                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10164                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10165                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10166                                  
 10167                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10168                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10169                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10170                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10171                                  	shr	dx,1
 10172                                  
 10173                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10174                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10175                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10176                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10177                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10178                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10179                                  					; number of clusters.
 10180                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10181                                  
 10182                                  	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
 10183                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10184                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10185                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10186                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10187                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10188                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10189                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10190                                  
 10191                                  setend_fat12:
 10192                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10193                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10194                                  
 10195                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10196                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10197                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10198                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10199                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10200                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10201                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10202                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10203                                  
 10204                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10205                                  
 10206                                  setend_fat16:
 10207                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10208                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10209                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10210                                  
 10211                                  setend_faterr:
 10212                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10213                                  
 10214                                  setend_fat:
 10215                                  
 10216                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10217                                  
 10218                                  ;	end M008
 10219                                  
 10220

 10222                                  	MOV	[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],AX

 10228                                  					; begining of FAT

 10710                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10711                                  	; cx = 0
 10712                                  
 10713                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10714                                  ; Inputs:
 10715                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10716                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10717                                  ; Function:
 10718                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10719                                  ;	specified segment.
 10720                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10721                                  ; Outputs:
 10722                                  ;	DS = DX
 10723                                  ;	ES = DX
 10724                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10725                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10726                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10727                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10728                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10729                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10730                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10731                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10732                                  
 10733                                  SETMEM:
 10734                                  	;XOR	CX,CX
 10735                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10736                                  	; cx = 0
 10737 000016C3 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 10738 000016C5 8EC2                    	MOV	ES,DX
 10739                                  	;mov	si,88h
 10740 000016C7 BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate
 10741                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10742 000016CA BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10743                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10744                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10745 000016CD B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10746 000016CF F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10747 000016D1 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10748 000016D5 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10749 000016D7 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10750 000016DA 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10751 000016DC B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10752                                  HAVDIF:
 10753 000016DF 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10754 000016E2 BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10755 000016E5 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10756 000016E7 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10757 000016E9 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10758 000016EB 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10759                                  
 10760                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10761                                  	;
 10762                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10763                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10764                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10765                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10766                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10767                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10768                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10769                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10770                                  	; into the PSP.
 10771                                  	;
 10772                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10773                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10774                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10775                                  	; for all cases.
 10776                                  	;
 10777                                  
 10778                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10779                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10780                                  
 10781 000016ED A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10782 000016F0 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10783                                  
 10784                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10785 000016F4 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10786                                  					;    memory left
 10787 000016F7 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10788                                  					;    OK
 10789                                  					; N: 
 10790                                  
 10791 000016F9 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10792 000016FF C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10793                                  addr_ok:
 10794                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10795 00001705 C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10796                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10797 0000170B C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10798                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10799 00001710 C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10800                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10801 00001716 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10802                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10803 0000171B C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10804                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10805 00001721 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10806                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10807 00001725 C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10808                                  ;
 10809                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10810                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10811                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10812                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10813                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10814                                  ;
 10815                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10816 0000172B C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10817                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10818 00001731 C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10819                                  
 10820                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10821                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10822                                  
 10823                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10824                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10825 00001737 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10826                                  
 10827 0000173E C3                      	retn

 10954                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10955                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10956                                  ;
 10957                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10958                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10959                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10960                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10961                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10963                                  
 10964                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10965                                  
 10966                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10967                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10968                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10969                                  StrCmp:
 10970 0000178D 56                      	push	si
 10971 0000178E 57                      	push	di
 10972 0000178F 50                      	push	ax
 10973                                  Cmplp:
 10974 00001790 AC                      	LODSB
 10975 00001791 E84F44                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10976 00001794 E8A144                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10977 00001797 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10978 00001799 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10979 0000179C 47                      	INC	DI
 10980 0000179D E84344                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10981 000017A0 E89544                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10982 000017A3 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10983 000017A5 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 10984                                  
 10985 000017A7 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10986 000017A9 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 10987                                  PopRet:
 10988 000017AB 58                      	pop	ax
 10989 000017AC 5F                      	pop	di
 10990 000017AD 5E                      	pop	si
 10991 000017AE C3                      	retn
 10992

 10994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10995                                  ;
 10996                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 10997                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 10998                                  ;	characters.
 10999                                  ;
 11000                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 11001                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 11002                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string
 11003                                  ;		DS:SI point byte after nul byte at end of source string
 11004                                  ;   Registers modified: SI,DI
 11005                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11006

 11101                                  ;Break	<Idle - wait for a specified amount of time>
 11102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11103                                  ;
 11104                                  ;   Idle - when retrying an operation due to a lock/sharing violation,
 11105                                  ;   	   we spin until RetryLoop is exhausted.
 11106                                  ;
 11107                                  ;   Inputs:	RetryLoop is the number of times we spin
 11108                                  ;   Outputs:	Wait
 11109                                  ;   Registers modified: none

 11117                                  	;SAVE	<CX>

 11126 000017F7 59                      	POP	CX

 11129                                  	;RESTORE <CX>
 11130 000017FA 59                      	pop	cx

 11133                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11134                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11135                                  ;
 11136                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11137                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11138                                  ;
 11139                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11140                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11141                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11142                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11143                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11144                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11145                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11146                                  
 11147                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11148 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11149 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11150 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11151 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11152 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11153 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11154                                  endstruc
 11155                                  
 11156                                  TableDispatch:
 11157 000017FC 55                      	PUSH	BP
 11158 000017FD 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP
 11159 000017FF 53                      	PUSH	BX			; save BX
 11160                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+6]

 11168 0000180E 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH			; convert to word

 11178 0000181D 5D                      	POP	BP			; restore BP

 11343                                  ;Break	<NLS_OPEN - do $open for NLSFUNC>
 11344                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11345                                  ;   DOS 3.3   6/10/86
 11346                                  ;   NLS_OPEN	- call $OPEN for NLSFUNC
 11347                                  ;
 11348                                  ;   Inputs:	Same input as $OPEN except CL = mode
 11349                                  ;   Outputs:	same output as $OPEN
 11350                                  ;
 11351                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11352                                  
 11353                                  ;hkn; NOTE! SS MUST HAVE BEEN SET UP TO DOSDATA BY THE TIME THESE
 11354                                  ;hkn; NLS FUNCTIONS ARE CALLED!!! THERE FORE WE WILL USE SS OVERRIDES
 11355                                  ;hkn; IN ORDER TO ACCESS DOS DATA VARIABLES!
 11356                                  
 11357                                  NLS_OPEN:
 11358                                  ;	MOV	BL,[CPSWFLAG]	 ; disable code page matching logic
 11359                                  ;	MOV	BYTE [CPSWFLAG],0
 11360                                  ;	PUSH	BX		 ; save current state
 11361                                  
 11362 00001884 88C8                    	MOV	AL,CL		 ; set up correct interface for $OPEN
 11363 00001886 E82B62                  	call	_$OPEN
 11364                                  
 11365                                  ;	POP	BX		 ; restore current state
 11366                                  ;	MOV	[CPSWFLAG],BL
 11367                                  
 11368 00001889 C3                      	RETN
 11369                                  
 11370                                  ;Break	<NLS_LSEEK - do $LSEEK for NLSFUNC>
 11371                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11372                                  ;   DOS 3.3   6/10/86
 11373                                  ;   NLS_LSEEK	- call $LSEEK for NLSFUNC
 11374                                  ;
 11375                                  ;   Inputs:	BP = open mode
 11376                                  ;   Outputs:	same output as $LSEEK
 11377                                  ;
 11378                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11379

 11381                                  
 11382                                  NLS_LSEEK:
 11383 0000188A 36FF36[8405]            	PUSH	word [SS:USER_SP] ; save user stack
 11384 0000188F 36FF36[8605]            	PUSH	word [SS:USER_SS]
 11385 00001894 E81000                  	CALL	Fake_User_Stack
 11386 00001897 89E8                    	MOV	AX,BP		; set up correct interface for $LSEEK
 11387 00001899 E8C55B                  	call	_$LSEEK
 11388 0000189C 368F06[8605]            	POP	word [SS:USER_SS] ; restore user stack
 11389 000018A1 368F06[8405]            	POP	word [SS:USER_SP]
 11390 000018A6 C3                      	RETN

 11402 000018AF 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 11403 000018B1 36A3[8605]              	MOV	[SS:USER_SS],AX
 11404 000018B5 C3                      	RETN
 11405

 11463                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11464                                  
 11465                                  ;Break	<MSG_RETRIEVAL- get beginning addr of system and parser messages>
 11466                                  
 11467                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11468                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11469                                  ;
 11470                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11471                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11472                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11473                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11474                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11475                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11476                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11477                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11478                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11479                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11480                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11481                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11482                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11483                                  
 11484                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11485                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11486                                  
 11487                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11488                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11489                                  
 11490                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11491                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11492                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11493                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11494                                  ;;
 11495                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11496                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11497                                  ;;
 11498                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11499                                  ;;	push	ds
 11500                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11501                                  ;;
 11502                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11503                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11504                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11505                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11506                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11507                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11508                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11509                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 11510                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 11511                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11512                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 11513                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11514                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11515                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11516                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11517                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11518                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;
 11519                                  ;;	LES	DI,DWORD PTR DS:[SI]	     ;AN000;;MS. get msg addr
 11520                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;
 11521                                  ;;	POP	SI			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11522                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11523                                  ;;
 11524                                  ;;	pop	ds
 11525                                  
 11526                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11527                                  
 11528                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11529                                  ;	retn	; 29/04/2019

 11587                                  ;============================================================================
 11588                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11589                                  ;============================================================================
 11590                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11591                                  
 11592                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11593                                  
 11594                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11595                                  
 11596                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11597                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11598                                  
 11599                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11600                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11601                                  ;
 11602                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11603                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11604                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11605                                  
 11606                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11607                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11608                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11609                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11610                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11611                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11612                                  
 11613                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11614                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11615                                  ;	iret
 11616                                  ;	push	cs
 11617                                  ;	call	$-2
 11618                                  ;%endmacro
 11619                                  
 11620                                  ; ---------------------------
 11621                                  
 11622                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11623                                  %if 0
 11624                                  
 11625                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11626                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11627                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11628                                  ECritMEM:
 11629                                  ECritSFT:
 11630                                  ;
 11631                                  ECritDisk:
 11632                                  
 11633                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11634                                  
 11635                                  	pushf
 11636                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11637                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11638                                  
 11639                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11640                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11641                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11642                                  ;
 11643                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11644                                  ;	iret ; *
 11645                                  
 11646                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11647                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11648                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11649                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11650                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11651                                  ;	iret	
 11652                                  
 11653                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11654                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11655                                  	push	cs ; *
 11656                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11657                                  	
 11658                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11659                                  	PUSH    AX
 11660                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11661                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11662                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11663                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11664                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11665                                  	POP     AX
 11666                                  	retn
 11667                                  
 11668                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11669                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11670                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11671                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11672                                  	iret
 11673                                  
 11674                                  ECritDisk_2:
 11675                                  	;;popff ; *
 11676                                  	;;retn
 11677                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_3 ; *
 11678                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2: ; *
 11679                                  ;	iret
 11680                                  	
 11681                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11682                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11683                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_3
 11684                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2:
 11685                                  	;iret
 11686                                  
 11687                                  ECritDisk_3:
 11688                                  	push    cs ; *
 11689                                  	; 13/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11690                                  	;call	ECritDisk_iret2 ; *
 11691                                  	;retn
 11692                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11693                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret
 11694                                  	retn
 11695

 11917 000018F5 B80180                  	mov	ax,8001h	; BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11918                                  				; AL = critical section number (01h)
 11919                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11920                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 11921                                  LCritDisk_1:
 11922                                  ECritDevice_1:
 11923                                  LCritDevice_1:
 11924 000018F8 51                      	push	cx
 11925 000018F9 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 11926 000018FB 368A0E[A110]            	mov	cl,[ss:IsWin386]
 11927 00001900 E305                    	jcxz	ECritDisk2
 11928 00001902 59                      	pop	cx
 11929 00001903 CD2A                    	int	2Ah		; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11930                                  				; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11931 00001905 58                      	pop	ax
 11932 00001906 C3                      	retn
 11933                                  
 11934                                  ECritDisk2:
 11935 00001907 06                      	push	es
 11936                                  	;mov	cx,0
 11937                                  	; 15/01/2024
 11938                                  	; cx = 0
 11939 00001908 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 11940 0000190A 9C                      	pushf			; simulate INT 2Ah
 11941 0000190B 26FF1EA800              	call	far [es:00A8h]	; call far (INT 2Ah vector)
 11942 00001910 07                      	pop	es
 11943 00001911 59                      	pop	cx
 11944 00001912 58                      	pop	ax
 11945 00001913 C3                      	retn
 11946                                  
 11947                                  ECritDisk_3:
 11948                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 11949                                  LCritDisk_3:
 11950                                  ECritDevice_3:
 11951                                  LCritDevice_3:
 11952 00001914 59                      	pop	cx
 11953 00001915 C3                      	retn
 11954                                  
 11955                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11956                                  LCritMEM:
 11957                                  LCritSFT:

 11959                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 11960                                  LCritDisk:
 11961 00001916 51                      	push	cx
 11962 00001917 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 11963 00001919 368A0E[860D]            	mov	cl,[ss:redir_patch]
 11964 0000191E E3F4                    	jcxz	LCritDisk_3
 11965 00001920 59                      	pop	cx
 11966 00001921 50                      	push	ax
 11967 00001922 B80181                  	mov	ax,8101h	; END DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11968                                  				; AL = critical section number (01h)
 11969 00001925 EBD1                    	jmp	short LCritDisk_1
 11970                                  
 11971                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11972                                  
 11973                                  ECritDevice:
 11974 00001927 51                      	push	cx
 11975 00001928 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 11976 0000192A 368A0E[860D]            	mov	cl,[ss:redir_patch]
 11977 0000192F E3E3                    	jcxz	ECritDevice_3
 11978 00001931 59                      	pop	cx
 11979 00001932 50                      	push	ax
 11980 00001933 B80280                  	mov	ax,8002h	; BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11981                                  				; AL = critical section number (02h)
 11982 00001936 EBC0                    	jmp	short ECritDevice_1
 11983                                  
 11984                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11985

 11988 00001939 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 11989 0000193B 368A0E[860D]            	mov	cl,[ss:redir_patch]
 11990 00001940 E3D2                    	jcxz	LCritDevice_3
 11991 00001942 59                      	pop	cx
 11992 00001943 50                      	push	ax
 11993 00001944 B80281                  	mov	ax,8102h	; END DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11994                                  				; AL = critical section number (02h)
 11995 00001947 EBAF                    	jmp	short LCritDevice_1

 12081                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 12082                                  ;
 12083                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 12084                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 12085                                  
 12086                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12087                                  ;
 12088                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12089                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 12090                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 12091                                  ;	$RawConIO
 12092                                  ;	$RawConInput
 12093                                  ;	RAWOUT
 12094                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 12095                                  ;
 12096                                  
 12097                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12098                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12099                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12100                                  
 12101                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12102                                  
 12103                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 12104                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 12105                                  
 12106                                  ;
 12107                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 12108                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 12109                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 12110                                  ;
 12111                                  
 12112                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12113                                  ;
 12114                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 12115                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 12116                                  ;	OUTT
 12117                                  ;	TAB
 12118                                  ;	BUFOUT
 12119                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 12120                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 12121                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 12122                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 12123                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 12124                                  ;
 12125                                  ;	Revision History:
 12126                                  ;
 12127                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 12128                                  
 12129                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12130                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12131                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12132                                  
 12133                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 12134                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 12135                                  
 12136                                  
 12137                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 12138                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 12139                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 12140                                  
 12141                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12142                                  ; 08/11/2022
 12143                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12144                                  
 12145                                  ;
 12146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12147                                  ;
 12148                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12149                                  ;
 12150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12151                                  ;
 12152                                  
 12153                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 12154                                  
 12155                                  ; Inputs:
 12156                                  ;	None
 12157                                  ; Function:
 12158                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 12159                                  ; Returns:
 12160                                  ;	AL = character
 12161                                  
 12162 00001949 1E                      	push	ds
 12163 0000194A 56                      	push	si
 12164                                  INTEST:
 12165 0000194B E8B443                  	call	STATCHK
 12166 0000194E 753B                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12167                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12168                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12169 00001950 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12170 00001956 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12171 00001958 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12172 0000195A E85236                  	call	IOFUNC
 12173                                  no_sys_wait:
 12174                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12175 0000195D B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12176 0000195F CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12177                                  
 12178                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12179                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12180                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12181                                  
 12182                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12183 00001961 36803E[E20D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12184 00001967 751B                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12185                                  
 12186 00001969 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12187 0000196A 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12188 0000196B 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12189 0000196C 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12190                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12191 0000196D 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12192                                  
 12193                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12194                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12195                                  
 12196 0000196E 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12197 0000196F 1F                      	POP	DS
 12198                                  
 12199 00001970 B80000                  	MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12200 00001973 E89402                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12201                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12202 00001976 E813F2                  	call	READTIME
 12203 00001979 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12204 0000197C E88B02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12205                                  
 12206                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12207                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12208                                  ;	push	bx
 12209                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12210                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12211                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12212                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12213                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12214                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12215                                  ;	pop	bx
 12216                                  
 12217 0000197F 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12218 00001980 5A                      	POP	DX
 12219 00001981 59                      	POP	CX
 12220 00001982 5B                      	POP	BX
 12221 00001983 58                      	POP	AX
 12222                                  NoUpdate:
 12223                                  
 12224                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12225 00001984 36FF06[E20D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12226                                  
 12227                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12228 00001989 EBC0                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12229                                  GET:
 12230 0000198B 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12231 0000198D E81F36                  	call	IOFUNC
 12232 00001990 5E                      	POP	SI
 12233 00001991 1F                      	POP	DS
 12234                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12235                                  
 12236                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12237                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12238 00001992 36C606[E10D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12239                                  	;
 12240 00001998 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12241 0000199A 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12242                                  
 12243                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12244                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12245                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12246 0000199C 36FE06[E10D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12247                                  noscan:
 12248 000019A1 C3                      	retn
 12249                                  ;
 12250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12251                                  ;
 12252                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12253                                  ;
 12254                                  ;
 12255                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12256                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12257                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12258                                  ;
 12259                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12260                                  ;
 12261                                  
 12262                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12263                                  
 12264 000019A2 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12265                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12266 000019A4 AC                      	lodsb
 12267 000019A5 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12268 000019A7 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12269                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12270 000019A9 E88702                  	call	OUTT
 12271 000019AC EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12272                                  
 12273                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12274                                  ;
 12275                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12276                                  ;
 12277                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12278                                  ;
 12279                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12280                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12281                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12282                                  ;
 12283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12284                                  
 12285                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12286                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12287                                  
 12288                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12289                                  
 12290                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12291                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12292                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12293 000019AE 16                      	push	ss
 12294 000019AF 07                      	pop	es
 12295                                  
 12296 000019B0 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12297 000019B2 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12298 000019B4 AD                      	lodsw
 12299                                  
 12300                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12301                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12302                                  
 12303 000019B5 08C0                            or	al,al
 12304 000019B7 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12305 000019B9 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12306 000019BB 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12307                                  
 12308                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12309                                  
 12310 000019BD 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12311 000019BF 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12312 000019C1 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12313 000019C4 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12314                                  
 12315                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12316                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12317                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12318                                  ;
 12319                                  
 12320                                  NOEDIT:	
 12321 000019C6 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12322                                  EDITON: 
 12323 000019C8 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12324 000019CA 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12325                                  
 12326                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12327                                  
 12328                                  NEWLIN: 
 12329 000019CB 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12330 000019CF 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12331                                  
 12332 000019D3 56                      	push	si
 12333 000019D4 BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12334 000019D7 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12335 000019DC 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12336 000019DE 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12337 000019E0 E866FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12338 000019E3 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12339 000019E5 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12340                                  
 12341                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12342                                  ;
 12343                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12344                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12345                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12346                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12347                                  
 12348                                  GETCH:
 12349 000019E7 E85FFF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12350                                  GOTCH:
 12351                                  ;
 12352                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12353                                  ; input queue.
 12354                                  ;
 12355 000019EA 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12356 000019EC 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12357                                  
 12358                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12359                                  
 12360                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12361                                  
 12362                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12363                                  
 12364                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12365                                  
 12366 000019EE 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12367 000019F3 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12368                                  
 12369                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12370                                  
 12371 000019F5 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12372                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12373                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12374 000019F7 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12375 000019F9 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12376                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12377                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12378 000019FB 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12379                                  
 12380                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12381                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12382                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12383                                  	;		
 12384                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12385                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12386                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12387                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12388                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12389                                  	;	
 12390                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12391                                  
 12392                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12393                                  	;
 12394                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12395                                  
 12396                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12397                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12398                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12399                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12400                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12401                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12402                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12403                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12404                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12405                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12406                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12407                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12408                                  	
 12409                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12410                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12411                                  
 12412                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12413                                  %if 0
 12414                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12415                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12416                                  ;	cursor
 12417                                  
 12418                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12419                                  
 12420                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12421                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12422                                  
 12423                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12424                                  	NOP
 12425                                  	NOP
 12426                                  
 12427                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12428                                  
 12429                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12430                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 12431                                  
 12432                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 12433                                  	NOP
 12434                                  	NOP
 12435                                  
 12436                                  %endif
 12437                                  
 12438                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12439                                  
 12440 000019FD 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12441 000019FF 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12442                                  
 12443                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12444                                  
 12445 00001A01 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 12446 00001A03 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12447                                  
 12448                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12449                                  
 12450                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 12451                                  	;cmp	al,[ss:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12452                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12453                                  
 12454                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 12455                                  
 12456                                  ;hkn; 	CANCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12457                                  
 12458 00001A05 2E3A06[950A]            	cmp	al,[cs:CANCHAR] ; 1Bh
 12459 00001A0A 7440                    	jz	short KILNEW
 12460                                  	
 12461                                  	;cmp	al,CANCEL ; 1Bh	; Retro DOS v3.0
 12462                                  	;jz	short KILNEW
 12463                                  
 12464                                  ; Otherwise, we save the input character.
 12465                                  
 12466                                  SAVCH:	
 12467 00001A0C 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12468 00001A0E 7317                    	jnb	short BUFFUL		; buffer is full.
 12469 00001A10 AA                              stosb
 12470 00001A11 FEC6                    	inc	dh                      ; increment count in buffer.
 12471 00001A13 E8B102                  	call	BUFOUT			; Print control chars nicely
 12472                                  
 12473 00001A16 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0
 12474 00001A1C 75C9                    	jnz	short GETCH		; insertmode => don't advance template
 12475 00001A1E 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12476 00001A20 73C5                            jnb	short GETCH		; no more characters in template
 12477 00001A22 46                              inc	si                      ; Skip to next char in template
 12478 00001A23 FEC7                            inc	bh                      ; remember position in template
 12479 00001A25 EBC0                            jmp	short GETCH
 12480                                  
 12481                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12482                                  ;BACKSPJ: 
 12483                                  	;jmp	short BACKSP
 12484                                  
 12485                                  BUFFUL: 
 12486 00001A27 B007                    	mov	al, 7			; Bell to signal full buffer
 12487 00001A29 E80702                  	call	OUTT

 12489                                  
 12490                                  ESCAPE: 
 12491                                  	;transfer OEMFunctionKey

 12493                                  
 12494                                  ENDLIN:

 12496 00001A32 E8FE01                  	call	OUTT                    ; Echo it
 12497 00001A35 5F                              pop	di                      ; Get start of user buffer
 12498 00001A36 8875FF                          mov	[di-1], dh		; Tell user how many bytes
 12499 00001A39 FEC6                            inc	dh			; DH is length including CR
 12500                                  
 12501                                  COPYNEW:
 12502                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 2.0, STRIN.ASM)
 12503                                  	;mov	bp, es
 12504                                  	;mov	bx, ds
 12505                                  	;mov	es, bx
 12506                                  	;mov	ds, bp
 12507                                  	;mov	si, INBUF
 12508                                  	;mov	cl, dh
 12509                                  	;rep	movsb
 12510                                  	;retn
 12511                                  
 12512                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0)
 12513                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 3.3, Offset 2061h) 
 12514                                  	;SAVE	<DS,ES>
 12515 00001A3B 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 12516 00001A3C 06                      	PUSH	ES
 12517                                  	;RESTORE <DS,ES>		; XCHG ES,DS
 12518 00001A3D 1F                      	POP	DS
 12519 00001A3E 07                      	POP	ES
 12520                                  
 12521                                  ;;hkn; INBUF is in DOSDATA
 12522 00001A3F BE[FB01]                        MOV     SI,INBUF
 12523 00001A42 88F1                            MOV     CL,DH                   ; set up count
 12524 00001A44 F3A4                            REP     MOVSB                   ; Copy final line to user buffer
 12525                                  OLDBAK_RETN:
 12526 00001A46 C3                              RETN
 12527                                  
 12528                                  ;	Output a CRLF to the user screen and do NOT store it into the buffer
 12529                                  
 12530                                  PHYCRLF:

 12532 00001A4A EB9B                            JMP	short GETCH
 12533                                  
 12534                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)
 12535

 12548                                  %if 0
