 20785                                  ;============================================================================
 20786                                  ; OPEN.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 20787                                  ;============================================================================
 20788                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 20789                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20790                                  
 20791                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_OPEN - Internal OPEN call for MS-DOS
 20792                                  ;	NAME	DOS_OPEN
 20793                                  
 20794                                  ;**	OPEN.ASM - File Open
 20795                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20796                                  ;	Low level routines for openning a file from a file spec.
 20797                                  ;	Also misc routines for sharing errors
 20798                                  ;
 20799                                  ;	DOS_Open
 20800                                  ;	Check_Access_AX
 20801                                  ;	SHARE_ERROR
 20802                                  ;	SET_SFT_MODE
 20803                                  ;	Code_Page_Mismatched_Error		   ; DOS 4.00
 20804                                  ;
 20805                                  ;	Revision history:
 20806                                  ;
 20807                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 20808                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00   Jan. 1988
 20809                                  ;
 20810                                  ;	M034 - The value in save_bx must be pushed on to the stack for
 20811                                  ; 	       remote extended opens and not save_cx.
 20812                                  ;
 20813                                  ;	M035 - if open made from exec then we must set the appropriate bits
 20814                                  ;	       on the stack before calling off to the redir.
 20815                                  ;	M042 - Bit 11 of DOS34_FLAG set indicates that the redir knows how 
 20816                                  ;	       to handle open from exec. In this case set the appropriate bit
 20817                                  ;	       else do not.
 20818                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------	
 20819                                  
 20820                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 20821                                  
 20822                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 20823                                  ;	i_need	THISSFT,DWORD
 20824                                  ;	i_need	THISCDS,DWORD
 20825                                  ;	i_need	CURBUF,DWORD
 20826                                  ;	i_need	CurrentPDB,WORD
 20827                                  ;	i_need	CURR_DIR_END,WORD
 20828                                  ;	I_need	RetryCount,WORD
 20829                                  ;	I_need	Open_Access,BYTE
 20830                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE
 20831                                  ;	i_need	JShare,DWORD
 20832                                  ;	I_need	FastOpenFlg,byte
 20833                                  ;	I_need	EXTOPEN_ON,BYTE 		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20834                                  ;	I_need	ALLOWED,BYTE			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20835                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR,WORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20836                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20837                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_ACTION,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20838                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_CLASS,BYTE		  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20839                                  ;	I_need	CPSWFLAG,BYTE			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20840                                  ;	I_need	EXITHOLD,DWORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20841                                  ;	I_need	THISDPB,DWORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20842                                  ;	I_need	SAVE_CX,WORD			  ;AN000;; DOS 4.00
 20843                                  ;	I_need	SAVE_BX,WORD			  ;M034
 20844                                  ;
 20845                                  ;	I_need	DOS_FLAG,BYTE
 20846                                  ;	I_need	DOS34_FLAG,WORD			  ;M042
 20847                                  
 20848                                  ;Break	<DOS_Open - internal file access>
 20849                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20850                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_Open
 20851                                  ;
 20852                                  ; Inputs:
 20853                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 20854                                  ;		terminated)
 20855                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 20856                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 20857                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 20858                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 20859                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 20860                                  ;	[THISSFT] Points to SFT to fill in if file found
 20861                                  ;		(sf_mode field set so that FCB may be detected)
 20862                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 20863                                  ;	AX is Access and Sharing mode
 20864                                  ;	  High NIBBLE of AL (Sharing Mode)
 20865                                  ;		sharing_compat	   file is opened in compatibility mode
 20866                                  ;		sharing_deny_none  file is opened Multi reader, Multi writer
 20867                                  ;		sharing_deny_read  file is opened Only reader, Multi writer
 20868                                  ;		sharing_deny_write file is opened Multi reader, Only writer
 20869                                  ;		sharing_deny_both  file is opened Only reader, Only writer
 20870                                  ;	  Low NIBBLE of AL (Access Mode)
 20871                                  ;		open_for_read	file is opened for reading
 20872                                  ;		open_for_write	file is opened for writing
 20873                                  ;		open_for_both	file is opened for both reading and writing.
 20874                                  ;
 20875                                  ;	  For FCB SFTs AL should = sharing_compat + open_for_both
 20876                                  ;		(not checked)
 20877                                  ; Function:
 20878                                  ;	Try to open the specified file
 20879                                  ; Outputs:
 20880                                  ;	sf_ref_count is NOT altered
 20881                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 20882                                  ;	    THISSFT filled in.
 20883                                  ;	CARRY SET
 20884                                  ;	    AX is error code
 20885                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 20886                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 20887                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 20888                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 20889                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 20890                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 20891                                  ;		error_invalid_access
 20892                                  ;			Bad sharing mode or bad access mode or bad combination
 20893                                  ;		error_access_denied
 20894                                  ;			Attempt to open read only file for writting, or
 20895                                  ;			open a directory
 20896                                  ;		error_sharing_violation
 20897                                  ;			The sharing mode was correct but not allowed
 20898                                  ;			generates an INT 24 on compatibility mode SFTs
 20899                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 20900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20901                                  
 20902                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20903                                  ; DOSCODE:6A60h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 20904                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 20905                                  ; DOSCODE:6A4Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 20906                                  
 20907                                  ; 01/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 20908                                  ; DOSCODE:71BBh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 20909                                  
 20910                                  DOS_OPEN:

 21072                                  
 21073                                  ; The file is marked READ-ONLY. We verify that the open mode allows access to
 21074                                  ; the read-only file. Unfortunately, with FCB's and net-FCB's we cannot
 21075                                  ; determine at the OPEN time if such access is allowed. Thus, we defer such
 21076                                  ; processing until the actual write operation:
 21077                                  ;
 21078                                  ; If FCB, then we change the mode to be read_only.
 21079                                  ; If net_FCB, then we change the mode to be read_only.
 21080                                  ; If not open for read then error.
 21081

 21094 000032B4 80FA70                  	CMP	DL,SHARING_NET_FCB ; 70h ; is it net FCB?

 21098                                  	;AND	CX,~access_mask	; 0FFF0h ; clear access
 21099                                  	; 16/12/2022
 21100                                  	;and	cl,0F0h ; 18/05/2019
 21101                                  	;;;
 21102                                  	; 01/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21103                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21104                                  	;and	cx,0FFFCh
 21105 000032B9 80E1FC                  	and	cl,0FCh ; ~3 ; ~open_mode_mask ; clear access
 21106                                  	;;;
 21107                                  ;	OR	CX,open_for_read ; 0	; stick in open_for_read
 21108 000032BC 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],CX
 21109 000032BF EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT FillSFT
 21110                                  
 21111                                  ; The SFT is normal. See if the requested access is open_for_read

 21223                                  ; Procedure Name : SHARE_ERROR
 21224                                  ;
 21225                                  ; Called on sharing violations. ES:DI points to SFT. AX has error code
 21226                                  ; If SFT is FCB or compatibility mode gens INT 24 error.
 21227                                  ; Returns carry set AX=error_sharing_violation if user says ignore (can't
 21228                                  ; really ignore). Carry clear if user wants a retry. ES, DI, DS preserved

 21235                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB ; 8000h
 21236 00003309 7509                    	JNZ	short _HARD_ERR

 21254                                  ; Procedure Name : DO_SHARE_CHECK
 21255                                  ;
 21256                                  ; Input: THISDPB, WFP_Start, THISSFT set
 21257                                  ; Functions: check file sharing mode is valid
 21258                                  ; Output: carry set, error
 21259                                  ;	  carry clear, share ok

 21261                                  
 21262                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21263                                  DO_SHARE_CHECK:
 21264 0000331E E8C8E5                  	call	ECritDisk		; enter critical section
 21265                                  OPN_RETRY:
 21266 00003321 8B0E[1A00]              	MOV	CX,[RetryCount]		; Get # tries to do
 21267                                  OpenShareRetry:
 21268 00003325 51                      	push	cx			; Save number left to do
 21269 00003326 E8F34B                  	call	SHARE_CHECK		; Final Check
 21270 00003329 59                      	pop	cx			; CX = # left
 21271 0000332A 730E                    	JNC	short Share_Ok2		; No problem with access
 21272 0000332C E8B3E4                  	call	Idle
 21273 0000332F E2F4                    	LOOP	OpenShareRetry		; One more retry used up
 21274                                  OpenShareFail:
 21275 00003331 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 21276 00003335 E8CCFF                  	call	SHARE_ERROR
 21277 00003338 73E7                    	JNC	short OPN_RETRY		; User wants more retry
 21278                                  Share_Ok2:
 21279                                  	;call	LCritDisk		; leave critical section
 21280                                  	;retn
 21281                                  	; 18/12/2022
 21282 0000333A E9D9E5                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21283                                  
 21284                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21285                                  ; Procedure Name : Check_Access
 21286                                  ;
 21287                                  ; Inputs:
 21288                                  ;	AX is mode
 21289                                  ;	  High NIBBLE of AL (Sharing Mode)
 21290                                  ;		sharing_compat	   file is opened in compatibility mode
 21291                                  ;		sharing_deny_none  file is opened Multi reader, Multi writer
 21292                                  ;		sharing_deny_read  file is opened Only reader, Multi writer
 21293                                  ;		sharing_deny_write file is opened Multi reader, Only writer
 21294                                  ;		sharing_deny_both  file is opened Only reader, Only writer
 21295                                  ;	  Low NIBBLE of AL (Access Mode)
 21296                                  ;		open_for_read	file is opened for reading
 21297                                  ;		open_for_write	file is opened for writing
 21298                                  ;		open_for_both	file is opened for both reading and writing.
 21299                                  ; Function:
 21300                                  ;	Check this access mode for correctness
 21301                                  ; Outputs:
 21302                                  ;	[open_access] = AL input
 21303                                  ;	Carry Clear
 21304                                  ;		Mode is correct
 21305                                  ;		AX unchanged
 21306                                  ;	Carry Set
 21307                                  ;		Mode is bad
 21308                                  ;		AX = error_invalid_access
 21309                                  ; No other registers effected
 21310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21311                                  
 21312                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21313                                  Check_Access_AX:
 21314 0000333D A2[6E05]                	MOV	[OPEN_ACCESS],AL
 21315 00003340 53                      	PUSH	BX
 21316                                  
 21317                                  ;	If sharing, then test for special sharing mode for FCBs
 21318                                  
 21319 00003341 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL
 21320 00003343 80E3F0                  	AND	BL,SHARING_MASK ; 0F0h
 21321                                  
 21322                                  	;CMP	byte [FSHARING],-1
 21323                                  	;JNZ	short CheckShareMode	; not through server call, must be ok
 21324                                  	; 23/01/2024
 21325                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 21326 00003346 803E[7205]00            	cmp	byte [FSHARING],0
 21327 0000334B 7405                    	jz	short CheckShareMode	; not through server call, must be ok
 21328                                  
 21329 0000334D 80FB70                  	CMP	BL,SHARING_NET_FCB ; 70h
 21330 00003350 7405                    	JZ	short CheckAccessMode	; yes, we have an FCB
 21331                                  CheckShareMode:
 21332 00003352 80FB40                  	CMP	BL,40h			; is this a good sharing mode?
 21333 00003355 770D                    	JA	short Make_Bad_Access
 21334                                  CheckAccessMode:
 21335 00003357 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL
 21336                                  	; 23/01/2024
 21337 00003359 80E303                  	and	bl,3 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM	
 21338                                  	;AND	BL,access_mask ; 0Fh
 21339 0000335C 80FB02                  	CMP	BL,2
 21340 0000335F 7703                    	JA	short Make_Bad_Access
 21341 00003361 5B                      	POP	BX
 21342 00003362 F8                      	CLC
 21343 00003363 C3                      	retn
 21344                                  
 21345                                  Make_Bad_Access:
 21346 00003364 B80C00                  	MOV	AX,error_invalid_access ; 0Ch
 21347 00003367 5B                      	POP	BX
 21348 00003368 F9                      	STC
 21349 00003369 C3                      	retn
 21350                                  
 21351                                  ;============================================================================
 21352                                  ; DINFO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21353                                  ;============================================================================
 21354                                  ; 08/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21355                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21356                                  ; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21357                                  
 21358                                  ;**	Low level routine for returning disk drive information from a local
 21359                                  ;	  or NET device
 21360                                  ;
 21361                                  ;	DISK_INFO
 21362                                  ;
 21363                                  ;	  Modification history:
 21364                                  ;
 21365                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21366                                  
 21367                                  ;	Break	<DISK_INFO -- Get Disk Drive Information>
 21368                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21369                                  ; Procedure Name : DISK_INFO
 21370                                  ;
 21371                                  ; Inputs:
 21372                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to the Macro List Structure of interest
 21373                                  ;		(It MAY NOT be NUL, error not detected)
 21374                                  ; Function:
 21375                                  ;	Get Interesting Drive Information
 21376                                  ; Returns:
 21377                                  ;	DX = Number of free allocation units
 21378                                  ;	BX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
 21379                                  ;	CX = Sector size
 21380                                  ;	AL = Sectors per allocation unit
 21381                                  ;	AH = FAT ID BYTE
 21382                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 21383                                  ; Segs except ES preserved, others destroyed
 21384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21385                                  
 21386                                  ;hkn; called from getset.asm and misc.asm. DS has already been set up to
 21387                                  ;hkn; DOSDATA. 
 21388

 21414                                  			; ES:DI -> current directory

 21463 000033A9 16                      	push	ss
 21464 000033AA 1F                      	pop	ds
 21465                                  
 21466                                  ; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21467                                  %if 0
 21468                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 21469                                  	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 21470                                  
 21471                                  ; Examine the current free count. If it indicates that we have an invalid
 21472                                  ; count, do the expensive calculation.
 21473                                  
 21474                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21475                                  	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; get free count
 21476                                  	CMP	DX,-1			; is it valid?
 21477                                  	JZ	short DoScan
 21478                                  
 21479                                  ; Check to see if it is in a reasonable range. If so, trust it and return.
 21480                                  ; Otherwise, we need to blast out an internal error message and then recompute
 21481                                  ; the count.
 21482                                  
 21483                                  	CMP	DX,CX			; is it in a reasonable range?
 21484                                  	JB	short GotVal		; yes, trust it.
 21485                                  DoScan:
 21486                                  	XOR	DX,DX
 21487                                  	DEC	CX
 21488                                  SCANFREE:
 21489                                  	call	UNPACK
 21490                                  	JC	short CRIT_LEAVE
 21491                                  	JNZ	short NOTFREECLUS
 21492                                  	INC	DX			; A free one
 21493                                  NOTFREECLUS:
 21494                                  	INC	BX			; Next cluster
 21495                                  	LOOP	SCANFREE
 21496                                  	DEC	BX			; BX was next cluster. Convert to
 21497                                  ReturnVals:
 21498                                  	DEC	BX			; count
 21499                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 21500                                  	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21501                                  	INC	AL			; Sectors/cluster
 21502                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2]
 21503                                  	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; Bytes/sector
 21504                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Fh],dx
 21505                                  	MOV	[ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],DX
 21506                                  	CLC
 21507                                  CRIT_LEAVE:
 21508                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 21509                                  	;retn
 21510                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21511                                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21512                                  
 21513                                  ; We have correctly computed everything previously. Load up registers for
 21514                                  ; return.
 21515                                  
 21516                                  GotVal: 
 21517                                  	MOV	BX,CX			; get cluster count
 21518                                  	JMP	short ReturnVals
 21519                                  
 21520                                  %else
 21521                                  	; 02/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21522 000033AB 31F6                    	xor	si,si	; 0
 21523 000033AD 89F7                    	mov	di,si	; 0
 21524                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+1Fh]

 21526                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],si
 21527 000033B3 2639760F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],si ; FAT32 (16 bit FAT size = 0) ?
 21528 000033B7 7406                    	jz	short dsk_info_4	; yes
 21529                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 21530 000033B9 268B4E0D                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 21531 000033BD EB18                    	jmp	short dsk_info_5 ; zf=0, si=di=0
 21532                                  
 21533                                  dsk_info_4:
 21534                                  	;mov	di,[es:bp+2Fh]
 21535 000033BF 268B7E2F                	mov	di,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 21536                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 21537 000033C3 268B4E2D                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 21538                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+21h]
 21539 000033C7 268B7621                	mov	si,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW] ; hw of free cluster count
 21540 000033CB 39F2                    	cmp	dx,si			; same (zero) ?
 21541                                  ;dsk_info_5:
 21542 000033CD 7504                    	jnz	short dsk_info_6	; not same (not zero)
 21543 000033CF 42                      	inc	dx
 21544 000033D0 740B                    	jz	short dsk_info_8	; 0FFFFh -> 0 (free count is invalid/initial)
 21545                                  					; free count calculation is needed
 21546 000033D2 4A                      	dec	dx
 21547                                  dsk_info_6:
 21548 000033D3 39FE                    	cmp	si,di			; same hw ?
 21549 000033D5 7502                    	jne	short dsk_info_7	; no
 21550                                  dsk_info_5:	; 02/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 21551 000033D7 39CA                    	cmp	dx,cx			; same lw ?
 21552                                  dsk_info_7:
 21553 000033D9 7268                    	jb	short GotVal		; free cluster count < last cluster number
 21554 000033DB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx	; 0
 21555                                  dsk_info_8:
 21556 000033DD 31F6                    	xor	si,si	; 0
 21557 000033DF 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; last cluster number - 1 = number of clusters
 21558 000033E2 19F7                    	sbb	di,si
 21559                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 21560 000033E4 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1 ; set first access bit 0
 21561                                  					; (Update flag for FSINFO sector)
 21562                                  SCANFREE:
 21563 000033E9 56                      	push	si
 21564 000033EA FF36[F30A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 21565 000033EE 57                      	push	di
 21566 000033EF E8E92C                  	call	UNPACK
 21567 000033F2 5F                      	pop	di
 21568 000033F3 8F06[F30A]              	pop	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 21569 000033F7 5E                      	pop	si
 21570 000033F8 7246                    	jc	short CRIT_LEAVE
 21571 000033FA 7504                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS
 21572 000033FC 42                      	inc	dx			; a free one
 21573 000033FD 7501                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS
 21574 000033FF 46                      	inc	si			; increase hw of free cluster count
 21575                                  
 21576                                  NOTFREECLUS:
 21577 00003400 43                      	inc	bx			; next cluster
 21578 00003401 7504                    	jnz	short NOTFREECLUS2
 21579 00003403 FF06[EF0A]              	inc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]	; increase hw of (next) cluster number
 21580                                  
 21581                                  NOTFREECLUS2:
 21582 00003407 83E901                  	sub	cx,1			; decrease remain cluster count for calculation
 21583 0000340A 83DF00                  	sbb	di,0
 21584 0000340D 75DA                    	jnz	short SCANFREE
 21585 0000340F E302                    	jcxz	NOTFREECLUS3		; calculation completed
 21586 00003411 EBD6                    	jmp	short SCANFREE
 21587                                  
 21588                                  NOTFREECLUS3:
 21589 00003413 8B3E[EF0A]              	mov	di,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 21590 00003417 83EB01                  	sub	bx,1
 21591 0000341A 83DF00                  	sbb	di,0			; di:bx = last cluster number
 21592                                  
 21593                                  ReturnVals:
 21594 0000341D 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21595 0000341F 83EB01                  	sub	bx,1
 21596 00003422 19CF                    	sbb	di,cx			; di:bx = number of clusters
 21597                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 21598 00003424 268A4604                	mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK] ; spc - 1
 21599 00003428 FEC0                    	inc	al			; sectors per cluster
 21600                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Fh],dx		
 21601 0000342A 2689561F                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],dx	; free cluster count,lw
 21602                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx ; 0
 21603 0000342E 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0 ; FAT32 (16 bit FAT size = 0) ?
 21604 00003432 7507                    	jnz	short ReturnVals2	; no
 21605                                  	;mov	[es:bp+21h],si
 21606 00003434 26897621                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],si ; hw of free cluster count
 21607                                  
 21608 00003438 E83800                  	call	update_fat32_fsinfo
 21609                                  
 21610                                  ReturnVals2:
 21611                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2]
 21612 0000343B 268B4E02                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; bytes per sector
 21613 0000343F F8                      	clc
 21614                                  
 21615                                  CRIT_LEAVE:
 21616                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 21617                                  	;retn
 21618 00003440 E9D3E4                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 21619                                  
 21620                                  GotVal:
 21621 00003443 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx
 21622 00003445 EBD6                    	jmp	short ReturnVals
 21623                                  
 21624                                  %endif

 21626                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21627                                  
 21628                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21629                                  
 21630                                  modify_spc:
 21631 00003447 50                      	push	ax			; ax = sectors per cluster
 21632 00003448 52                      	push	dx
 21633 00003449 F7E1                    	mul	cx			; bytes per sector
 21634                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21635 0000344B 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 21636 0000344D 7503                    	jnz	short mspc_1
 21637 0000344F 3D0040                  	cmp	ax,16384		; 16 kilobytes (per cluster)
 21638                                  					; ***
 21639                                  					; actual disk size limit
 21640                                  					; without invalidating cluster counts is
 21641                                  					; 2 GB (512K clusters * 8 sectors per cluster)
 21642                                  					;      (128K clusters * 32 sectors per cluster)
 21643                                  mspc_1:
 21644 00003452 5A                      	pop	dx
 21645 00003453 58                      	pop	ax
 21646 00003454 760E                    	jbe	short mspc_3		; bytes per cluster <= 16 KB
 21647                                                                          ; ***
 21648                                                                          ; bytes per cluster > 16 KB
 21649 00003456 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; 0
 21650 00003458 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh		; (invalidated)
 21651 0000345B 09F6                    	or	si,si			; hw of free cluster count
 21652 0000345D 7404                    	jz	short mspc_2		; si = 0
 21653 0000345F 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; si = 0
 21654 00003461 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx			; dx = bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated)
 21655                                  mspc_2:
 21656 00003463 C3                      	retn
 21657                                  
 21658                                  mspc_3:
 21659 00003464 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			; sectors per clust = sectors per clust * 2
 21660                                  					; (ax <= 32768) -modified spc limit-
 21661 00003466 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; cluster count = cluster count /2
 21662                                  					; di:bx = modified value of total clusters
 21663                                  mspc_4:
 21664 00003468 D1DB                    	rcr	bx,1
 21665 0000346A D1EE                    	shr	si,1			; free clusters = free clusters / 2
 21666 0000346C D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1			; si:dx = modified value of free clusters
 21667

 21669

 21672                                  
 21673                                  modify_cluster_count:
 21674 0000346E 09FF                    	or	di,di			; hw of cluster count
 21675 00003470 75D5                    	jnz	short modify_spc

 21678                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21679                                  
 21680                                  ; write FSINFO sector onto disk
 21681                                  
 21682                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21683                                  ; --------------------------------
 21684                                  ; FAT32 FSInfo Sector Structure
 21685                                  ; --------------------------------
 21686                                  ; ref: Microsoft FAT32 File System Specification (2000)
 21687                                  
 21688                                  struc FSINFO		; Offset ;
 21689 00000000 ????????                .LeadSig:	resb 4	  ; 0		; Value 0x41615252. Lead Signature.
 21690 00000004 <res 1E0h>              .Reserved1:	resb 480  ; 4		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21691 000001E4 ????????                .StrucSig:	resb 4	  ; 484		; Value 0x61417272. Fields Signature.
 21692 000001E8 ????????                .Free_Count:	resb 4	  ; 488		; Last known free cluster count. (*) 
 21693 000001EC ????????                .Nxt_Free:	resb 4	  ; 492		; Start clus for free clus srch. (**)
 21694 000001F0 <res Ch>                .Reserved2:	resb 12	  ; 496		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21695 000001FC ????????                .TrailSig:	resb 4	  ; 508		; Value 0xAA550000. Trail Signature.
 21696                                  .size:
 21697                                  endstruc
 21698                                  
 21699                                  ; (*) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then the free count is unknown
 21700                                  ;     and must be computed.
 21701                                  ; (**) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then free cluster search must be started
 21702                                  ;     from cluster 2.
 21703                                  ; Lead Signature, Fields (Structure) Signature and Trail Signature
 21704                                  ; are used to validate FSInfo sector.
 21705                                  
 21706                                  ; --------------------------------
 21707                                  
 21708                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21709                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7436h
 21710                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7227h)
 21711                                  
 21712                                  update_fat32_fsinfo:
 21713 00003473 51                      	push	cx
 21714 00003474 52                      	push	dx
 21715 00003475 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21716                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+25h]
 21717 00003477 268B5625                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FSINFO_SECTOR]
 21718                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx
 21719 0000347B 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0
 21720                                  				; (16bit FAT size field = 0 for FAT32 fs)
 21721 0000347F 7505                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_1
 21722 00003481 83FAFF                  	cmp	dx,0FFFFh ; -1
 21723 00003484 7508                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_2
 21724                                  
 21725                                  u_fat32_inf_1:
 21726 00003486 5A                      	pop	dx
 21727 00003487 59                      	pop	cx
 21728                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],0F4h
 21729 00003488 26806618F4              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],0F4h ; clear bit 0,1 and 3
 21730                                  					; bit 0 - FSINFO update (dirty) bit
 21731                                  					; bit 1 - BPB_RootClus update bit
 21732                                  					; bit 3 - BPB_ExtFlags update bit
 21733 0000348D C3                      	retn
 21734                                  
 21735                                  u_fat32_inf_2:
 21736 0000348E 50                      	push	ax
 21737 0000348F 53                      	push	bx
 21738 00003490 57                      	push	di
 21739 00003491 56                      	push	si
 21740 00003492 1E                      	push	ds
 21741 00003493 36803E[7900]00          	cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0	; is buffers in HMA?
 21742 00003499 740A                    	jz	short u_fat32_inf_3	; no
 21743 0000349B 36C53E[7A00]            	lds	di,[ss:LoMemBuff]	; read it into scratch buffer
 21744                                  	;sub	di,24
 21745 000034A0 83EF18                  	sub	di,BUFINSIZ		; space for buffer header
 21746                                  					; (buffer header size = 24)
 21747                                  	;clc
 21748 000034A3 EB0E                    	jmp	short u_fat32_inf_4
 21749                                  
 21750                                  u_fat32_inf_3:
 21751 000034A5 06                      	push	es
 21752 000034A6 55                      	push	bp
 21753 000034A7 E8F82F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		; ds:di = first buffer in queue
 21754 000034AA 52                      	push	dx
 21755 000034AB E8D231                  	call	BUFWRITE		; BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk,
 21756                                  					;  if it's dirty.
 21757 000034AE 5A                      	pop	dx
 21758 000034AF 5D                      	pop	bp
 21759 000034B0 07                      	pop	es
 21760                                  ;u_fat32_inf_4:
 21761 000034B1 726A                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21762                                  u_fat32_inf_4:
 21763 000034B3 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21764                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24]
 21765 000034B5 8D5D18                  	lea	bx,[di+BUFINSIZ]	; buffer data address
 21766                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21767 000034B8 36C606[4B03]18          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 21768 000034BE 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21769 000034C3 41                      	inc	cx			; cx = sector count = 1
 21770                                  					; es:bp = DPB
 21771 000034C4 53                      	push	bx			; ds:bx = buffer (data) address
 21772 000034C5 52                      	push	dx			; HIGH_SECTOR:dx = disk sector address
 21773 000034C6 E8300B                  	call	DREAD		 	; read fs info sector
 21774 000034C9 5A                      	pop	dx
 21775 000034CA 5B                      	pop	bx
 21776 000034CB 7250                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21777                                  
 21778                                  	;cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig],5252h	
 21779 000034CD 813F5252                	cmp	word [bx],5252h		; 'RR'
 21780 000034D1 754A                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21781                                  	;cmp	word [bx+2],4161h	; 'aA' ; (NASM syntax)
 21782 000034D3 817F026141              	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig+2],4161h
 21783 000034D8 7543                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21784                                  	
 21785                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E4h],7272h	; 'rr' at offset 484
 21786 000034DA 81BFE4017272            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig],7272h
 21787 000034E0 753B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21788                                  
 21789                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E6h],6141h	; 'Aa' at offset 486
 21790 000034E2 81BFE6014161            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig+2],6141h
 21791 000034E8 7533                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21792                                  
 21793                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1FEh],0AA55h	; boot signature at offset 510
 21794 000034EA 81BFFE0155AA            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.TrailSig+2],0AA55h
 21795 000034F0 752B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21796                                  	
 21797                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21798 000034F2 268B461F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT]
 21799                                  	;mov	[bx+1E8h],ax 
 21800 000034F6 8987E801                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count],ax ; at offset 488
 21801                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+21h]
 21802 000034FA 268B4621                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 21803                                  	;mov	[bx+1EAh],ax
 21804 000034FE 8987EA01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count+2],ax
 21805                                  
 21806                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+39h]
 21807 00003502 268B4639                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 21808                                  	;mov	[bx+1ECh],ax
 21809 00003506 8987EC01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free],ax	; at offset 492
 21810                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+3Bh]
 21811 0000350A 268B463B                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 21812                                  	;mov	[bx+1EEh],ax
 21813 0000350E 8987EE01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free+2],ax
 21814                                  
 21815 00003512 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21816 00003514 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21817 00003519 41                      	inc	cx	; 1
 21818 0000351A E8410B                  	call	DWRITE
 21819                                  
 21820                                  u_fat32_inf_5:
 21821 0000351D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21822 0000351E 5E                      	pop	si
 21823 0000351F 5F                      	pop	di
 21824 00003520 5B                      	pop	bx
 21825 00003521 58                      	pop	ax
 21826 00003522 E961FF                  	jmp	u_fat32_inf_1

 21834                                  ;	NAME	DOS_SEARCH
 21835                                  
 21836                                  ;**	Low level routines for doing local and NET directory searches
 21837                                  ;
 21838                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21839                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 21840                                  ;	RENAME_NEXT
 21841                                  ;
 21842                                  ;	Revision history:
 21843                                  ;
 21844                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21845                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 21846                                  ;	    A001	PTM 3564 -- search for fastopen
 21847                                  
 21848                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21849                                  
 21850                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21851                                  ;
 21852                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21853                                  ;
 21854                                  ; Inputs:
 21855                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21856                                  ;		terminated)
 21857                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21858                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21859                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21860                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21861                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21862                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 21863                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer
 21864                                  ; Function:
 21865                                  ;	Initiate a search for the given file spec
 21866                                  ; Outputs:
 21867                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 21868                                  ;	    The 53 bytes ot DMAADD are filled in as follows:
 21869                                  ;
 21870                                  ;	LOCAL
 21871                                  ;	    Drive Byte (A=1, B=2, ...) High bit clear
 21872                                  ;		NEVER STORE DRIVE BYTE AFTER  found_it
 21873                                  ;	    11 byte search name with Meta chars in it
 21874                                  ;	    Search Attribute Byte, attribute of search
 21875                                  ;	    WORD LastEnt value
 21876                                  ;	    WORD DirStart
 21877                                  ;	    4 byte pad
 21878                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21879                                  ;	NET
 21880                                  ;	    21 bytes First byte has high bit set
 21881                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21882                                  ;
 21883                                  ;	CARRY SET
 21884                                  ;	    AX = error code
 21885                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 21886                                  ;			No match for this file
 21887                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21888                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21889                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21890                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21891                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21892                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21893                                  
 21894                                  ; 24/01/2024
 21895                                  %if 1
 21896                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21897                                  GET_FAST_SEARCH:
 21898                                  	; 22/07/2018
 21899                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21900                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21901 00003525 36800E[1206]04          	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 21902                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 21903                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 21904                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21905                                  	;retn
 21906                                  	; 24/01/2024
 21907                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21908                                  	;jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21909                                  %endif

 22016                                  found_entry:

 22021 0000359A C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]

 22138                                  ;BREAK <DOS_SEARCH_NEXT - scan for subsequent matches>
 22139                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22140                                  ;
 22141                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 22142                                  ;
 22143                                  ; Inputs:
 22144                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer returned by DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 22145                                  ;	    (only first 21 bytes must have valid information)
 22146                                  ; Function:
 22147                                  ;	Look for subsequent matches
 22148                                  ; Outputs:
 22149                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 22150                                  ;	    The 53 bytes at DMAADD are updated for next call
 22151                                  ;		(see DOS_SEARCH_FIRST)
 22152                                  ;	CARRY SET
 22153                                  ;	    AX = error code
 22154                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 22155                                  ;			No more files to find
 22156                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22157                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22158                                  
 22159                                  ;hkn; called from search.asm. DS already set up at this point.
 22160                                  
 22161                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22162                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:75ECh
 22163                                  
 22164                                  DOS_SEARCH_NEXT:
 22165 00003625 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]	; 24/01/2024 (Retro DOS v5-v4)
 22166 00003629 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 22167 0000362C A880                    	TEST	AL,80H			; Test for NET
 22168 0000362E 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_SEARCH_NEXT
 22169                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 22170                                  ;	transfer NET_SEARCH_NEXT
 22171                                  ;ELSE
 22172                                  	;mov	ax,111Ch
 22173 00003630 B81C11                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|28
 22174 00003633 CD2F                    	INT	2FH  ; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - FINDNEXT
 22175                                  		     ; SS = DS = DOS CS, [DTA] = 21-byte findfirst search data
 22176                                  		     ; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22177                                  		     ; CF clear if successful
 22178 00003635 C3                      	retn
 22179                                  ;ENDIF
 22180                                  
 22181                                  LOCAL_SEARCH_NEXT:
 22182                                  	;AL is drive A=1
 22183                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 22184 00003636 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 22185 0000363B E8ABE2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22186                                  
 22187                                  ;hkn; DummyCDS is in DOSDATA
 22188 0000363E C706[A205][F304]        	MOV     word [THISCDS],DUMMYCDS

 22213 00003670 AC                      	LODSB				; Drive Byte
 22214

 22216                                  RENAME_NEXT:
 22217                                  	;context ES
 22218 00003671 16                      	push	ss
 22219 00003672 07                      	pop	es			; THIS BLOWS ES:BP POINTER TO DPB
 22220                                  
 22221                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 22222 00003673 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 22223                                  
 22224 00003676 B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 22225 00003679 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; Search name
 22226 0000367B AC                      	LODSB				; Attribute
 22227

 22229 0000367C 36A2[6B05]              	MOV	[SS:ATTRIB],AL
 22230 00003680 AD                      	LODSW				; LastEnt
 22231 00003681 09C0                    	OR	AX,AX
 22232                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22233                                  	;JNS	short cont_load
 22234 00003683 781D                    	js	short No_files
 22235                                  ;No_files:
 22236                                  	;JMP	find_no_more
 22237                                  
 22238                                  cont_load:
 22239 00003685 50                      	PUSH	AX			; Save LastEnt
 22240 00003686 AD                      	LODSW				; DirStart
 22241 00003687 89C3                    	MOV	BX,AX
 22242                                  
 22243                                  	;;;
 22244                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 22246 00003689 AD                      	lodsw				; DIRSTART_HW
 22247                                  	;;;
 22248

 22250                                  	;context DS
 22251 0000368A 16                      	push	ss
 22252 0000368B 1F                      	pop	ds
 22253 0000368C C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Recover ES:BP
 22254                                  
 22255                                  	;;;
 22256                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 22258

 22262 00003697 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 22263                                  cont_load2:

 22265                                  	;;;
 22266                                  
 22267                                  	;invoke	SetDirSrch

 22270 000036A1 58                      	POP	AX			; Clean stack

 22272                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22273                                  No_files:
 22274 000036A2 E9D5FE                  	JMP	find_no_more

 22284 000036B5 E9EEFE                  	JMP	found_it ; 10/08/2018
