 22287                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_QUESTION
 22290                                  ;
 22291                                  ; Input: [WFP_START]= pointer to final path
 22292                                  ; Function: check '?' char
 22293                                  ; Output: carry clear, if no '?'
 22294                                  ;	 carry set, if '?' exists
 22295                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22296                                  
 22297                                  ; 03/02/2024
 22298                                  %if 0
 22299                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22300                                  CHECK_QUESTION:
 22301                                  ;hkn;	wfp_start is in DOSDATA;hkn;	MOV	WORD PTR ThisCDS+2,CS
 22302                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			;AN000;;FO.
 22303                                  	push	ss
 22304                                  	POP	DS			;AN000;;FO. ds:si -> final path
 22305                                  	; 16/12/2022
 22306                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 22307                                  	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]		;AN000;;FO.
 22308                                  	;mov	si,[ss:WFP_START]
 22309                                  getnext:				;AN000;
 22310                                  	LODSB				;AN000;;FO. get char
 22311                                  	OR	AL,AL			;AN000;;FO. is it null
 22312                                  	JZ	short NO_Question	;AN000;;FO. yes
 22313                                  	CMP	AL,'?'                  ;AN000;;FO. is '?'
 22314                                  	JNZ	short getnext 		;AN000;;FO. no
 22315                                  	STC				;AN000;;FO.
 22316                                  NO_Question:				;AN000;
 22317                                  	retn				;AN000;;FO.
 22318                                  %endif
 22319                                  
 22320                                  ;============================================================================
 22321                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22322                                  ;============================================================================
 22323                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22324                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22325                                  
 22326                                  ;**
 22327                                  ;
 22328                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22329                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22330                                  ;
 22331                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22332                                  ;
 22333                                  ;   Modification history:
 22334                                  ;
 22335                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22336                                  ;
 22337                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22338                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22339                                  ;
 22340                                  
 22341                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22342                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22343                                  ;
 22344                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22345                                  ;
 22346                                  ; Inputs:
 22347                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22348                                  ; Function:
 22349                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22350                                  ; Returns:
 22351                                  ;       None
 22352                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22353                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22354                                  
 22355                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22356                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22357                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22358                                  
 22359                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22360 000036B8 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22361 000036BD 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22362                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22363 000036C2 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22364 000036C4 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22365 000036C5 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22366                                  
 22367 000036C6 E81C3C                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22368 000036C9 59                      	POP     CX
 22369 000036CA E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22370                                  
 22371                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22372                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22373                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22374                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22375                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22376                                  ;
 22377                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22378                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22379                                  ;
 22380                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22381                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22382                                  ; up after this process.
 22383                                  ;
 22384                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22385                                  
 22386                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22387 000036CC 16                      	push	ss
 22388 000036CD 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22389                                  
 22390                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22391 000036CE B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22392 000036D1 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22393                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22394                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22395                                  ;if installed
 22396 000036D3 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22397                                  ;else
 22398                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22399                                  ;endif
 22400                                  
 22401                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22402                                  ; counts.
 22403                                  					; SS override
 22404 000036D7 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22405                                  
 22406                                  	;;;
 22407                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22408                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22409                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22410 000036DC 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22411 000036DE 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22412 000036E0 E31C                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22413 000036E2 57                      	push	di
 22414                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22415                                  	;;;
 22416                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22417 000036E3 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22418 000036E7 E315                    	jcxz    FCBScanDone
 22419                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22420 000036E9 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22421 000036EC 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22422                                  FCBTest:
 22423                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22424 000036F0 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22425 000036F4 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22426                                  
 22427                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22428                                  %if 0
 22429                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22430                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22431                                  %else
 22432                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22433                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22434 000036F6 E83913                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22435                                  %endif
 22436                                  
 22437                                  FCBNext:
 22438 000036F9 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22439 000036FC E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22440                                  FCBScanDone:
 22441                                  
 22442                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22443                                  
 22444 000036FE 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22445                                  Scan:
 22446 00003700 53                      	push    bx
 22447 00003701 E85C3B                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22448 00003704 5B                      	pop     bx
 22449                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22450                                  	;retn
 22451                                  
 22452                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22453                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22454                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22455 00003705 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22456                                  
 22457                                  ;M038
 22458                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22459                                  
 22460                                  Scan1:
 22461                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22462                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22463                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22464 00003707 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22465                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22466                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22467 0000370B 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22468                                  ;
 22469                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22470                                  ;
 22471 0000370D 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22472                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22473 00003711 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22474 00003715 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22475 00003717 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22476                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22477                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22478 0000371B 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22479 0000371F 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22480                                  
 22481                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22482                                  
 22483                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22484                                  %if 0
 22485                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22486                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22487                                  %else
 22488                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22489                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22490 00003721 E80E13                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22491                                  %endif
 22492                                  
 22493                                  scan_next:
 22494 00003724 43                      	inc     bx
 22495 00003725 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22496                                  
 22497                                  ;============================================================================
 22498                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22499                                  ;============================================================================
 22500                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22501                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22502                                  
 22503                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22504                                  ;
 22505                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22506                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22507                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22508                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22509                                  ;
 22510                                  ;	Revision history:
 22511                                  ;
 22512                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22513                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22514                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22515                                  
 22516                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22517                                  
 22518                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22519                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22520                                  ;
 22521                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22522                                  ;
 22523                                  ; Inputs:
 22524                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22525                                  ; Function:
 22526                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22527                                  ; Returns:
 22528                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22529                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22530                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22531                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22532                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22533                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22534                                  
 22535                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22536                                  
 22537                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22538                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22539                                  
 22540                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22541                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22542                                  
 22543                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22544                                  
 22545                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22546                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22547                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22548                                  
 22549                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22550 00003727 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22551                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22552 0000372B 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22553                                  
 22554                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22555                                  
 22556                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22557                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22558                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22559                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22560 0000372F F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22561 00003732 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22562                                  
 22563                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22564 00003734 B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22565 00003737 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22566                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22567                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22568                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22569                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22570                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22571 00003739 C3                      	retn
 22572                                  
 22573                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22574                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22575                                  ;
 22576                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22577                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22578                                  
 22579                                  LocalClose:
 22580 0000373A E8ACE1                  	call	ECritDisk
 22581 0000373D E8C901                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22582 00003740 E84C01                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22583                                  
 22584                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22585                                  	;Context DS
 22586 00003743 16                      	push	ss
 22587 00003744 1F                      	pop	ds
 22588                                  
 22589 00003745 50                      	push	ax
 22590 00003746 53                      	push	bx
 22591 00003747 E8FD47                  	call	ShareEnd
 22592 0000374A 5B                      	pop	bx
 22593 0000374B 58                      	pop	ax
 22594                                  
 22595                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 22596                                  
 22597                                  CloseEntry:
 22598 0000374C 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22599                                  
 22600                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22601                                  
 22602                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22603                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22604 0000374D F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22605                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22606 00003750 7403                    	JZ	short rdir
 22607                                  	; 14/11/2022
 22608 00003752 E90101                  	JMP	FREE_SFT_OK		; either clean or device
 22609                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 22610                                  
 22611                                  ; Retrieve the directory entry for the file
 22612                                  
 22613                                  rdir:
 22614 00003755 E84401                  	CALL	DirFromSFT
 22615                                  	;mov	al,5
 22616 00003758 B005                    	MOV	AL,error_access_denied
 22617                                  	
 22618                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22619                                  	;JNC	short clook
 22620                                  	;; 14/11/2022
 22621                                  	;JMP	CloseFinish		; pretend the close worked.
 22622                                  	;;jc	short CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 22623                                  	
 22624                                  	;;;
 22625                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22626                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22627 0000375A 7240                    	jc	short jmp_to_CloseFinish ; pretend the close worked.
 22628                                  rdir2:
 22629                                  	;test	word [si+2],4
 22630 0000375C F6440204                	test	byte [si+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],4 ; devid_device_null
 22631                                  					; bit 2 - null device
 22632 00003760 751F                    	jnz	short clook
 22633                                  
 22634 00003762 1E                      	push	ds
 22635 00003763 53                      	push	bx
 22636 00003764 C55C07                  	lds	bx,[si+7]
 22637 00003767 C55C07                  	lds	bx,[si+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; pointer to DPB
 22638                                  
 22639 0000376A 8A1F                    	mov	bl,[bx]			; DPB.DRIVE
 22640 0000376C 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh  ; 0
 22641 0000376E 36F687[2F14]04          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],4
 22642                                  					; bit 2 - last access date/time flag?
 22643                                  					; or disk accessed flag !?
 22644 00003774 5B                       	pop	bx
 22645 00003775 7409                    	jz	short skip_upd_laccdt	; no support for last access date&time
 22646 00003777 1F                      	pop	ds
 22647 00003778 1E                      	push	ds
 22648 00003779 E8E6D3                  	call	DATE16
 22649                                  	;mov	[es:di+12h],ax
 22650 0000377C 26894512                	mov	[es:di+dir_entry.dir_lstaccdate],ax
 22651                                  skip_upd_laccdt:
 22652 00003780 1F                      	pop	ds
 22653                                  	;;;
 22654                                  
 22655                                  clook:
 22656                                  
 22657                                  ; ES:DI points to entry
 22658                                  ; DS:SI points to SFT
 22659                                  ; ES:BX points to buffer header
 22660                                  
 22661 00003781 57                      	push	di
 22662 00003782 56                      	push	si
 22663                                  	;lea	si,[si+20h]
 22664 00003783 8D7420                  	LEA	SI,[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_name]
 22665                                  
 22666                                  ; ES:DI point to directory entry
 22667                                  ; DS:SI point to unpacked name
 22668                                  
 22669 00003786 E852E0                  	call	XCHGP
 22670                                  
 22671                                  ; ES:DI point to unpacked name
 22672                                  ; DS:SI point to directory entry
 22673                                  
 22674 00003789 E86F10                  	call	MetaCompare
 22675 0000378C E84CE0                  	call	XCHGP
 22676 0000378F 5E                      	pop	si
 22677 00003790 5F                      	pop	di
 22678 00003791 740C                    	JZ	short CLOSE_GO		; Name OK
 22679                                  Bye:	
 22680 00003793 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 22681 00003795 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 22682 00003796 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:DI points to SFT
 22683 00003797 16                      	PUSH	SS
 22684 00003798 1F                      	POP	DS
 22685 00003799 F9                      	STC
 22686                                  	;mov	al,2
 22687 0000379A B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found
 22688                                  	
 22689                                  jmp_to_CloseFinish: ; 03/02/2024
 22690                                  	;JMP	CloseFinish ; 24/07/2019
 22691                                  	; 03/02/2024

 22693 0000379C E9DF00                  	jmp	CloseFinish2
 22694                                  
 22695                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22696                                  CLOSE_GO:
 22697                                  	; 03/02/2024

 22700

 23086                                  ;**	DOS_Commit - UPdate Directory Entries
 23087                                  ;
 23088                                  ;	ENTRY	same as DOS_CLOSE (??? BUGBUG - update this jgl)

 23101                                  DOS_COMMIT:
 23102                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.
 23103 000038DA C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 23104                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+5]
 23105 000038DE 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 23106                                  	;test	bx,0C0h

 23109                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device ;Clears carry
 23110 000038E5 75F2                    	jnz	short PopDone_retn
 23111                                  	;test	bx,8000h
 23112                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23113                                  	;test	bh,80h
 23114 000038E7 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 23115                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet ; 8000h
 23116 000038EA 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_COMMIT
 23117                                  
 23118                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 23119                                  ;	transfer NET_COMMIT
 23120                                  ;ELSE
 23121                                  	;mov	ax,1107h
 23122 000038EC B80711                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|7
 23123 000038EF CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 23124                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 23125                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 23126                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 23127                                  			; CF clear if successful
 23128                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 23129 000038F1 C3                      	retn
 23130                                  ;ENDIF
 23131                                  
 23132                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 23133                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 23134                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 23135                                  ; the close decrementing.
 23136                                  ;
 23137                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 23138                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 23139                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 23140                                  
 23141                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23142                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23143                                  
 23144                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 23145 000038F2 E8F4DF                  	call	ECritDisk
 23146                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23147 000038F5 E8F1DF                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 23148 000038F8 E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 23149 000038FB B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 23150 000038FE E84BFE                  	call	CloseEntry
 23151                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23152 00003901 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 23153 00003902 E8FB17                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 23154 00003905 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 23155                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 23156                                  	; 18/12/2022
 23157 00003906 E90DE0                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 23158                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 23159                                  ;	retn

 23161                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 23162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23163                                  ;
 23164                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 23165                                  ;
 23166                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 23167                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 23168                                  ;
 23169                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 23170                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 23171                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 23172                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 23173                                  ;
 23174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23175                                  
 23176                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 23177                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM 
 23178                                  
 23179                                  SetSFTTimes:
 23180                                  
 23181                                  ; 04/02/2024
 23182                                  %if 0
 23183                                  ;	File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 23184                                  	
 23185                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 23186                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23187                                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23188                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23189                                  	;retnz				; clean or device => no timestamp
 23190                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23191                                  
 23192                                  ;	file and dirty. See if date is good
 23193                                  
 23194                                  	;test	bx,4000h
 23195                                  	; 17/12/2022
 23196                                  	;test	bh,40h
 23197                                  	test	bh,(sf_close_nodate>>8)
 23198                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_close_nodate
 23199                                  	;retnz				; nodate => no timestamp
 23200                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23201                                  %else
 23202                                  	; 04/02/2024
 23203                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23204                                  	;test	bx,40C0h
 23205 00003909 F7C3C040                	test	bx,sf_close_nodate+devid_file_clean+devid_device
 23206 0000390D 75E2                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23207                                  %endif
 23208                                  
 23209 0000390F 50                      	push	ax
 23210 00003910 53                      	push	bx
 23211 00003911 E84ED2                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 23212                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 23213 00003914 2689450F                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 23214                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],dx
 23215 00003918 2689550D                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time],DX
 23216 0000391C 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23217                                  ;if installed
 23218                                  	;call	JShare + 14 * 4
 23219 0000391E FF1E[C800]              	call	far [JShare+(14*4)]	; 14 = ShSU
 23220                                  ;else
 23221                                  ;	call	ShSU
 23222                                  ;endif
 23223 00003922 5B                      	pop	bx
 23224 00003923 58                      	pop	ax
 23225 00003924 C3                      	retn

 23235                                  ;TITLE DIRCALL - Directory manipulation internal calls
 23236                                  ;NAME  DIRCALL
 23237                                  
 23238                                  ;**	Low level directory manipulation routines for making removing and
 23239                                  ;	  verifying local or NET directories
 23240                                  ;
 23241                                  ;	DOS_MKDIR
 23242                                  ;	DOS_CHDIR

 23244                                  ;
 23245                                  ;	Modification history:
 23246                                  ;
 23247                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 23248                                  
 23249                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23250                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23251                                  ;
 23252                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23253                                  ;
 23254                                  ; Inputs:
 23255                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23256                                  ;		terminated)
 23257                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23258                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23259                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23260                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23261                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23262                                  ; Function:
 23263                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23264                                  ; Returns:
 23265                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23266                                  ;		No error
 23267                                  ;	Carry Set
 23268                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23269                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23270                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23271                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23272                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23273                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23274                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23275                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23276                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23277                                  
 23278                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23279                                  
 23280                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23281                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23282                                  
 23283                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23284                                  ; DOSCODE:78FFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 23285

 23532                                  ;BREAK <DOS_ChDir -- Verify a directory>
 23533                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23534                                  ;
 23535                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 23536                                  ;
 23537                                  ; Inputs:
 23538                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23539                                  ;		terminated)
 23540                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23541                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23542                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23543                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used May not be NUL

 23545                                  ;	Validate the path for potential new current directory
 23546                                  ; Returns:
 23547                                  ;	NOTE:
 23548                                  ;	    [SATTRIB] is modified by this call
 23549                                  ;	Carry Clear

 23551                                  ;		Caller must NOT set ID fields on a NET CDS.
 23552                                  ;	Carry Set
 23553                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23554                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23555                                  ;			Bad path
 23556                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23557                                  ;			device or file name
 23558                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed

 23893                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 23894                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 23895                                  
 23896                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 23897                                  ;
 23898                                  ;	SWAPCON
 23899                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 23900                                  ;	DOS_READ
 23901                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 23902                                  ;	get_io_sft
 23903                                  ;	DirRead
 23904                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23905                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 23906                                  ;	FATSecRd
 23907                                  ;	DREAD
 23908                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 23909                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 23910                                  ;
 23911                                  ;	Revision history:
 23912                                  ;
 23913                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 23914                                  ;
 23915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23916                                  ;
 23917                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 23918                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 23919                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 23920                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 23921                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 23922                                  ;
 23923                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23924                                  ;
 23925                                  
 23926                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 23927                                  
 23928                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 23929                                  
 23930                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 23931                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23932                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 23933                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 23934                                  ;
 23935                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 23936                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 23937                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23938                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23939                                  
 23940                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 23941                                  
 23942                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23943                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23944                                  
 23945                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23946                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23947                                  
 23948                                  SWAPBACK:
 23949 00003B67 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 23950 00003B6C C3                      	retn
 23951                                  
 23952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23953                                  ;
 23954                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 23955                                  ;
 23956                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 23957                                  ;
 23958                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 23959                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 23960                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 23961                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23962                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23963                                  
 23964                                  SWAPCON:
 23965                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23966                                  	;push	es
 23967                                  	;push	di
 23968                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 23969                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 23970                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 23971                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 23972                                  	;pop	di
 23973                                  	;pop	es
 23974                                  	;retn
 23975                                  
 23976                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23977 00003B6D C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 23978 00003B72 50                      	push	ax
 23979 00003B73 A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 23980 00003B76 A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 23981 00003B79 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 23982 00003B7C A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 23983 00003B7F 58                      	pop	ax
 23984 00003B80 C3                      	retn
 23985                                  
 23986                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23987                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23988                                  
 23989                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 23990                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23991                                  ;
 23992                                  ; Inputs:
 23993                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 23994                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 23995                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 23996                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23997                                  ; Function:
 23998                                  ;	Perform read operation
 23999                                  ; Outputs:
 24000                                  ;    Carry clear
 24001                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24002                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 24003                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24004                                  ;    Carry set
 24005                                  ;	AX is error code
 24006                                  ;	CX = 0
 24007                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24008                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24009                                  ;
 24010                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24011                                  
 24012                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 24013                                  
 24014                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24015                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24016                                  
 24017                                  ; 07/02/2024
 24018                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24019                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7B76h
 24020                                  
 24021                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7997h)
 24022                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:71FDh)
 24023                                  
 24024                                  DOS_READ:
 24025 00003B81 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24026                                  
 24027                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 24028                                  
 24029                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+2]
 24030 00003B85 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24031                                  	;;and	al,0Fh	; (MSDOS 5.0 & 6.22)
 24032                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask
 24033                                  	; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24034                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 & Win Me)
 24035 00003B89 2403                    	and	al,3	; open_mode_mask ?
 24036                                  
 24037                                  	;cmp	al,1
 24038 00003B8B 3C01                    	CMP	AL,open_for_write
 24039 00003B8D 7503                    	JNE	short READ_NO_MODE	; Is read or both
 24040 00003B8F E96506                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24041                                  
 24042                                  READ_NO_MODE:
 24043 00003B92 E82505                  	call	SETUP
 24044 00003B95 E30B                    	JCXZ	NoIORet 		; no bytes to read - fast return
 24045 00003B97 E8A6DC                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24046 00003B9A 7408                    	JZ	short LOCAL_READ
 24047                                  
 24048                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24049                                  ;	transfer NET_READ
 24050                                  ;ELSE
 24051                                  	;mov	ax,1108h
 24052 00003B9C B80811                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|8
 24053 00003B9F CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - READ FROM REMOTE FILE
 24054                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24055                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24056                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24057                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read
 24058 00003BA1 C3                      	retn
 24059                                  ;ENDIF
 24060                                  
 24061                                  ; The user ended up requesting 0 bytes of input. We do nothing for this case
 24062                                  ; except return immediately.
 24063                                  
 24064                                  NoIORet:
 24065 00003BA2 F8                      	CLC
 24066 00003BA3 C3                      	retn
 24067                                  
 24068                                  LOCAL_READ:
 24069                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 24070                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device  ; Check for named device I/O
 24071 00003BA4 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; 02/06/2019
 24072 00003BA9 750E                    	JNZ	short READDEV
 24073                                  
 24074                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 24075 00003BAB C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk

 24077 00003BB3 E8F805                  	call	DISKREAD
 24078                                  
 24079                                  critexit:
 24080                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 24081                                  	;retn
 24082                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24083 00003BB6 E95DDD                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 24084                                  
 24085                                  ; We are reading from a device. Examine the status of the device to see if we
 24086                                  ; can short-circuit the I/O. If the device in the EOF state or if it is the
 24087                                  ; null device, we can safely indicate no transfer.
 24088                                  
 24089                                  READDEV:
 24090                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],4
 24091 00003BB9 C606[2303]04            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev
 24092                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+5]
 24093 00003BBE 268A5D05                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 24094 00003BC2 C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 24095                                  	;test	bl,40h
 24096 00003BC6 F6C340                  	test	BL,devid_device_EOF	; End of file?
 24097 00003BC9 7407                    	JZ	short ENDRDDEVJ3
 24098                                  	;test	bl,4
 24099 00003BCB F6C304                  	test	BL,devid_device_null	; NUL device?
 24100 00003BCE 7405                    	JZ	short TESTRAW 		; NO
 24101 00003BD0 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; Indicate EOF by setting zero
 24102                                  ENDRDDEVJ3:
 24103                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility!)
 24104                                  	;JMP	short ENDRDDEVJ2
 24105                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24106 00003BD2 E93F01                  	jmp	ENDRDDEV ; 04/05/2019
 24107                                  
 24108                                  ; We need to hit the device. Figure out if we do a raw read or we do the
 24109                                  ; bizarre std_con_string_input.
 24110                                  
 24111                                  TESTRAW:
 24112                                  	;test	bl,20h
 24113 00003BD5 F6C320                  	test	BL,devid_device_raw	; Raw mode?
 24114 00003BD8 7508                    	JNZ	short DVRDRAW 		; Yes, let the device do all local editing
 24115                                  	;test	bl,1
 24116 00003BDA F6C301                  	test	BL,devid_device_con_in	; Is it console device?
 24117 00003BDD 7458                    	JZ	short NOTRDCON
 24118 00003BDF E96701                  	JMP	READCON
 24119                                  
 24120                                  DVRDRAW:
 24121 00003BE2 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24122 00003BE3 1F                      	POP	DS			; Xaddr to DS:DI
 24123                                  
 24124                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24125                                  
 24126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24127                                  ;SR;
 24128                                  ;Check for win386 presence -- if present, do polled read of characters
 24129                                  
 24130 00003BE4 36F606[A110]01          	test	byte [ss:IsWin386],1 ; 19/05/2019
 24131 00003BEA 7408                    	jz	short ReadRawRetry	;not present
 24132 00003BEC F6C301                  	test	bl,devid_device_con_in	;is it console device?
 24133 00003BEF 7403                    	jz	short ReadRawRetry	;no, do normal read
 24134 00003BF1 E9A800                  	jmp	do_polling		;yes, do win386 polling loop
 24135                                  
 24136                                  ReadRawRetry:
 24137                                  
 24138                                  ; 07/02/2024
 24139                                  %if 0
 24140                                  	MOV	BX,DI			; DS:BX transfer addr
 24141                                  	; 06/02/2024 ; *
 24142                                  	;XOR	AX,AX			; Media Byte, unit = 0
 24143                                  	;;MOV	DX,AX			; Start at 0
 24144                                  	;; 06/02/2024
 24145                                  	;cwd
 24146                                  	;call	SETREAD
 24147                                  	; 06/02/2024 ; *
 24148                                  	call	SETREAD_X
 24149                                  %else
 24150 00003BF4 E80316                  	call	SETREAD_XJ
 24151                                  %endif
 24152                                  
 24153 00003BF7 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save Seg part of Xaddr
 24154                                  
 24155                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24156 00003BF8 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]
 24157 00003BFD E88115                  	call	DEVIOCALL
 24158 00003C00 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; DS:DX is preserved by INT 24
 24159 00003C02 B486                    	MOV	AH,86H			; Read error
 24160                                  
 24161                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24162 00003C04 368B3E[5D03]            	MOV	DI,[SS:DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 24163                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 24164                                  	;test	di,8000h
 24165                                  	;jz	short CRDROK
 24166                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24167 00003C09 09FF                    	or	di,di
 24168 00003C0B 7920                    	jns	short CRDROK		; no errors
 24169                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 24170 00003C0D E86022                  	call	CHARHARD
 24171                                  
 24172                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retrro DOS v5.0
 24173                                  %if 0
 24174                                  	MOV	DI,DX			; DS:DI is Xaddr
 24175                                  	; 04/05/2019
 24176                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24177                                  	add	di,[ss:CALLSCNT]	; update ptr and count to reflect the	M065
 24178                                  	sub	cx,[ss:CALLSCNT]	; number of chars xferred		M065
 24179                                  %else
 24180 00003C10 368B3E[6C03]            	mov	di,[ss:CALLSCNT]
 24181 00003C15 29F9                    	sub	cx,di			; update transfer count
 24182 00003C17 01D7                    	add	di,dx			; update pointer
 24183                                  %endif
 24184                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 24185 00003C19 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24186 00003C1B 7410                    	JZ	short CRDROK		; Ignore
 24187 00003C1D 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 24188 00003C1F 7403                    	JZ	short CRDFERR 		; fail.
 24189 00003C21 1F                      	POP	DS			; Recover saved seg part of Xaddr
 24190 00003C22 EBD0                    	JMP	short ReadRawRetry	; Retry
 24191                                  
 24192                                  ; We have encountered a device-driver error. We have informed the user of it
 24193                                  ; and he has said for us to fail the system call.
 24194                                  
 24195                                  CRDFERR:
 24196 00003C24 5F                      	POP	DI			; Clean stack
 24197                                  DEVIOFERR:
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24200 00003C25 36C43E[9E05]            	LES	DI,[SS:THISSFT]
 24201 00003C2A E9C805                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 24202                                  
 24203                                  CRDROK:
 24204 00003C2D 5F                      	POP	DI			; Chuck saved seg of Xaddr
 24205 00003C2E 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 24206                                  
 24207                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24208 00003C30 36033E[6C03]            	ADD	DI,[ss:CALLSCNT]	; Amount transferred
 24209                                  	;JMP	SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 24210                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24211 00003C35 EB63                    	jmp	short ENDRDDEVJ2
 24212                                  
 24213                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 24214                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line
 24215                                  ; CR line CR line CR, or is it file data, line CR LF line CR LF? Does it have
 24216                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 24217                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 24218                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode
 24219                                  ; reading one line at a time. With file data, however, the lines will look

 24322                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 24359                                  	;test	word [es:bx+SRHEAD.REQSTAT],STERR ;check if error

 24361

 24364                                  
 24365                                  invoke_charhard:	; 07/02/2024
 24366                                  	;invoke charhard		;invoke int 24h handler

 24370 00003CBF 744D                    	jz	short pop_done_read	;ignore by user, assume read done

 24384                                  ;are read in or no character is available
 24385

 24401                                  ; 07/02/2024

 24403                                  	;invoke	charhard		;invoke int 24h handler

 24407                                  	jz	short pop_done_read	;ignore by user,assume read is done

 24412                                  %endif

 24414                                  next_char:

 24442                                  pop_done_read:

 24453                                  ENDRDDEV:

 24461                                  TRANBUF:

 24552                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24553                                  
 24554                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24555                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24556                                  ;
 24557                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24558                                  ;
 24559                                  ; Inputs:
 24560                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24561                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24562                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24563                                  ; Function:
 24564                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24565                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24566                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24567                                  ; Outputs:
 24568                                  ;    Carry clear
 24569                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24570                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24571                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24572                                  ;    Carry set
 24573                                  ;	AX is error code
 24574                                  ;	CX = 0
 24575                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24576                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24577                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24578                                  
 24579                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio2.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is set up at this 
 24580                                  ;hkn; point to DOSDATA.
 24581                                  
 24582                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24583                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24584                                  
 24585                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24586                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24587                                  
 24588                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24589                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24590                                  
 24591                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24592 00003D82 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24593                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 24594 00003D86 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24595                                  	;;and	al,0Fh
 24596                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask
 24597                                  	; 07/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24598                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 & Win Me)
 24599 00003D8A 2403                    	and	al,3	; open_mode_mask ?
 24600                                  	;cmp	al,0
 24601 00003D8C 3C00                    	CMP	AL,open_for_read
 24602 00003D8E 7503                    	JNE	short Check_FCB_RO		 ;Is write or both
 24603                                  BadMode:
 24604 00003D90 E96404                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24605                                  
 24606                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 24607                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 24608                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24609                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24610                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24611                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24612                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24613                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24614                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 24615                                  
 24616                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 24617                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 24618                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 24619                                  	;JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24620                                  	
 24621                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],80h
 24622 00003D93 26F6450380              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(sf_isFCB>>8)
 24623 00003D98 7407                    	JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24624                                  
 24625                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],1
 24626 00003D9A 26F6450401              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_read_only
 24627 00003D9F 75EF                    	JNZ	short BadMode 		; Can't write to Read_Only files via FCB
 24628                                  WRITE_NO_MODE:
 24629 00003DA1 E81603                  	call	SETUP
 24630 00003DA4 E899DA                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24631 00003DA7 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_WRITE
 24632                                  
 24633                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24634                                  ;	transfer NET_WRITE
 24635                                  ;ELSE
 24636                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 24637 00003DA9 B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 24638 00003DAC CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 24639                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24640                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24641                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24642                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 24643 00003DAE C3                      	retn
 24644                                  ;ENDIF
 24645                                  
 24646                                  LOCAL_WRITE:
 24647                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 24648                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device
 24649                                  	;jnz	short WRTDEV
 24650                                  
 24651                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],80h
 24652 00003DAF 26F6450580              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; Check for named device I/O
 24653 00003DB4 756D                    	jnz	short WRTDEV
 24654                                  
 24655                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 24656 00003DB6 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 24657 00003DBB E82BDB                  	call	ECritDisk
 24658                                  
 24659 00003DBE E8A905                  	call	DISKWRITE
 24660                                  
 24661                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24662                                  
 24663                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24664                                  ; Extended Open
 24665 00003DC1 7210                    	JC	short nocommit
 24666                                  	
 24667 00003DC3 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24668                                  	
 24669                                  	;;test	word [ES:DI+2],4000h
 24670                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],AUTO_COMMIT_WRITE
 24671                                  	;JZ	short nocommit
 24672                                  	
 24673                                  	;test	byte [ES:DI+3],40h
 24674 00003DC7 26F6450340              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(AUTO_COMMIT_WRITE>>8)
 24675 00003DCC 7405                    	JZ	short nocommit
 24676                                  	
 24677 00003DCE 51                      	PUSH	CX
 24678 00003DCF E808FB                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 24679 00003DD2 59                      	POP	CX
 24680                                  nocommit:
 24681                                  ; Extended Open
 24682                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 24683                                  	;retn
 24684                                  	; 18/12/2022
 24685 00003DD3 E940DB                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 24686                                  
 24687                                  DVWRTRAW:
 24688 00003DD6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; Media Byte, unit = 0
 24689 00003DD8 E86014                  	call	SETWRITE
 24690 00003DDB 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save seg of transfer
 24691

 24885                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24886                                  ;
 24887                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 24888                                  ;
 24889                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 24890                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 24891                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 24892                                  ;
 24893                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24894                                  
 24895                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24896                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24897                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24898                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24899                                  
 24900                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 24901                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 24902 00003ED4 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 24903 00003EDA 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 24904                                  GetNormal:
 24905 00003EDC 16                      	push	ss
 24906 00003EDD 1F                      	pop	ds
 24907 00003EDE 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24908 00003EDF 57                      	PUSH	DI
 24909 00003EE0 E86733                  	call	SFFromHandle
 24910 00003EE3 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 24911 00003EE5 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 24912 00003EE7 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 24913 00003EE9 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24914                                  RET44P:
 24915 00003EEB 5F                      	POP	DI
 24916 00003EEC 07                      	POP	ES
 24917 00003EED C3                      	retn
 24918                                  GetRedir:
 24919 00003EEE 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1
 24920 00003EF1 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 24921 00003EF3 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 24922 00003EF8 F8                      	CLC
 24923                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 24924 00003EF9 C3                      	retn
