 27923                                  					; point to first cluster field
 27924                                  	;test	ch,8
 27925 000047D2 F6C508                  	TEST	CH,attr_volume_id	; Volume ID file?
 27926 000047D5 7409                    	JZ	short check_one_volume_id ; Nope check other attributes
 27927                                  	;test	ah,8
 27928 000047D7 F6C408                  	TEST	AH,attr_volume_id	; Can we find Volume ID?
 27929                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Nope, (not even $FCB_CREATE)
 27930                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27931 000047DA 74C1                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 27932                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27933                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 27934 000047DC 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Set zero flag for $FCB_CREATE
 27935 000047DE EB11                    	JMP	SHORT RETFF		; Found Volume ID
 27936                                  check_one_volume_id:
 27937                                  	;CMP	ah,8
 27938 000047E0 80FC08                  	CMP	AH,attr_volume_id	; Looking only for Volume ID?
 27939                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Yes, continue search
 27940                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27941 000047E3 74B8                    	je	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 27942                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 27943 000047E5 E8F204                  	CALL	MatchAttributes
 27944 000047E8 7407                    	JZ	SHORT RETFF
 27945 000047EA F606[7E05]FF            	TEST	BYTE [CREATING],-1	; Pass back mismatch if creating

 27949                                  RETFF:

 27951                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 27955                                  ;SETESRET:
 27956                                  	;PUSH	SS
 27957                                  	;POP	ES
 27958                                  	;retn
 27959                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27960 000047F9 EBAB                    	jmp	short SETESRET
 27961                                  
 27962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27963                                  ;
 27964                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 27965                                  ;
 27966                                  ; Inputs:
 27967                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 27968                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 27969                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 27970                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 27971                                  ; Function:
 27972                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 27973                                  ; Outputs:
 27974                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 27975                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 27976                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27977                                  
 27978                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27979                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27980                                  
 27981                                  MetaCompare:
 27982 000047FB B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 27983                                  WILDCRD:
 27984 000047FE F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 27985 00004800 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 27986                                  CHECK_META:
 27987 00004802 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 27988 00004807 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 27989                                  MetaRet:
 27990 00004809 C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match
 27991                                  
 27992                                  ;Break	<NEXTENTRY -- STEP THROUGH DIRECTORY>
 27993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27994                                  ;
 27995                                  ; Procedure Name : NEXTENTRY
 27996                                  ;
 27997                                  ; Inputs:
 27998                                  ;	Same as outputs of GETENTRY, above
 27999                                  ; Function:
 28000                                  ;	Update BX, and [LASTENT] for next directory entry.
 28001                                  ;	Carry set if no more.

 28004                                  NEXTENTRY:
 28005                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28006                                  	; DOSCODE:7D4Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 28007                                  
 28008                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28009                                  	; DOSCODE:7D88h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28010                                  
 28011                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28012                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 4671h 
 28013                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 28014                                  
 28015 0000480A A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28016 0000480D 3B06[DA05]              	CMP	AX,[ENTLAST]
 28017 00004811 7422                    	JZ	short NONE

 28019                                  	;ADD	BX,32
 28020 00004814 8D5F20                  	LEA	BX,[BX+32]

 28022                                  	; 21/11/2022 - MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS (DOSCODE:7D5Dh)
 28023                                  	;JB	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.0 src (dir.asm)
 28024                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28025 00004819 751C                    	jne	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:7D97h)
 28026 0000481B 8A1E[7305]              	MOV	BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 28027 0000481F FEC3                    	INC	BL
 28028 00004821 3A1E[7705]              	CMP	BL,[CLUSFAC]
 28029 00004825 7215                    	JB	short SAMECLUS
 28030 00004827 8B1E[DC05]              	MOV	BX,[NXTCLUSNUM]
 28031 0000482B E89618                  	call	IsEOF
 28032 0000482E 7305                    	JAE	short NONE
 28033                                  	; 23/07/2019

 28035                                  	;JB	short NONE
 28036                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 28037                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28038 00004833 732D                    	jnb	short GETENT
 28039                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28040                                  	;JB	short NONE
 28041                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 28042                                  NONE:
 28043 00004835 F9                      	STC
 28044 00004836 C3                      	retn
 28045                                  HAVIT:

 28047 0000483A F8                      	CLC
 28048                                  nextentry_retn:
 28049 0000483B C3                      	retn
 28050                                  SAMECLUS:

 28052 00004840 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28053 00004843 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 28054 00004844 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 28055                                  	; 19/05/2019
 28056                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28057                                  	;;mov	dx,[di+8]
 28058                                  	; 23/09/2023
 28059                                  	;MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000; >32mb
 28060                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28061                                  	;MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX 		;AN000; >32mb
 28062                                  	; 23/09/2023
 28063 00004848 8B7508                  	mov	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	
 28064                                  	
 28065                                  	;mov	dx,[di+6]
 28066 0000484B 8B5506                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000; >32mb
 28067                                  	;inc	dx ; MSDOS 3.3
 28068                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28069                                  	;ADD	DX,1				;AN000; >32mb
 28070                                  	;ADC	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;AN000; >32mb
 28071                                  	; 23/09/2023
 28072 0000484E 42                      	inc	dx
 28073 0000484F 7501                    	jnz	short nextexntry_fc
 28074 00004851 46                      	inc	si
 28075                                  	;inc	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR]
 28076                                  nextexntry_fc:
 28077                                  	; 23/09/2023
 28078 00004852 368936[0706]            	mov	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],si
 28079                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 28080 00004857 1F                      	POP	DS
 28081 00004858 E829F7                  	call	FIRSTCLUSTER
 28082 0000485B 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 28083 0000485D EB23                    	JMP	short SETENTRY
 28084                                  
 28085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28086                                  ;
 28087                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 28088                                  ;
 28089                                  ; Inputs:
 28090                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 28091                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 28092                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 28093                                  ; Function:
 28094                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 28095                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 28096                                  ; Outputs:
 28097                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 28098                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 28099                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 28100                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 28101                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28103                                  
 28104                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28105                                  GETENTRY:
 28106                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28107 0000485F A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28108                                  
 28109                                  	;entry	GETENT
 28110                                  GETENT:
 28111 00004862 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28112                                  ;
 28113                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28114                                  ; directory.
 28115                                  ;
 28116 00004865 B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28117 00004867 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28118 00004869 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28119                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28120                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28121                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28122                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28123                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28124 0000486B 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28125 0000486D 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28126                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28127                                  ;
 28128                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28129                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28130                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28131                                  ;
 28132                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28133 00004870 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28134 00004874 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28135                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28136 00004877 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28137 00004879 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28138 0000487B 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28139 0000487C E87BF6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28140 0000487F 5B                      	POP	BX
 28141                                  	;retc
 28142 00004880 72B9                    	jc	short nextentry_retn	
 28143                                  SETENTRY:
 28144 00004882 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28145                                  	;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28146                                  	;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28147 00004886 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28148 00004889 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28149                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28150 0000488B 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28151                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28152                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28153 0000488F F8                      	clc
 28154 00004890 C3                      	retn
 28155                                  
 28156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28157                                  
 28158                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28159                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28160                                  
 28161                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28162 00004891 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28163                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28164 000048A5 00000000                	dd	0
 28165                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28166 000048A9 0000                    	dw	0
 28167                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6
 28168                                  
 28169 000048AB 00<rep 72h>             	times 114 db 0	; 6*20 = 120 ; entry size = 6 bytes 
 28170                                  
 28171                                  SRCH_CLUSTER:
 28172 0000491D 0000                    	dw	0
 28173                                  SRCH_CLUSTER_HW:
 28174 0000491F 0000                    	dw	0
 28175

 28177                                  
 28178                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28179                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28180                                  ;
 28181                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28182                                  ;
 28183                                  ; Inputs:
 28184                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28185                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28186                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28187                                  ; Function:
 28188                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28189                                  ; Outputs:
 28190                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28191                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28192                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28193                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28194                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28195                                  
 28196                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28197                                  %if 0
 28198                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28199                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28200                                  	OR	BX,BX
 28201                                  	JZ	short SETROOTSRCH
 28202                                  	MOV	[DIRSTART],BX
 28203                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 28204                                  	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 28205                                  	INC	AL
 28206                                  	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 28207                                  
 28208                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 28209                                  	;SAVE	<SI>
 28210                                  	push	si
 28211                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 28212                                  	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 28213                                  	JNZ	short UNP_OK
 28214                                  
 28215                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 28216                                  	;invoke	UNPACK
 28217                                  	call	UNPACK
 28218                                  	JNC	short UNP_OK
 28219                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 28220                                  	pop	si
 28221                                  	;return
 28222                                  	retn
 28223                                  
 28224                                  UNP_OK:
 28225                                  	MOV	[CLUSNUM],DI
 28226                                  	MOV	DX,BX
 28227                                  	XOR	BL,BL
 28228                                  	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 28229                                  	;invoke	FIGREC
 28230                                  	call	FIGREC
 28231                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 28232                                  	pop	si
 28233                                  	
 28234                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28235                                  
 28236                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28237                                  	;PUSH	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 28238                                  	;MOV	DX,[HIGH_SECTOR]	   ;AN000; >32mb
 28239                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC+2],DX		   ;AN000; >32mb
 28240                                  	;POP	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 28241                                  
 28242                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28243                                  	;push	dx
 28244                                  	;mov	dx,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 28245                                  	;mov	[DIRSEC+2],dx
 28246                                  	;pop	dx
 28247                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC],dx
 28248                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28249                                  	mov	ax,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 28250                                  	mov	[DIRSEC+2],AX
 28251                                  	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX
 28252                                  
 28253                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28254                                  	; cf=0 (at the return of FIGREC)
 28255                                  	;CLC
 28256                                  	retn
 28257                                  
 28258                                  	;entry	SETROOTSRCH
 28259                                  SETROOTSRCH:
 28260                                  	XOR	AX,AX
 28261                                  	MOV	[DIRSTART],AX
 28262                                  	; 22/09/2023
 28263                                  	mov	[DIRSEC+2],ax ; 0
 28264                                  	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],AL
 28265                                  	DEC	AX
 28266                                  	MOV	[CLUSNUM],AX
 28267                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Bh]
 28268                                  	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 28269                                  	; 19/05/2019
 28270                                  	;;mov	dx,[es:bp+10h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 28271                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 28272                                  	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 28273                                  	SUB	AX,DX
 28274                                  	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 28275                                  	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX		      ;F.C. >32mb
 28276                                  	; 22/09/2023
 28277                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28278                                  	;MOV	WORD [DIRSEC+2],0	      ;F.C. >32mb
 28279                                  	CLC
 28280                                  	retn
 28281                                  %else
 28282                                  	;;;
 28283                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28284                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - 8A27h
 28285                                  	;;;
 28286                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28287 00004921 A1[F50A]                	mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28288                                  	;cmp	word [ROOTCLUST_HW],0
 28289 00004924 21C0                    	and	ax,ax

 28534                                  
 28535                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28537                                  ;
 28538                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28539                                  ;
 28540                                  ; Inputs:
 28541                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28542                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28543                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28544                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28545                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28546                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28547                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28548                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28549                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28550                                  ; Function:
 28551                                  ;	Crack the path
 28552                                  ; Outputs:
 28553                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28554                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28555                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28556                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28557                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28558                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28559                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28560                                  ;	   Zero set
 28561                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28562                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28563                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28564                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28565                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28566                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28567                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28568                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28569                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28570                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28571                                  ;	ELSE
 28572                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28573                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28574                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28575                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28576                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28577                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28578                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28579                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28580                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28581                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28582                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28583                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28584                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28585                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28586                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28587                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28588                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28589                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28590                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28591                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28592                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28593                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28594                                  
 28595                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28596                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28597                                  
 28598                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28599                                  GETPATH:
 28600                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28601 00004A33 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28602                                  
 28603                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28604                                  
 28605                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28606                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28607                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2	
 28608 00004A39 C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28609 00004A3E C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28610                                  
 28611                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28612                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28613                                  
 28614 00004A44 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28615                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28616                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28617 00004A48 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28618 00004A4D 7438                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28619                                  
 28620                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28621                                  
 28622 00004A4F 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28623                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28624                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28625                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28626                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28627                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28628 00004A52 E8AB00                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28629 00004A55 722E                    	JC	short InternalError
 28630                                  
 28631                                  Build_devJ:
 28632 00004A57 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28633 00004A5A A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28634                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 28635 00004A5D C606[2303]01            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 28636                                  					; "finding" a char device
 28637                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 28638                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 28639                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 28640                                  
 28641                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28642                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28643                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28644                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 28645                                  ;
 28646                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 28647                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 28648                                  
 28649                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 28650 00004A62 16                      	push	ss
 28651 00004A63 07                      	pop	es
 28652                                  
 28653                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28654 00004A64 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 28655 00004A67 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 28656 00004A6B 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28657 00004A6D B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 28658                                  MoveLoop:
 28659 00004A70 AC                      	lodsb
 28660 00004A71 AA                      	stosb
 28661 00004A72 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 28662 00004A74 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 28663                                  
 28664 00004A76 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28665                                  NoSave:
 28666 00004A78 E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 28667                                  
 28668                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 28669                                  ; at this point.
 28670                                  
 28671 00004A7A 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 28672 00004A7C C60500                  	mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 28673 00004A7F E8C402                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 28674 00004A82 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 28675 00004A84 C3                      	retn
 28676                                  
 28677                                  InternalError:
 28678                                  InternalError_loop:
 28679 00004A85 EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop	; freeze
 28680                                  
 28681                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 28682                                  
 28683                                  CrackIt:
 28684 00004A87 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 28685 00004A8B 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 28686 00004A8E 7503                    	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 28687 00004A90 8D7503                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.
 28688                                  LOOK_SING:
 28689                                  	;mov	byte [ATTRIB],16h
 28690 00004A93 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 28691                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 28692 00004A98 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28693 00004A9C B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1
 28694                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 28695 00004A9F 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 28696 00004AA3 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28697                                  
 28698                                  ; AX = -1
 28699                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. THis number is -1 if the media
 28700                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 28701                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 28702                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 28703                                  
 28704 00004AA7 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 28705 00004AA9 743B                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 28706 00004AAB 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 28707                                  
 28708                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28709 00004AAD 7437                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack form the root
 28710                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 28711 00004AAF F606[6D12]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 28712 00004AB4 743D                    	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 28713 00004AB6 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 28714 00004AB7 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28715 00004AB8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 28716 00004AB9 FF74FF                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 28717 00004ABC 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28718 00004ABD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28719                                  
 28720 00004ABE C644FF00                	MOV	BYTE [SI-1],0		; call fastopen to look up cur dir info
 28721 00004AC2 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 28722                                  
 28723                                  ;hkn; FastOpenTable, Dir_Info_Buff & FastOpen_Ext_Info are in DOSDATA
 28724 00004AC6 BB[6312]                	MOV	BX,FastOpenTable
 28725 00004AC9 BF[970D]                	MOV	DI,Dir_Info_Buff
 28726 00004ACC B9[8C0D]                	MOV	CX,FastOpen_Ext_Info
 28727                                  	;mov	al,1
 28728 00004ACF B001                    	MOV	AL,FONC_Look_up
 28729 00004AD1 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 28730 00004AD2 07                      	POP	ES
 28731                                  	;call	far [BX+2]
 28732 00004AD3 FF5F02                  	CALL	far [BX+fastopen_entry.name_caching]
 28733 00004AD6 7203                    	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.
 28734                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster
 28735                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28736                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0		;fastopen has current dir info?
 28737                                  	;JE	short GO_Chk_end	;yes. Go to got_search_cluster
 28738                                  	;stc
 28739                                  	;jmp	short GO_Chk_end	;Go to No_Curr_D
 28740                                  
 28741 00004AD8 803C01                  	cmp	byte [si],1
 28742                                  GO_Chk_end1:	; 29/12/2022
 28743 00004ADB F5                      	cmc 
 28744                                  	; [si] = 0 -> cf = 0
 28745                                  	; [si] > 0 -> cf = 1
 28746                                  
 28747                                  ;GO_Chk_end1:
 28748                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28749                                  	;clc
 28750                                  
 28751                                  GO_Chk_end:				; restore registers
 28752 00004ADC 5B                      	POP	BX
 28753 00004ADD 5E                      	POP	SI
 28754 00004ADE 8F44FF                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 28755 00004AE1 59                      	POP	CX
 28756 00004AE2 5F                      	POP	DI
 28757 00004AE3 07                      	POP	ES
 28758 00004AE4 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 28759                                  
 28760                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28761                                  ;
 28762                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 28763                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 28764                                  
 28765                                  NO_CURR_D:
 28766 00004AE6 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 28767 00004AEA 8D7403                  	LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 28768 00004AED C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28769 00004AF1 EB3B                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 28770                                  
 28771                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 28772                                  ; of specified cluster.
 28773                                  
 28774                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 28775 00004AF3 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28776 00004AF7 E827FE                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 28777                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28778                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28779                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28780 00004AFA 7342                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 28781                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28782                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28783                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28784                                  SETFERR:
 28785 00004AFC 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 28786 00004AFE F9                      	STC
 28787 00004AFF C3                      	retn
 28788                                  
 28789                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28790                                  ;
 28791                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 28792                                  ;
 28793                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 28794                                  ;   device.
 28795                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 28796                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28797                                  
 28798                                  CHKDEV:
 28799 00004B00 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 28800 00004B02 8CD7                    	MOV	DI,SS
 28801 00004B04 8EC7                    	MOV	ES,DI
 28802                                  
 28803 00004B06 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28804 00004B09 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 28805                                  TESTLOOP:
 28806 00004B0C E8D310                  	call	GETLET
 28807                                  
 28808 00004B0F 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 28809 00004B11 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28810 00004B13 E82211                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 28811 00004B16 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 28812 00004B18 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28813 00004B1A 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28814                                  
 28815 00004B1C AA                      	STOSB
 28816 00004B1D E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 28817                                  NOTDEV:
 28818 00004B1F F9                      	STC
 28819 00004B20 C3                      	retn
 28820                                  
 28821                                  TESTDEVICE:
 28822                                  	;ADD	CX,2
 28823                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28824 00004B21 41                      	inc	cx
 28825 00004B22 41                      	inc	cx
 28826 00004B23 B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 28827 00004B25 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28828 00004B27 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 28829 00004B29 8ED8                    	MOV	DS,AX
 28830                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 28831                                  	;retn
 28832                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28833 00004B2B E9B901                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 28834                                  
 28835                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 28836                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28837                                  ;
 28838                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 28839                                  ;
 28840                                  ; Inputs:
 28841                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 28842                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 28843                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 28844                                  ; Function:
 28845                                  ;	Search from root for path
 28846                                  ; Outputs:
 28847                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 28848                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 28849                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 28850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28851                                  
 28852                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28853                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28854                                  
 28855                                  ROOTPATH:
 28856 00004B2E E81CFE                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 28857                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28858 00004B31 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 28859                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 28860 00004B33 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 28861 00004B35 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 28862                                  
 28863                                  ; Root dir specified
 28864 00004B37 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28865 00004B3A A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28866                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28867                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 28868                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 28869 00004B3D C3                      	retn
 28870                                  
 28871                                  ; Inputs:
 28872                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 28873                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 28874                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28875                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 28876                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 28877                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 28878                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 28879                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 28880                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28881                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28882                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28883                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28884                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28885                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 28886                                  ; Function:
 28887                                  ;	Parse path name
 28888                                  ; Outputs:
 28889                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28890                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28891                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28892                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 28893                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28894                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28895                                  ;	   Zero set
 28896                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28897                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28898                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28899                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28900                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28901                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28902                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28903                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28904                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 28905                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28906                                  ;	ELSE
 28907                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28908                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28909                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 28910                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28911                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28912                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28913                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28914                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28915                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28916                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28917                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 28918                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28919                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28920                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28921                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28922                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28923                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28924                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28925                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28926                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 28927                                  
 28928                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28929                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28930                                  
 28931                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 28932                                  FINDPATH:
 28933 00004B3E 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 28934 00004B3F 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28935 00004B40 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 28936 00004B42 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 28937 00004B46 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 28938 00004B4B 740E                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 28939 00004B4D 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28940 00004B51 7508                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 28941 00004B53 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28942                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 28943 00004B57 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory currency
 28944                                  NOIDS:
 28945                                  
 28946                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 28947                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 28948                                  ;
 28949                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 28950                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 28951                                  ;
 28952                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 28953                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 28954                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 28955                                  
 28956 00004B5B 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 28957 00004B5D 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX
 28958                                  
 28959                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28960 00004B5F BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28961 00004B62 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 28962 00004B65 AA                      	STOSB
 28963 00004B66 AB                      	STOSW
 28964 00004B67 AB                      	STOSW
 28965 00004B68 AB                      	STOSW
 28966 00004B69 AB                      	STOSW
 28967 00004B6A AB                      	STOSW
 28968                                  
 28969                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28970 00004B6B BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28971 00004B6E 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 28972                                  GetNam:
 28973                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28974                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 28975                                  
 28976                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28977                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28978                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 28979                                  	
 28980 00004B70 AC                      	LODSB
 28981 00004B71 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 28982 00004B73 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 28983 00004B75 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28984 00004B77 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28985 00004B79 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 28986 00004B7B 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28987 00004B7D 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 28988 00004B7F 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 28989 00004B81 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 28990                                  StoNam: 
 28991 00004B84 AA                      	STOSB
 28992 00004B85 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 28993                                  _SetExt:
 28994 00004B87 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 28995                                  GetExt:
 28996 00004B8A AC                      	LODSB

 29257                                  ;Break	<STARTSRCH -- INITIATE DIRECTORY SEARCH>
 29258                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29259                                  ;
 29260                                  ; Procedure Name : STARTSRCH
 29261                                  ;
 29262                                  ; Inputs:
 29263                                  ;	[THISDPB] Set
 29264                                  ; Function:
 29265                                  ;	Set up a search for GETENTRY and NEXTENTRY
 29266                                  ; Outputs:
 29267                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameters
 29268                                  ;	Sets up LASTENT, ENTFREE=ENTLAST=-1, VOLID=0
 29269                                  ; Destroys ES,BP,AX

 29272                                  STARTSRCH:

 29277 00004CD2 48                      	DEC	AX

 29279 00004CD6 A3[DA05]                	MOV	[ENTLAST],AX

 29282                                  ;BREAK <MatchAttributes - the final check for attribute matching>
 29283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29284                                  ; Procedure Name : MatchAttributes
 29285                                  ;
 29286                                  ; Input:    [Attrib] = attribute to search for
 29287                                  ;	    CH = found attribute
 29288                                  ; Output:   JZ <match>
 29289                                  ;	    JNZ <nomatch>
 29290                                  ; Registers modified: noneski
 29291                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29292                                  
 29293                                  MatchAttributes:
 29294 00004CDA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29295                                  
 29296                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29297 00004CDB 36A0[6B05]              	MOV	AL,[ss:ATTRIB]		; AL <- SearchSet
 29298 00004CDF F6D0                    	NOT	AL			; AL <- SearchSet'
 29299 00004CE1 20E8                    	AND	AL,CH			; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet
 29300                                  	;and	al,16h
 29301 00004CE3 2416                    	AND	AL,attr_all	; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet and Important
 29302                                  ;
 29303                                  ; the result is non-zero if an attribute is not in the search set
 29304                                  ; and in the found set and in the important set. This means that we do not
 29305                                  ; have a match. Do a JNZ <nomatch> or JZ <match>
 29306                                  ;
 29307 00004CE5 58                      	POP	AX
 29308 00004CE6 C3                      	retn

 29310                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29311                                  ; DOSCODE:8148h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29312                                  
 29313                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29314                                  ; DOSCODE:810Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29315                                  
 29316                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>
 29317                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29318                                  ;
 29319                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 29320                                  ;
 29321                                  ; Inputs:
 29322                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 29323                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 29324                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29325                                  ; Function:
 29326                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29327                                  ; Outputs:
 29328                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29329                                  ;	ELSE
 29330                                  ;	Zero flag set
 29331                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 29332                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word
 29333                                  ;	DEVPT = DWORD pointer to Device header of device
 29334                                  ; BX destroyed, others preserved
 29335                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29336                                  
 29337                                  DEVNAME:
 29338                                  	; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29339                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 49FBh
 29340                                  
 29341 00004CE7 56                      	PUSH	SI
 29342 00004CE8 57                      	PUSH	DI
 29343 00004CE9 51                      	PUSH	CX
 29344 00004CEA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29345                                  
 29346                                  ; E5 special code
 29347 00004CEB FF36[4B05]              	PUSH	WORD [NAME1]
 29348 00004CEF 803E[4B05]05            	CMP	byte [NAME1],5
 29349 00004CF4 7505                    	JNZ	short NOKTR
 29350 00004CF6 C606[4B05]E5            	MOV	byte [NAME1],0E5h
 29351                                  NOKTR:
 29352                                  	;test	byte [ATTRIB],8
 29353 00004CFB F606[6B05]08            	TEST	byte [ATTRIB],attr_volume_id
 29354                                  					; If looking for VOL id don't find devs
 29355 00004D00 7521                    	JNZ	short RET31
 29356                                  
 29357                                  ;hkn; NULDEV is in DOSDATA
 29358 00004D02 BE[4800]                	MOV	SI,NULDEV
 29359                                  LOOKIO:
 29360                                  	; 21/11/2022
 29361                                  	;test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],80h
 29362                                  	; 17/12/2022
 29363                                  	;test	byte [si+5],80h
 29364 00004D05 F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)
 29365                                  	;;test	word [si+4],8000h
 29366                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 29367 00004D09 7411                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)
 29368 00004D0B 89F0                    	MOV	AX,SI
 29369                                  	;add	si,10
 29370 00004D0D 83C60A                  	ADD	SI,SYSDEV.NAME
 29371                                  
 29372                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 29373 00004D10 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29374 00004D13 B90400                  	MOV	CX,4			; All devices are 8 letters
 29375 00004D16 F3A7                    	REPE	CMPSW			; Check for name in list
 29376 00004D18 89C6                    	MOV	SI,AX
 29377 00004D1A 7415                    	JZ	short IOCHK		; Found it?
 29378                                  SKIPDEV:

 29380 00004D1E 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1			; At end of list?
 29381 00004D21 75E2                    	JNZ	short LOOKIO
 29382                                  RET31:	
 29383 00004D23 F9                      	STC				; Not found
 29384                                  RETNV:

 29386 00004D26 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 29387                                  
 29388 00004D28 8F06[4B05]              	POP	WORD [NAME1]
 29389 00004D2C 58                      	POP	AX
 29390 00004D2D 59                      	POP	CX
 29391 00004D2E 5F                      	POP	DI
 29392 00004D2F 5E                      	POP	SI

 29400 00004D39 80CFC0                  	OR	BH,0C0h

 29403 00004D3F 368936[9A05]            	MOV	[SS:DEVPT],SI
 29404 00004D44 EBDE                    	JMP	short RETNV

 29406                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 29407                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29408                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 29409                                  ;
 29410                                  ; Inputs:
 29411                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 29412                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29413                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29414                                  ; Function:
 29415                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 29416                                  ; Outputs:
 29417                                  ;	BX points to DEVFCB
 29418                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 29419                                  ;	AH = input BH
 29420                                  ;	AL = 0
 29421                                  ;	dir_first = DEVPT
 29422                                  ;	Zero Set, Carry Clear
 29423                                  ; DS,ES,BP preserved, others destroyed
 29424                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29425                                  
 29426                                  Build_device_ent:
 29427 00004D46 B82020                  	MOV	AX,"  " ; 2020h
 29428

 29432                                  ;	Fill dir_ext  BUGBUG - use ERRNZs for this stuff!
 29433

 29435 00004D4D AA                      	STOSB				; Blank out extent field

 29437 00004D4E B040                    	MOV	AL,attr_device
 29438                                  
 29439                                  ;	Fill Dir_attr
 29440

 29443 00004D53 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,10
 29444                                  
 29445                                  ; Fill dir_pad

 29448 00004D58 E807BE                  	call	DATE16
 29449                                  
 29450                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA

 29452 00004D5E 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 29453                                  
 29454                                  ; Fill dir_time
 29455                                  
 29456 00004D5F AB                      	STOSW

 29458                                  
 29459                                  ; Fill dir_date
 29460                                  
 29461 00004D61 AB                      	STOSW
 29462 00004D62 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; SI points to dir_first field
 29463 00004D64 A1[9A05]                	MOV	AX,[DEVPT]
 29464                                  
 29465                                  ; Fill dir_first

 29480                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 29481                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29482                                  ;
 29483                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 29484                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 29485                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.
 29486                                  ;

 29647                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 29648                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29649                                  ;
 29650                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 29651                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 29652                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 29653                                  ;
 29654                                  ;	[path]device
 29655                                  ;
 29656                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 29657                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 29658                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 29659                                  ;
 29660                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29661                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 29662                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29663                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 29664                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 29665                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 29666                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 29667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29668                                  
 29669                                  CheckThisDevice:
 29670 00004E30 57                      	push	di
 29671 00004E31 56                      	push	si
 29672 00004E32 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 29673                                  
 29674                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 29675                                  
 29676 00004E34 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 29677 00004E36 E8FF0D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 29678 00004E39 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 29679 00004E3B 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 29680                                  
 29681                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 29682                                  
 29683 00004E3C AD                      	LODSW
 29684 00004E3D 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 29685 00004E40 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 29686                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 29687 00004E43 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 29688 00004E45 AC                      	LODSB
 29689 00004E46 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 29690 00004E48 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 29691 00004E4A 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 29692 00004E4C AC                      	LODSB
 29693 00004E4D E8E80D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 29694 00004E50 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 29695                                  
 29696                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 29697                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 29698                                  
 29699                                  ParseDev:
 29700 00004E52 1E                      	push	ds
 29701 00004E53 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 29702 00004E54 E81F0D                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 29703 00004E57 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 29704 00004E5A F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 29705 00004E5B 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 29706                                  
 29707                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29708 00004E5D 16                      	push	ss
 29709 00004E5E 1F                      	pop	ds
 29710                                  
 29711                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 29712                                  ;
 29713                                  ; SR;
 29714                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 29715                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 29716                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 29717                                  
 29718 00004E5F A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 29719 00004E62 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 29720                                  
 29721                                  ; M026 - end
 29722                                  
 29723 00004E65 E87FFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 29724                                  
 29725                                  SkipSearch:
 29726 00004E68 5E                      	pop	si
 29727 00004E69 1F                      	pop	ds
 29728                                  
 29729                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 29730                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 29731                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 29732                                  
 29733                                  CheckReturn:
 29734 00004E6A 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 29735 00004E6B 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 29736 00004E6D 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29737                                  Check_Done:
 29738 00004E6F 5F                      	pop	di
 29739 00004E70 F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 29740 00004E71 C3                      	retn
 29741                                  NotDevice:
 29742 00004E72 F9                      	STC
 29743 00004E73 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn
 29744

 29875                                  ; Output: FastOPen_Ext_Info is set and path dir info is inserted
 29876                                  ;

 30004                                  CmdTab:

 30006 00004FA5 8605                    	DB	86h, DEVRDND	; 1 input status

 30027                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 30028                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30029                                  ;
 30030                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 30031                                  ;
 30032                                  ; Inputs:
 30033                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 30034                                  ;	AH is function code
 30035                                  ;		= 0 Input
 30036                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 30037                                  ;		= 2 Output
 30038                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 30039                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 30040                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 30041                                  ;				   present.
 30042                                  ;	AL = character if output
 30043                                  ; Function:
 30044                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 30045                                  ; Outputs:
 30046                                  ;	AL is character if input
 30047                                  ;	If a status call
 30048                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 30049                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 30050                                  ; For regular files:
 30051                                  ;	Input Status
 30052                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 30053                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 30054                                  ;	Input
 30055                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 30056                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 30057                                  ;	Output Status
 30058                                  ;		Always ready
 30059                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 30060                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30061                                  
 30062                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
