 32579 00005960 5A                              POP     DX              ; Starting cluster
 32580 00005961 29D3                            SUB     BX,DX           ; Number of new clusters accessed
 32581 00005963 011E[BA05]                      ADD     [LASTPOS],BX
 32582 00005967 5B                              POP     BX              ; BL = sector position within cluster
 32583 00005968 E81600                  	call	FIGREC
 32584 0000596B 89F3                            MOV     BX,SI
 32585                                  	; 24/09/2023
 32586                                  	; cf=0 (at the return of FIGREC)
 32587                                  	;CLC
 32588 0000596D C3                              retn
 32589                                  OP_ERR:
 32590 0000596E 83C404                          ADD     SP,4
 32591 00005971 F9                      	STC
 32592 00005972 C3                              retn
 32593                                  BLKDON:
 32594 00005973 29D1                            SUB     CX,DX           ; Number of sectors in cluster we don't want
 32595 00005975 28CC                            SUB     AH,CL           ; Number of sectors in cluster we accepted
 32596 00005977 FECC                            DEC     AH              ; Adjust to mean position within cluster
 32597 00005979 8826[7305]                      MOV     [SECCLUSPOS],AH
 32598 0000597D 89D1                            MOV     CX,DX           ; Anyway, make the total equal to the request
 32599 0000597F EBC8                            JMP     SHORT FINCLUS

 32601                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 32602                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32603                                  ;
 32604                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 32605                                  ;
 32606                                  ; Inputs:
 32607                                  ;       DX = Physical cluster number
 32608                                  ;       BL = Sector position within cluster
 32609                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32610                                  ; Outputs:
 32611                                  ;       DX = physical sector number           (LOW)
 32612                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)
 32613                                  ; No other registers affected.
 32614                                  ;
 32615                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32616                                  
 32617                                  	; 10/06/2019
 32618                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32619                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32620                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32621                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 32622                                  FIGREC:

 32646                                  noshift:

 32662                                  
 32663                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32664                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 32665                                  
 32666                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32667                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 32668                                  
 32669                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 32670                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32671                                  ;
 32672                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 32673                                  ;
 32674                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 32675                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 32676                                  ;
 32677                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 32678                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 32679                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 32680                                  ;
 32681                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 32682                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 32683                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 32684                                  ;
 32685                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 32686                                  ;
 32687                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 32688                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 32689                                  ;           ELSE
 32690                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 32691                                  ;
 32692                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 32693                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 32694                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 32695                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 32696                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 32697                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 32698                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 32699                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 32700                                  ;   allocated.
 32701                                  ;
 32702                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 32703                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 32704                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 32705                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 32706                                  ;
 32707                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 32708                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 32709                                  ;                                                                          ;
 32710                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 32711                                  ;   explanation:
 32712                                  ;
 32713                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 32714                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 32715                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 32716                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 32717                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 32718                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 32719                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 32720                                  ;   the
 32721                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 32722                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 32723                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 32724                                  ;
 32725                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 32726                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 32727                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 32728                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 32729                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 32730                                  ;
 32731                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 32732                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 32733                                  ;                                                                          ;
 32734                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 32735                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 32736                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 32737                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 32738                                  ;
 32739                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 32740                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 32741                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 32742                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 32743                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 32744                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 32745                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 32746                                  ;
 32747                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 32748                                  
 32749                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 32750                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 32751                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 32752                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 32753                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 32754                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 32755                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 32756                                  ;callmagic  endp
 32757                                  
 32758                                  ; 25/09/2023
 32759                                  %if 0
 32760                                  callmagic:
 32761                                  	push	ds
 32762                                  	push	MagicPatch
 32763                                  	retf	
 32764                                  %endif
 32765                                  
 32766                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 32767                                  %if 1
 32768                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 32769 000059AE A3[F70A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 32770                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 32771                                  %endif
 32772                                  
 32773                                  ALLOCATE:
 32774                                  	; 10/09/2018
 32775                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 32776                                  ;
 32777                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 32778                                  ;
 32779                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 32780                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 32781                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 32782                                  ;data would not.
 32783                                  ;        
 32784                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 32785                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 32786                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 32787                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 32788                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 32789                                  
 32790                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32791                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 32792                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 32793                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 32794                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 32795                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 32796                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 32797                                  
 32798                                  ; 25/09/2023
 32799                                  %if 0
 32800                                  	clc
 32801                                  	push	cs
 32802                                  	call	callmagic
 32803                                  	jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 32804                                  	jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 32805                                  Regular_Allocate_Path:
 32806                                  %endif
 32807                                  
 32808                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32809                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 32810                                  
 32811                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32812                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32813                                  
 32814 000059B1 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 32815 000059B2 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 32816 000059B4 E82407                  	call	UNPACK
 32817 000059B7 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 32818 000059BB 5B                              POP     BX
 32819 000059BC 72EF                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 32820                                  
 32821 000059BE 51                              PUSH    CX
 32822 000059BF 53                              PUSH    BX
 32823                                  
 32824 000059C0 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 32825                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 32826                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 32827 000059C2 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 32828 000059C6 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 32829 000059C9 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 32830                                  
 32831                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 32832                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 32833                                  
 32834                                  ads1:
 32835                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 32836                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32837 000059CB 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 32838 000059D1 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 32839                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 32840                                  
 32841                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 32842                                  ;
 32843                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 32844                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 32845                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 32846                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 32847                                  
 32848                                  FINDFRE:
 32849 000059D4 43                              INC     BX
 32850                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 32851 000059D5 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 32852 000059D9 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 32853 000059DB E8FD06                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 32854 000059DE 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 32855 000059E0 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 32856                                  
 32857                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 32858                                  ;
 32859                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 32860                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 32861                                  
 32862                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 32863                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 32864 000059E2 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 32865 000059E6 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 32866 000059E7 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 32867 000059EA E84207                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 32868 000059ED 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 32869                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 32870                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 32871 000059EF 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 32872 000059F4 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 32873                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 32874                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 32875 000059F6 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 32876                                  NO_ALLOC:
 32877 000059FA 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 32878 000059FB 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 32879 000059FD 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 32880 000059FF E82D07                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 32881                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 32882                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 32883 00005A02 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 32884 00005A04 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 32885 00005A05 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 32886 00005A07 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 32887                                  
 32888                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 32889                                  ;
 32890                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 32891                                  
 32892 00005A09 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 32893 00005A0C E82007                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 32894                                  
 32895                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 32896                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 32897                                  ;
 32898                                  ;       'C' set if error
 32899                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 32900                                  
 32901                                  ads4:   
 32902 00005A0F 5B                      	POP     BX
 32903 00005A10 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 32904 00005A11 729A                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32905 00005A13 E8C506                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 32906                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 32907 00005A16 7295                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32908 00005A18 E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 32909 00005A1B 7290                            jc	short figrec_retn
 32910 00005A1D 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 32911 00005A1F 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 32912 00005A21 758A                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 32913                                  
 32914                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 32915                                  ;   info
 32916                                  dofastk:
 32917                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32918                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32919                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 32920                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 32921                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 32922                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 32923                                  
 32924                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32925                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32926                                  	
 32927                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32928                                  	;push	dx ; *
 32929                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 32930                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32931                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 32932                                  	
 32933                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 32934 00005A23 06                      	PUSH	ES
 32935 00005A24 C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 32936                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 32937 00005A28 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 32938                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 32939                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 32940 00005A2C 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 32941 00005A30 07                      	POP	ES
 32942                                  	;retn
 32943                                  
 32944                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 32945                                  
 32946                                  	; 16/12/2022
 32947                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32948                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 32949                                  
 32950 00005A31 C3                      	retn	
 32951                                  
 32952                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 32953                                  ;   of the disk...
 32954                                  
 32955                                  ads7:   
 32956 00005A32 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 32957 00005A37 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 32958                                  
 32959                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 32960                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 32961                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 32962                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 32963                                  ;
 32964                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 32965                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 32966                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 32967                                  
 32968 00005A39 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 32969 00005A3A BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 32970 00005A3D E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 32971 00005A40 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 32972                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 32973                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 32974                                                                  ;   setup.
 32975 00005A41 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 32976 00005A43 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 32977                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 32978                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 32979                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 32980 00005A46 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 32981 00005A4B F9                              STC
 32982 00005A4C C3                              retn
 32983                                  
 32984                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32985                                  ;
 32986                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 32987                                  ;
 32988                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 32989                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32990                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 32991                                  
 32992                                  RESTFATBYT:
 32993 00005A4D 53                              PUSH    BX
 32994 00005A4E 52                              PUSH    DX
 32995 00005A4F 57                              PUSH    DI
 32996 00005A50 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 32997 00005A52 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 32998 00005A56 E8D606                  	call	PACK
 32999 00005A59 5F                              POP     DI
 33000 00005A5A 5A                              POP     DX
 33001 00005A5B 5B                              POP     BX
 33002                                  ; 16/12/2022
 33003                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33004                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 33005 00005A5C C3                      	retn
 33006                                  
 33007                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 33008                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33009                                  ;
 33010                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 33011                                  ;
 33012                                  ; Inputs:
 33013                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 33014                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33015                                  ; Function:
 33016                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 33017                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33018                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 33019                                  ;
 33020                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33021                                  
 33022                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33023                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33024                                  RELEASE:
 33025 00005A5D 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 33026                                  
 33027                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 33028                                  RELBLKS:
 33029                                  
 33030                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 33031                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 33032                                  
 33033 00005A5F E87906                  	call	UNPACK
 33034 00005A62 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33035 00005A64 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 33036 00005A66 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 33037 00005A68 52                              PUSH    DX
 33038 00005A69 E8C306                  	call	PACK
 33039 00005A6C 5A                              POP     DX
 33040 00005A6D 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33041 00005A6F 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 33042 00005A71 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 33043                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33044                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33045 00005A73 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33046 00005A78 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 33047 00005A7A 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33048                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33049 00005A7E 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 33050 00005A80 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 33051 00005A81 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33052 00005A83 E83E06                  	call	IsEOF
 33053 00005A86 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 33054                                  
 33055                                  	; 16/12/2022
 33056                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33057                                  ;%if 0
 33058                                  RELEASE_flush:
 33059                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33060 00005A88 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 33061                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33062 00005A8C 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 33063 00005A8D 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 33064 00005A8E 06                      	push	es
 33065 00005A8F 55                      	push	bp
 33066 00005A90 E8850B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 33067 00005A93 5D                      	pop	bp
 33068 00005A94 07                      	pop	es
 33069 00005A95 59                      	pop	cx
 33070 00005A96 5E                      	pop	si
 33071                                  ;%endif
 33072                                  RET12:
 33073 00005A97 C3                      	retn
 33074                                  
 33075                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 33076                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33077                                  ;
 33078                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 33079                                  ;
 33080                                  ; Inputs:
 33081                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 33082                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 33083                                  ;       DS = CS
 33084                                  ; Outputs:
 33085                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 33086                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33087                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 33088                                  ;
 33089                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33090                                  
 33091                                  GETEOF:
 33092 00005A98 E84006                  	call	UNPACK
 33093 00005A9B 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 33094 00005A9D 53                              PUSH    BX
 33095 00005A9E 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 33096 00005AA0 E82106                  	call	IsEOF
 33097 00005AA3 5B                              POP     BX
 33098 00005AA4 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 33099 00005AA6 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 33100 00005AA8 EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF

 33138                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33139                                  ;
 33140                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 33141                                  ;
 33142                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33143                                  
 33144                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33145                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33146                                  MAKEFCB:

 33312                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 33313                                  ;
 33314                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 33315                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames

 33318                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 33319                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup

 33321                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 33322                                  ;
 33323                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 33331 00005B7D 07                      	pop	es
 33332                                  
 33333                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA

 33337 00005B85 B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 33338 00005B88 AA                      	STOSB

 33340 00005B8B 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 33341 00005B8D 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL

 33362                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 33363                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33364                                  
 33365                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 33366                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 33367                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 33368                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 33369                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 33370                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 33371                                  
 33372                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 33373                                  ;CharType:
 33374                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33375                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 33376                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33377                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 33378                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33379                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 33380                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33381                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 33382                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33383                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 33384                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33385                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 33386                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33387                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 33388                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33389                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 33390                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33391                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 33392                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33393                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 33394                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33395                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 33396                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 33397                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 33398                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh

 33503                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33504                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33505                                  
 33506                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33507                                  ;
 33508                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 33509                                  ;
 33510                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 33511                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 33512                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 33513                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 33514                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 33515                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 33516                                  ;
 33517                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 33518                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 33519                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 33520                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 33521                                  ;
 33522                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 33523                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 33524                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 33525                                  ;
 33526                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33527                                  
 33528                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 33529                                  
 33530                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 33531                                  GETLET:	
 33532 00005BE2 AC                      	LODSB
 33533                                  
 33534                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 33535                                  
 33536                                  	;entry	UCase
 33537                                  UCase:	
 33538                                  	; 09/08/2018
 33539                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 33540                                  _UCase:
 33541 00005BE3 53                      	PUSH	BX
 33542 00005BE4 BB[850B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2

 33545

 33550 00005BED 7702                    	JA	short gl_1

 33557 00005BF3 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 33558 00005BF5 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 33559

 33561                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 33562                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 33563                                  	; preserve it.
 33564                                  
 33565                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33566                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 33567                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 33568                                  	;CS	XLAT
 33569

 33574                                  	;getdseg <ds>

 33576 00005BFD D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 33577 00005BFE 1F                      	pop	ds
 33578                                  
 33579                                  	; M048 - End
 33580                                  
 33581                                  ; Now check the type
 33582                                  
 33583                                  ;If TableLook
 33584                                  gl_2:

 33586 00005BFF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 33587                                  
 33588                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 33589                                  	;mov	bx,CharType

 33593

 33599 00005C05 58                      	POP	AX
 33600                                  
 33601 00005C06 5B                      	POP	BX
 33602 00005C07 C3                      	RETN

 33716                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33717                                  ;
 33718                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 33719                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 33720                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 33721                                  ;
 33722                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 33723                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 33724                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 33725                                  ;
 33726                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33727                                  
 33728                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33729                                  
 33730                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33731                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33732                                  GetCharType:
 33733                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 33734 00005C1B 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 33735 00005C1D 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 33736                                  
 33737 00005C1F 53                      	push	bx
 33738 00005C20 BB[A35B]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 33739 00005C23 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 33740                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 33741 00005C25 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 33742 00005C27 5B                      	pop	bx
 33743                                  
 33744                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 33745                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 33746                                  
 33747 00005C28 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 33748                                  
 33749 00005C2A D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 33750 00005C2C D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33751 00005C2E D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33752 00005C30 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 33753                                  gct_80:
 33754 00005C32 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 33755 00005C34 C3                      	retn
 33756                                  gct_90:
 33757 00005C35 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 33758 00005C37 C3                      	retn

 33792                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 33793                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.

 33805                                  ;
 33806                                  ;	Revision history:
 33807                                  ;
 33808                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 33809                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 33810                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 33811                                  ;
 33812                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 33813                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 33814                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 33815                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 33816                                  ;
 33817                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 33818                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine

 33991                                  ; Procedure Name : SpoolInt
 33992                                  ;
 33993                                  ; SpoolInt - signal processes that the DOS is truly idle. We are allowed to
 33994                                  ; do this ONLY if we are working on a 1-12 system call AND if we are not in
 33995                                  ; the middle of an INT 24.

 33999                                  SPOOLINT:
 34000 00005CD4 9C                              PUSHF
 34001                                  	; 15/03/2018
 34002 00005CD5 36803E[5803]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:IDLEINT],0	; SS override
 34003 00005CDB 7423                            JZ      SHORT POPFRET
 34004 00005CDD 36803E[2003]00                  CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0

 34006

 34010                                  	; calls at this time. We MUST preserve IdleInt across this.

 34020 00005CF4 EB05                    	jmp	short spool_ret_addr

 34162                                  	; !! NOTE: FALL THROUGH !!
 34163                                  
 34164                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34165                                  ;
 34166                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 34167                                  ;
 34168                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 34169                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 34170                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 34171                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 34172                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 34173                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 34174                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 34175                                  ; is simulated.
 34176                                  ;
 34177                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34178                                  
 34179                                  CNTCHAND:
 34180                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 34181                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 34182                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 34183                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 34184                                  
 34185                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34186                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 34187 00005D8F 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 34188 00005D95 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 34189                                  
 34190 00005D97 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 34191 00005D99 E82BBF                          CALL	BUFOUT
 34192 00005D9C E8C6BD                          CALL	CRLF
 34193                                  around_deadlock:
 34194 00005D9F 16                              PUSH    SS
 34195 00005DA0 1F                              POP     DS
 34196 00005DA1 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 34197 00005DA6 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 34198 00005DA8 E8BCDD                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 34199                                  NOSWAP:

 34202 00005DB0 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]

 34204                                  
 34205                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 34207                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0

 34213                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 34214                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 34215                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 34216                                  			; else
 34217                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 34218

 34232                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it

 34234

 34252                                  ;

 34254                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 34255                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit

 34518                                  ;
 34519                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 34520                                  ;
 34521                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 34522                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 34523                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 34524                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 34525                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 34526                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 34527                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 34528                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 34529                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 34530                                  ; Output:
 34531                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 34532                                  ;
 34533                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34534                                  
 34535                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 34543                                          ;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 34544                                  	;cmp	di,0
 34545 00005EA6 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?
 34546 00005EA9 750A                            JNZ     short NOSETWRPERR
 34547 00005EAB 50                              PUSH    AX

 34800                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34801                                  ;
 34802                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 34803                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 34804                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 34805                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 34806                                  ;
 34807                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 34808                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 34809                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 34810                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 34811                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 34812                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 34813                                  ;
 34814                                  ; output:   none.
 34815                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34816                                  
 34817                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 34818                                  	
 34819                                  reset_environment:
 34820                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34821                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 34822                                  
 34823                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 34824                                  
 34825 00005FFD 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 34826                                  
 34827                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 34828                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 34829                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 34830

 34842                                  					; On process exit.
