 34974                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34975                                  ;
 34976                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 34977                                  ;
 34978                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 34979                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 34980                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 34981                                  ;
 34982                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34983                                  
 34984                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 34985 0000609D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34986                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 34987 0000609E B8[020F]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 34988 000060A1 2D[F20E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 34989                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 34990                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 34991                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34992                                  	
 34993                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34994 000060A4 1E                      	push	ds
 34995                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 34996 000060A5 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34997                                  
 34998                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate 
 34999                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35000                                  
 35001 000060AA 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35002 000060AC 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35003 000060AE 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35004                                  
 35005                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35006 000060B0 8A85[F20E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35007 000060B4 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35008                                  NoTrans:
 35009                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 35010 000060B6 A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 35011 000060B9 1F                      	pop	ds
 35012                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 35013 000060BA 58                      	POP	AX
 35014                                  
 35015                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct 
 35016                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 35017                                  
 35018 000060BB 56                      	PUSH	SI
 35019                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 35020 000060BC BE[A20E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 35021 000060BF E8F1A5                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 35022 000060C2 5E                      	POP	SI
 35023 000060C3 C3                      	retn
 35024                                  
 35025                                  ;============================================================================
 35026                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35027                                  ;============================================================================
 35028                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35029                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35030                                  
 35031                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 35032                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 35033                                  
 35034                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 35035                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35036                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 35037                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 35038                                  ;
 35039                                  ;	IsEof
 35040                                  ;	UNPACK
 35041                                  ;	PACK
 35042                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 35043                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 35044                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 35045                                  ;	FAT_operation
 35046                                  ;
 35047                                  ;	Revision history:
 35048                                  ;
 35049                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 35050                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 35051                                  ;
 35052                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 35053                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 35054                                  
 35055                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35056                                  
 35057                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 35058                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35059                                  ;
 35060                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 35061                                  ;
 35062                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 35063                                  ;
 35064                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 35065                                  ;		BX has fat value
 35066                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 35067                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 35068                                  ;
 35069                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35070                                  
 35071                                  IsEOF:
 35072                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 35073 000060C4 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 35074 000060CA 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 35075                                  
 35076                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 35077                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 35078                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 35079                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 35080                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 35081                                  
 35082 000060CC 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 35083 000060D0 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 35084                                  
 35085 000060D2 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 35086                                  IsEOF_other:
 35087 000060D6 C3                      	retn
 35088                                  EOF16:
 35089 000060D7 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 35090 000060DA C3                      	retn
 35091                                  
 35092                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35093                                  
 35094                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 35095                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35096                                  ;
 35097                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 35098                                  ;
 35099                                  ; Inputs:
 35100                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 35101                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35102                                  ; Outputs:
 35103                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 35104                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 35105                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 35106                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 35107                                  ;
 35108                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 35109                                  ;
 35110                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35111                                  	
 35112                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35113                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35114                                  
 35115                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35116                                  UNPACK:
 35117                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 35118 000060DB 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 35119 000060DD 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 35120 000060DF 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 35121 000060E3 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 35122 000060E5 C3                      	retn				; done
 35123                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 35124                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 35125                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 35126 000060E6 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 35127 000060EA 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 35128 000060EC E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 35129 000060EF 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 35130 000060F1 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 35131 000060F3 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 35132 000060F5 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 35133 000060F9 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 35134 000060FD 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 35135 000060FF 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 35136 00006101 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 35137                                  High12:
 35138 00006103 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 35139 00006105 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 35140 00006107 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 35141 00006109 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 35142                                  Unpack12:
 35143 0000610B 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 35144                                  _DoContext:
 35145 0000610F 16                      	PUSH	SS
 35146 00006110 1F                      	POP	DS
 35147 00006111 C3                      	retn
 35148                                  HURTFAT:
 35149                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 35150                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 35151 00006112 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 35152 00006118 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35153 00006119 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 35154                                  
 35155                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35156 0000611B 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 35157                                  ;
 35158                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 35159                                  ;
 35160 00006121 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 35161 00006124 E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 35162 00006127 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 35163 00006129 F8                      	CLC
 35164 0000612A 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 35165 0000612C F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 35166                                  OKU_RET:
 35167 0000612D 58                      	POP	AX
 35168                                  hurtfat_retn:
 35169 0000612E C3                      	retn
 35170                                  
 35171                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35172                                  
 35173                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 35174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35175                                  ;
 35176                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 35177                                  ;
 35178                                  ; Inputs:
 35179                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 35180                                  ;	DX = Data
 35181                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 35182                                  ; Outputs:
 35183                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 35184                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 35185                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 35186                                  ;	No other registers affected
 35187                                  ;
 35188                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 35189                                  ;
 35190                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35191                                  
 35192                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35193                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35194                                  PACK:
 35195                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 35196 0000612F 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 35197 00006131 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 35198 00006133 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 35199 00006137 C3                      	retn				; done
 35200                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 35201                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 35202 00006138 E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 35203 0000613B 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 35204 0000613D 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 35205 0000613F 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 35206 00006141 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 35207 00006142 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 35208 00006144 D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 35209 00006146 59                      	POP	CX
 35210 00006147 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 35211 0000614A EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 35212                                  ALIGNED:
 35213                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 35214 0000614C 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 35215 00006152 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 35216 00006154 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 35217 00006158 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 35218 0000615C EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 35219                                  Pack16:
 35220 0000615E 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 35221                                  PACKIN:
 35222 00006160 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 35223 00006162 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 35224                                  
 35225                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35226 00006164 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 35227                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35228 00006169 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 35229                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 35230 0000616D 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 35231                                  	; 10/06/2019
 35232 0000616F E8B705                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 35233                                  	
 35234                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 35235 00006172 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 35236                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 35237                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35238 00006176 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 35239                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35240 0000617C 16                      	push	ss
 35241 0000617D 1F                      	pop	ds
 35242 0000617E 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 35243 00006180 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35244 00006181 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35245 00006182 51                      	PUSH	CX
 35246 00006183 A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 35247 00006186 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 35248                                  	;;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 35249                                  	;;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35250                                  	; 02/01/2024
 35251                                  	;add	si,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 
 35252 0000618A 83C618                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 35253 0000618D 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 35254                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35255                                  	;Context DS
 35256 0000618F 16                      	push	ss
 35257 00006190 1F                      	pop	ds
 35258                                  	
 35259 00006191 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35260                                  	
 35261                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35262 00006192 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 35263 00006196 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 35264                                  
 35265                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 35266 0000619A 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 35267                                  
 35268                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *
 35269                                  	;XOR	AL,AL     ; *
 35270                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB ; *
 35271                                  	; 22/09/2023
 35272 0000619E E86C03                  	call	GETBUFFRA ; *
 35273                                  
 35274 000061A1 58                      	POP	AX
 35275 000061A2 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 35276 000061A4 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 35277                                  	
 35278                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35279 000061A8 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 35280                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 35281 000061AC 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 35282 000061AE E87805                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 35283                                  	
 35284                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 35285 000061B1 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 35286                                  yesdirty12:
 35287                                  	;;;add	di,16
 35288                                  	;;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35289                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 35290                                  	;DEC	DI
 35291                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35292                                  	;add	di,23 ; PCDOS 7.1
 35293 000061B5 83C717                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 23 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 35294                                  	
 35295                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 35296 000061B8 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 35297 000061BC 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 35298 000061BE F8                      	CLC
 35299                                  POPP_RET:
 35300 000061BF 16                      	PUSH	SS
 35301 000061C0 1F                      	POP	DS
 35302 000061C1 59                      	POP	CX
 35303 000061C2 5B                      	POP	BX
 35304 000061C3 58                      	POP	AX
 35305 000061C4 C3                      	retn
 35306                                  
 35307                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35308                                  
 35309                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 35310                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35311                                  ;
 35312                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 35313                                  ;
 35314                                  ; Inputs:
 35315                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 35316                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 35317                                  ; Function:
 35318                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 35319                                  ; Outputs:
 35320                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 35321                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 35322                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 35323                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 35324                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 35325                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 35326                                  ;
 35327                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35328                                  
 35329                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35330                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35331                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35332                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35333                                  
 35334                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 35335                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 35336 000061C5 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 35337                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 35338 000061CA 50                      	push	ax
 35339 000061CB 53                      	push	bx
 35340 000061CC 51                      	push	cx
 35341 000061CD 52                      	push	dx
 35342 000061CE 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 35343 000061D0 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 35344 000061D6 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 35345 000061D8 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 35346                                  Map16:	
 35347                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 35348 000061DA 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 35349                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 35350 000061DC 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 35351 000061DE 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 35352 000061E0 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 35353                                  
 35354                                  ;IF FastDiv
 35355                                  ;
 35356                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 35357                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 35358                                  ;
 35359                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 35360                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 35361                                  ;
 35362                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 35363                                  
 35364 000061E4 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 35365 000061E8 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 35366 000061EA 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 35367 000061EC 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 35368 000061F0 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 35369                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 35370                                  	;shr	al,1	
 35371                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 35372 000061F2 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 35373 000061F4 D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 35374                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 35375 000061F6 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 35376 000061F8 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 35377                                  _DoDiv:
 35378                                  ;ENDIF
 35379                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35380                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 35381                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35382 000061FA 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 35383                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 35384 000061FC F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 35385                                  ;IF FastDiv
 35386                                  DivDone:
 35387                                  ;ENDIF
 35388                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 35389 000061FE 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 35390 00006202 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 35391                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 35392 00006203 50                      	push	ax
 35393 00006204 52                      	push	dx
 35394 00006205 51                      	push	cx
 35395 00006206 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 35396                                  
 35397                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35398                                  	; 22/09/2023
 35399                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 35400                                  	;
 35401                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 35402                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 35403                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 35404                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 35405                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 35406                                  	; 22/09/2023
 35407 00006208 E8FC02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 35408                                  
 35409                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 35410 0000620B 59                      	pop	cx
 35411 0000620C 58                      	pop	ax
 35412 0000620D 5A                      	pop	dx
 35413 0000620E 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 35414                                  
 35415 00006210 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 35416                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 35417                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35418 00006214 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 35419 00006217 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 35420 00006219 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 35421 0000621B 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 35422 0000621D 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 35423                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35424 0000621F 16                      	push	ss
 35425 00006220 1F                      	pop	ds	
 35426 00006221 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 35427 00006225 A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 35428 00006228 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 35429                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35430 0000622C C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 35431 00006232 42                      	INC	DX
 35432                                  
 35433                                  	; 22/09/2023
 35434                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 35435                                  	;
 35436                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 35437                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 35438                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 35439                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 35440                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 35441                                  	; 22/09/2023
 35442 00006233 E8D102                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 35443 00006236 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 35444                                  
 35445 00006238 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 35446 0000623C 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 35447 0000623F 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 35448                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35449 00006241 16                      	push	ss
 35450 00006242 1F                      	pop	ds
 35451 00006243 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 35452                                  
 35453                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 35454 00006246 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 35455                                  MAPRET:
 35456                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 35457 00006249 5A                      	pop	dx
 35458 0000624A 59                      	pop	cx
 35459 0000624B 5B                      	pop	bx
 35460 0000624C 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 35461 0000624E 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 35462 00006254 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 35463 00006256 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 35464                                  MapSet:
 35465 00006258 A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 35466                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 35467 0000625A 58                      	pop	ax
 35468 0000625B C3                      	retn
 35469                                  
 35470                                  MAP_POP:
 35471                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 35472 0000625C 5A                      	pop	dx
 35473 0000625D 59                      	pop	cx
 35474 0000625E 5B                      	pop	bx
 35475 0000625F 58                      	pop	ax
 35476                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 35477 00006260 C3                      	retn
 35478                                  
 35479                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35480                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35481                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35482                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35483                                  
 35484                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 35485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35486                                  ;
 35487                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 35488                                  ;
 35489                                  ; Inputs:
 35490                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 35491                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 35492                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 35493                                  ; Function:
 35494                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 35495                                  ;	if disk changed.
 35496                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 35497                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 35498                                  ; Outputs:
 35499                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 35500                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 35501                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 35502                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 35503                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 35504                                  ;
 35505                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35506                                  
 35507                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 35508 00006261 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 35509                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35510                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 35511                                  	; 15/12/2022
 35512 00006265 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 35513 00006269 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 35514 0000626C E8F8A3                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 35515                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 35516                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35517 0000626F E99F00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 35518                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 35519                                  	;retn
 35520                                  
 35521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35522                                  ;
 35523                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 35524                                  ;
 35525                                  ; Inputs:
 35526                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 35527                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 35528                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 35529                                  ; Function:
 35530                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 35531                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 35532                                  ; Outputs:
 35533                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 35534                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 35535                                  ;	THISDRV set
 35536                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 35537                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 35538                                  ;
 35539                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35540                                  
 35541                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35542                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35543                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35544                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35545                                  
 35546                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 35547 00006272 06                      	PUSH	ES
 35548 00006273 57                      	PUSH	DI
 35549                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 35550 00006274 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 35551                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35552                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 35553                                  	; 15/12/2022
 35554 00006278 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 35555 0000627C A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 35556 0000627F E8E5A3                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 35557 00006282 E88C00                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 35558 00006285 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 35559 00006286 07                      	POP	ES
 35560 00006287 72D7                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 35561 00006289 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 35562                                  
 35563                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 35564                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 35565                                  
 35566                                  MED_CHANGE:
 35567 0000628B 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 35568 0000628D 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 35569 0000628E 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 35570 0000628F 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 35571 00006293 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 35572                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 35573 00006295 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 35574                                  
 35575                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35576                                  
 35577                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 35578                                  ;
 35579                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 35580                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 35581                                  
 35582 00006299 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 35583                                  frcd20: 
 35584                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 35585                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 35586 0000629E 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 35587 000062A3 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 35588                                  
 35589                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35590                                  	;push	es
 35591                                  	;push	di
 35592                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 35593                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 35594                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 35595                                  	;pop	di
 35596                                  	;pop	es
 35597                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 35598                                  
 35599                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35600 000062A5 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 35601 000062A9 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 35602 000062AB 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 35603 000062AD 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 35604 000062B1 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 35605                                  
 35606                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 35607                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 35608 000062B3 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 35609 000062B7 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 35610                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 35611 000062B9 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 35612                                  frcd25:	
 35613                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35614                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 35615 000062BD 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 35616 000062C0 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 35617 000062C2 1F                      	POP	DS
 35618                                  NO_CHANGE:
 35619 000062C3 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 35620 000062C7 F8                      	CLC
 35621 000062C8 C3                      	retn
 35622                                  
 35623                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35624                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 35625                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 35626                                  ;;;
 35627                                  chk_set_first_access:
 35628 000062C9 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0	; DPB.FATSIZE
 35629 000062CE 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 35630                                  					; FAT32
 35631 000062D0 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT_HW
 35632 000062D5 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 35633 000062DB 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 35634                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 35635 000062DD 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT
 35636                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 35637 000062E2 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 35638 000062E8 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 35639 000062EA 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+18h],1	; DPB.FIRST_ACCESS
 35640                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 35641 000062EF C3                      	retn
 35642                                  ;;;

 35657                                  FATERR:

 35659                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35660 000062F0 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1

 35664                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 35665 000062FA C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 35666                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 35667 000062FF B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 35668 00006301 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 35669 00006304 E8ECFB                  	call	FATAL1

 35672 0000630D 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 35673 0000630F F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 35674 00006310 C3                      	retn

 35676                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 35677                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35678 00006311 16                      	push	ss

 35680                                  	;mov	al,0Fh

 35685 0000631C C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 35686 00006321 C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0

 35688                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35689 00006327 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 35690 0000632B A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 35691 0000632E 06                      	PUSH	ES
 35692 0000632F 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 35693                                  
 35694                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 35695 00006330 BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 35696                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 35697                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35698 00006333 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 35699 00006337 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 35700 00006338 E849EE                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 35701                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35702 0000633B 16                      	push	ss
 35703 0000633C 1F                      	pop	ds

 35705 0000633E 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 35706                                  	;test	di,8000h
 35707                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 35708 00006342 09FF                    	or	di,di
 35709 00006344 78AA                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 35710 00006346 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35711                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 35712                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35713 00006348 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 35714 0000634C A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 35715                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 35716 0000634F 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 35717 00006353 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 35718 00006355 C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1
 35719 0000635A E9A500                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 35720                                  					; new volume label.
 35721                                  CHECK_BYT:

 35724                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK

 35726 00006361 7863                    	js	short NEWDSK
 35727                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35728                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 35729                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 35730

 35734                                  	; cf=0 (after 'or' instruction)
 35735                                  	;CLC
 35736 00006365 C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 35737                                  
 35738                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:
 35739 00006366 06                      	PUSH	ES
 35740 00006367 55                      	PUSH	BP
 35741                                  	;;les	bp,[es:bp+12h]
 35742                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0

 35744                                  	;;test	word [es:bp+4],800h

 35748 00006372 07                      	POP	ES

 35750 00006375 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save buffer pointer for ignore
 35751 00006376 57                      	PUSH	DI
 35752 00006377 16                      	push	ss			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 35753 00006378 1F                      	pop	ds
 35754                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 35755 00006379 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 35756 0000637E 06                      	PUSH	ES

 35758 00006383 8C06[2A03]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT+2],ES
 35759 00006387 07                      	POP	ES

 35761                                  	;mov	ax,0Fh
 35762 0000638C B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_I24_wrong_disk
 35763 0000638F C606[7505]01            	MOV	byte [READOP],1		; Write
 35764                                  	;invoke	HARDERR

 35767 00006398 1F                      	POP	DS
 35768 00006399 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3

 35770 0000639B 741C                    	JZ	short FAIL_OP
 35771 0000639D E971FF                  	JMP	FAT_GOT_DPB		; Retry
 35772                                  
 35773                                  CHKBUFFDIRT:
 35774                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35775                                  
 35776                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35777                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 35778                                  
 35779                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35780 000063A0 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0	; any dirty buffers ? ;hkn;

 35783                                  nbuffer:

 35791 000063B6 16                      	push	ss

 35795                                  	;clc
 35796 000063B8 C3                      	retn
 35797                                  
 35798                                  FAIL_OP:					; This label & code is here
 35799                                  	;Context DS				;  for reachability

 35801 000063BA 1F                      	pop	ds
 35802 000063BB F9                      	STC

 35813

 35817

 35821                                  
 35822                                  ; If no dirty buffers, assume Media changed
 35823                                  NEWDSK:

 35854

 36033                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 36034                                  ;; No other registers altered

 36039                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh

 36045                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 36046                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 36047                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP

 36116                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 36117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36118                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 36119                                  ; Inputs:
 36120                                  ;	 No Inputs
 36121                                  ; Function:
 36122                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 36123                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 36124                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 36125                                  ; Outputs:
 36126                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 36127                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 36128                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 36129                                  ; No other registers altered
 36130                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36131                                  
 36132                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36133                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36134                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36135                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36136                                  
 36137                                  GETCURHEAD:
 36138 000064A2 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 36139 000064A7 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 36140 000064AE 36893E[A512]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 36141 000064B3 C3                      	retn

 36369                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 36370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36371                                  ;
 36372                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 36373                                  ; Inputs:
 36374                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 36375                                  ; Function:
 36376                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 36377                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 36378                                  ;	   same segment
 36379                                  ;
 36380                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 36381                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 36382                                  ; No Registers altered
 36383                                  ;
 36384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36385                                  
 36386                                  POINTCOMP:

 36405                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 36406                                  
 36407                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 36408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36409                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 36410                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 36411                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 36412                                  ; 
 36413                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 36414                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 36415                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 36416                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 36417                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 36418                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 36419                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 36420                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 36421                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 36422                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 36423                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 36424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36425                                  
 36426                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 36427                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36428                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 36429                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 36430                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 36431                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 36432                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 36433                                  ; 
 36434                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 36435                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 36436                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 36437                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 36438                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 36439                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 36440                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 36441                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 36442                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 36443                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 36444                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 36445                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 36446                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36447

 36791                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>
 36792                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36793                                  ; Input:
 36794                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 36795                                  ;	AL = Physical unit number local buffers only
 36796                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers
 36797                                  ; Function:
 36798                                  ;	Write out all dirty buffers for unit, and flag them as clean
 36799                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 36800                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.

 36890                                  ;
 36891                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 36892                                  ;
 36893                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 36894                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 36895                                  ;
 36896                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 36897                                  ;
 36898                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36899                                  ;
 36900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36901                                  
 36902                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 36903                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36904 00006657 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 36905                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 36906 00006659 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 36907 0000665C 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 36908 0000665E 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 36909 00006660 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 36910                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 36911 00006662 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 36912 00006665 F8                      	CLC
 36913 00006666 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 36914                                  DOBUFFER:
 36915                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 36916 00006668 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 36917 0000666C 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 36918 0000666E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36919                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 36920 0000666F FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 36921 00006672 E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 36922 00006675 58                      	POP	AX
 36923 00006676 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 36924                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 36925 00006678 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 36926                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 36927 0000667B 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 36928                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 36929 0000667E 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 36930                                  checkflush_retn:
 36931 0000667F C3                      	retn

 37169                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 37170                                  ;============================================================================
 37171                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37172                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37173                                  
 37174                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 37175                                  
 37176                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 37177                                  
 37178                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 37179                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 37180                                  
 37181                                  ; =========================================================================
 37182                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 37183                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 37184                                  ;
 37185                                  ;	$WAIT
 37186                                  ;	$EXEC
 37187                                  ;	$Keep_process
 37188                                  ;	Stay_resident
 37189                                  ;	$EXIT
 37190                                  ;	$ABORT
 37191                                  ;	abort_inner
 37192                                  ;
 37193                                  ;	Modification history:
 37194                                  ;
 37195                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 37196                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 37197                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 37198                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 37199                                  ;
 37200                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 37201                                  ;
 37202                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 37203                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 37204                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 37205                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 37206                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 37207                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 37208                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 37209                                  ;
 37210                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 37211                                  ;
 37212                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 37213                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 37214                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 37215                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 37216                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 37217                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 37218                                  ;
 37219                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 37220                                  ;
 37221                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 37222                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 37223                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 37224                                  ;
 37225                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 37226                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 37227                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 37228                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 37229                                  ;
 37230                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 37231                                  ;
 37232                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 37233                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 37234                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 37235                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 37236                                  ;
 37237                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 37238                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 37239                                  ;		       UMBs.
 37240                                  ;
 37241                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 37242                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 37243                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 37244                                  ;
 37245                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 37246                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 37247                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 37248                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 37249                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 37250                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 37251                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 37252                                  ;
 37253                                  ; =========================================================================
 37254                                  
 37255                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 37256                                  
 37257                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 37258                                  ; =========================================================================
 37259                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 37260                                  ;
 37261                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 37262                                  ;
 37263                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 37264                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 37265                                  ;
 37266                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 37267                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 37268                                  ;	USES	all
 37269                                  ; =========================================================================
 37270                                  
 37271                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37272                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37273                                  
 37274                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37275                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 37276                                  _$WAIT:
 37277                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37278                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 37279                                  
 37280 0000673D 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 37281 0000673F 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 37282 00006744 E9299F                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 37283                                  
 37284                                  ; =========================================================================
 37285                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 37286                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 37287                                  ;
 37288                                  ;
 37289                                  ; Assembler usage:
 37290                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 37291                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 37292                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 37293                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 37294                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 37295                                  ;
 37296                                  ;	AL  Function
 37297                                  ;	--  --------
 37298                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 37299                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 37300                                  ;	    begin execution.
 37301                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 37302                                  ;
 37303                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 37304                                  ;
 37305                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37306                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 37307                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 37308                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37309                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 37310                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 37311                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37312                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 37313                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 37314                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37315                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 37316                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 37317                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37318                                  ;
 37319                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 37320                                  ;
 37321                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37322                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 37323                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 37324                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37325                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 37326                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 37327                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37328                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 37329                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 37330                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37331                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 37332                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 37333                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37334                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 37335                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 37336                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37337                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 37338                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 37339                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37340                                  ;
 37341                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 37342                                  ;
 37343                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37344                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 37345                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 37346                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37347                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 37348                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 37349                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 37350                                  ;
 37351                                  ; Returns:
 37352                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 37353                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 37354                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 37355                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 37356                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 37357                                  ; =========================================================================
 37358                                  ;
 37359                                  ;   Revision history:
 37360                                  ;
 37361                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37362                                  ;
 37363                                  ; =========================================================================
 37364                                  
 37365                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 37366                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 37367                                  
 37368                                  ; =========================================================================
 37369                                  
 37370                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 37371                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 37372                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 37373                                  ;%out
 37374                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 37375                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 37376                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 37377                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 37378                                  ;ENDIF

 37388
