 37391                                  	
 37392                                  _$EXEC:
 37393                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37394                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 37395                                  
 37396                                  EXEC001S:
 37397                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 37398                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 37399                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 37400                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 37401                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 37402                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 37403                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 37404                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 37405                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 37406                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 37407                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 37408                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 37409                                  	;
 37410                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 37411                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 37412                                  
 37413                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37414                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 37415                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 37416                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 37417                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 37418                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 37419                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 37420                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 37421                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 37422                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 37423                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 37424                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 37425                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 37426                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 37427                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 37428                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 37429                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 37430                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 37431                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 37432                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37433                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 37434                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 37435                                  	
 37436                                  	; ==================================================================
 37437                                  	; validate function
 37438                                  	; ==================================================================
 37439                                  		      	
 37440                                  	; M068 - Start
 37441                                  	;
 37442                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 37443                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 37444                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 37445                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 37446                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 37447                                  
 37448                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37449 00006747 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 37450                                  
 37451                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 37452                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 37453                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 37454                                  
 37455 0000674D 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 37456                                  	;jne	short @f
 37457 0000674F 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 37458                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 37459 00006751 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 37460 00006752 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 37461 00006755 51                      	push	cx
 37462                                  ;@@:
 37463                                  Exec_@f:
 37464                                  	; M068 - End
 37465                                  	
 37466                                  	;Enter
 37467                                  
 37468 00006756 55                      	push	bp
 37469 00006757 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37470                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 37471                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 37472                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 37473                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37474                                  	; 20/05/2019
 37475 00006759 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 37476                                  
 37477                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37478 0000675C 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 37479                                  					; M030
 37480 0000675E 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 37481                                  
 37482                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37483                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 37484                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 37485                                  
 37486                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 37487 00006760 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 37488                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 37489                                  	;mov	al,1
 37490 00006766 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 37491                                  
 37492                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 37493                                  	;Leave
 37494 00006768 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 37495 0000676A 5D                      	pop	bp

 37497 0000676B E90C9F                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 37498                                  
 37499                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 37502 00006771 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 37503

 37506 00006776 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 37507

 37510 0000677A 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun

 37513 0000677E 74EE                    	je	short ExecReadyJ	; M028

 37533                                  
 37534                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 37537                                  
 37538 000067A3 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL			; open for reading
 37539 000067A5 55                      	push	BP
 37540                                  
 37541                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37542                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 37543 000067A6 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to 
 37544                                  					; the redir that this open call is
 37545                                  					; due to an exec.
 37546                                  
 37547                                  	;invoke	$OPEN			; is the file there?
 37548 000067AC E80513                  	call	_$OPEN
 37549                                  
 37550                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37551 000067AF 9C                      	pushf

 37558

 37602                                  	;mov	ax,[44]
 37603 000067F3 A12C00                  	mov	AX,[PDB.ENVIRON]
 37604                                  
 37605                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 37606                                  ;---------------------------------------------BUG 92 4/30/90-----------------
 37607                                  ;
 37608                                  ; Exec_environ is being correctly initialized after the environment has been
 37609                                  ; allocated and copied form the parent's env. It must not be initialized here.
 37610                                  ; Because if the call to $alloc below fails Exec_dealloc will deallocate the
 37611                                  ; parent's environment.
 37612                                  ;	mov	Exec_Environ,AX
 37613                                  ;
 37614                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37615                                  
 37616                                  	;mov	[bp-14],ax
 37617                                  	;mov	Exec_Environ,ax
 37618

 37620 000067F8 743D                    	jz	short Exec_Read_Header

 37622                                  Exec_Scan_Env:
 37623 000067FA 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 37624 000067FC 31FF                    	xor	DI,DI
 37625                                  	;mov	cx,7FFFh ; MSDOS 3.3
 37626 000067FE B90080                  	mov	CX,8000h ; MSDOS 6.0	; at most 32k of environment ;M040
 37627 00006801 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 37628                                  
 37629                                  Exec_Get_Environ_Len:
 37630 00006803 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find that nul byte
 37631 00006805 75C9                    	jnz	short BadEnv
 37632                                  
 37633 00006807 49                      	dec	CX			; Dec CX for the next nul byte test
 37634 00006808 78C6                    	js	short BadEnv		; gone beyond the end of the environment
 37635                                  
 37636 0000680A AE                      	scasb				; is there another nul byte?
 37637 0000680B 75F6                    	jnz	short Exec_Get_Environ_Len ; no, scan some more
 37638                                  
 37639 0000680D 57                      	push	DI
 37640                                  	;lea	bx,[DI+11h]
 37641 0000680E 8D5D11                  	lea	BX,[DI+0Fh+2]
 37642                                  	;add	bx,[bp-22]
 37643 00006811 035EEA                  	add	BX,ExecNameLen		; BX <- length of environment
 37644                                  					; remember argv[0] length
 37645                                  					; round up and remember argc

 37666 00006825 31F6                    	xor	SI,SI
 37667 00006827 89F7                    	mov	DI,SI
 37668 00006829 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; copy the environment
 37669 0000682B B80100                  	mov	AX,1
 37670 0000682E AB                      	stosw
 37671                                  	;lds	si,[bp-26]
 37672 0000682F C576E6                  	lds	SI,ExecName
 37673                                  	;mov	cx,[bp-22]
 37674 00006832 8B4EEA                  	mov	CX,ExecNameLen

 37677                                  Exec_Read_Header:
 37678                                  	; We read in the program header into the above data area and

 37680

 38944                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38945                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 38946                                  ;
 38947                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 38948                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 38949                                  ;
 38950                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 38951                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 38952                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 38953                                  ;
 38954                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38955                                  
 38956                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38957                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38958                                  
 38959                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38960                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 38961                                  
 38962                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 38963 00006D6D 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 38964                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 38965 00006D6E 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 38966 00006D74 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 38967 00006D79 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 38968 00006D7C 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 38969                                  
 38970 00006D7E BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 38971                                  
 38972                                  Keep_Shrink:
 38973 00006D81 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 38974 00006D83 53                      	push	BX
 38975 00006D84 06                      	push	ES
 38976 00006D85 E82E02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 38977 00006D88 1F                      	pop	DS
 38978 00006D89 5B                      	pop	BX
 38979 00006D8A 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 38980                                  
 38981 00006D8C 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 38982 00006D8E 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 38983                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 38984 00006D90 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 38985                                  
 38986                                  Keep_Done:
 38987 00006D93 58                      	pop	AX
 38988 00006D94 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 38989                                  
 38990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38991                                  ;
 38992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38993                                  
 38994                                  STAY_RESIDENT:
 38995                                  	;mov	ax,3100h
 38996 00006D96 B80031                  	mov	AX,(KEEP_PROCESS<<8)+0 ; Lower part is return code;PBUGBUG
 38997 00006D99 83C20F                  	add	DX,15
 38998 00006D9C D1DA                    	rcr	DX,1
 38999 00006D9E B103                    	mov	CL,3
 39000 00006DA0 D3EA                    	shr	DX,CL

 39002 00006DA2 E94C95                  	jmp	COMMAND

 39022                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h
 39023 00006DA5 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH
 39024 00006DA7 368626[4D03]            	xchg	AH,[SS:DidCTRLC]
 39025 00006DAC 08E4                    	or	AH,AH
 39026                                  	;mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 39027 00006DAE 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_TERMINATE
 39028 00006DB4 7406                    	jz	short exit_inner

 39030 00006DB6 36C606[7C05]01          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_CTRL_C
 39031

 39033                                  exit_inner:

 39035

 39039 00006DC7 EB08                    	jmp	short abort_inner
 39040                                  
 39041                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 39042                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39043                                  ; Inputs:
 39044                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 39045                                  ; Function:
 39046                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 39047                                  ;	to the terminate address
 39048                                  ; Returns:
 39049                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 39050                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39051                                  
 39052                                  _$ABORT:
 39053 00006DC9 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 39054                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 39055                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 39056 00006DCB 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 39057                                  
 39058                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 39059                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 39060                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 39061                                  
 39062                                  abort_inner:
 39063 00006DD1 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 39064 00006DD6 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 39065 00006DDA E89A96                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 39066                                  
 39067                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 39068 00006DDD 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 39069 00006DE0 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39070 00006DE2 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 39071                                  	;mov	si,10
 39072 00006DE4 BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 39073                                  	;mov	di,88h
 39074 00006DE7 BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 39075 00006DEA A5                      	movsw
 39076 00006DEB A5                      	movsw
 39077 00006DEC A5                      	movsw
 39078 00006DED A5                      	movsw
 39079 00006DEE A5                      	movsw
 39080 00006DEF A5                      	movsw
 39081 00006DF0 E90AF2                  	jmp	reset_environment
 39082

 39166                                  ;INCLUDE DOSSEG.ASM

 39179                                  ;NAME Alloc
 39180                                  
 39181                                  ;SUBTTL memory allocation utility routines
 39182                                  ;PAGE
 39183                                  ;
 39184                                  ; arena data
 39185                                  ;
 39186                                  ;       i_need  arena_head,WORD         ; seg address of start of arena
 39187                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 39188                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 39189                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found
 39190                                  ;       i_need  LastArena,WORD          ; last free block found
 39191                                  ;       i_need  AllocMethod,BYTE        ; how to alloc first(best)last
 39192                                  
 39193                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 39194                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39195                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 39196                                  ;
 39197                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 39198                                  ;	EXIT	none
 39199                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 39200                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39201                                  
 39202                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39203                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39204                                  
 39205                                  arena_free_process:
 39206                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39207                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39208 00006DF4 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 39209                                  arena_free_process_start:
 39210 00006DF8 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 39211                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 39212 00006DFB E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 39213                                  
 39214                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 39215                                          ;retc
 39216 00006DFE 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 39217 00006E00 06                      	PUSH    ES
 39218 00006E01 1F                              POP     DS
 39219                                  	;cmp	[1],bx 
 39220 00006E02 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 39221 00006E06 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 39222                                  	;mov	[1],di
 39223 00006E08 893E0100                        MOV     [ARENA.OWNER],DI	; yes... free him
 39224                                  
 39225                                  arena_free_next:
 39226                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ;'Z'
 39227 00006E0C 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 39228                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 39229                                          ;retz				; never come back no more

 39253                                  ;	BREAK	<Arena Helper Routines>
 39254                                  
 39255                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 39256                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39257                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 39258                                  ;		(di) = 0
 39259                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 39260                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 39261                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39262                                  
 39263                                  arena_next:
 39264 00006E27 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 39265 00006E29 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 39266 00006E2D 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 39267                                  
 39268                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 39269                                  ;
 39270                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 39271                                  ;       RETN
 39272                                  
 39273                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 39274                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39275                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 39276                                  ;		(di) = 0
 39277                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 39278                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 39279                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 39280                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 39281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39282                                  
 39283                                  check_signature:        
 39284                                  
 39285 00006E2E 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 39286                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 39287 00006E30 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 39288                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 39289 00006E34 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 39290                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 39291 00006E36 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 39292                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 39293 00006E3A 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 39294 00006E3C F9                              STC                             ; set error
 39295                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 39296                                  AFP_RETN:
 39297                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 39298                                  check_signature_ok:
 39299                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 39300 00006E3D C3                      	RETN
 39301                                  
 39302                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 39303                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39304                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 39305                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 39306                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 39307                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 39308                                  ;
 39309                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 39310                                  ;		(di) = 0
 39311                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39312                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 39313                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 39314                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 39315                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 39316                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39317                                          
 39318                                  Coalesce:
 39319                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 39320 00006E3E 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 39321                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 39322                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 39323 00006E41 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 39324 00006E43 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 39325                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 39326 00006E46 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 39327                                  
 39328                                  coalesce_check:
 39329                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 39330 00006E48 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 39331                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 39332 00006E4D 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 39333                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 39334 00006E4F 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 39335 00006E54 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 39336                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 39337 00006E55 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 39338 00006E59 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 39339 00006E5C 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 39340 00006E5E EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 39341                                  
 39342                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39343                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 39344                                  
 39345                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 39346                                  
 39347                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39349                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 39350                                  ;
 39351                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 39352                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 39353                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 39354                                  ;
 39355                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 39356                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 39357                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 39358                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 39359                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 39360                                  ;
 39361                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 39362                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 39363                                  ;
 39364                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39365                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 39366                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 39367                                  ;           INT     21h
 39368                                  ;
 39369                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 39370                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 39371                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 39372                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 39373                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 39374                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 39375                                  ;
 39376                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 39377                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 39378                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 39379                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 39380                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 39381                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 39382                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 39383                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 39384                                  ;	USES	All
 39385                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39386                                  
 39387                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39388                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39389                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 39390                                  ;
 39391                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39392                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 39393                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 39394                                  ;           INT     21h
 39395                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 39396                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 39397                                  ;
 39398                                  ;   Description:
 39399                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 39400                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 39401                                  ;
 39402                                  ;   Error return:
 39403                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 39404                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 39405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39406                                  
 39407                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39408                                  
 39409                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 39723                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 39724                                  
 39725                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39727                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 39728                                  ;
 39729                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 39730                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 39731                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 39732                                  ;
 39733                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 39734                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 39735                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 39736                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 39737                                  ;
 39738                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 39739                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 39740                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 39741                                  ;		code.
 39742                                  ;
 39743                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 39744                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 39745                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 39746                                  ;
 39747                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39748                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39749                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 39750                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 39751                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 39752                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 39753                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 39754                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 39755                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39756                                  
 39757                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39758                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39759                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 39760                                  ;
 39761                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39762                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 39763                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 39764                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 39765                                  ;           INT     21h
 39766                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 39767                                  ;         size possible
 39768                                  ;   Error return:
 39769                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 39770                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 39771                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 39772                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 39773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39774                                  
 39775                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 39776                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39777                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 39778 00006FB6 E830A9                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 39779                                  
 39780 00006FB9 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 39781 00006FBC 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 39782 00006FBE 48                              DEC     AX
 39783 00006FBF E86CFE                          CALL    check_signature
 39784 00006FC2 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 39785                                  
 39786                                  setblock_bad:
 39787 00006FC4 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 39788                                  
 39789                                  setblock_grab:
 39790 00006FC7 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 39791 00006FC9 E872FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 39792 00006FCC 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 39793 00006FCE 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 39794 00006FD2 51                              PUSH    CX
 39795 00006FD3 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 39796 00006FD5 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 39797 00006FD7 E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 39869                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 39870                                  
 39871                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 39872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39873                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 39874                                  ;
 39875                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39876                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 39877                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 39878                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 39879                                  ;           INT     21h
 39880                                  ;
 39881                                  ;	ENTRY	
 39882                                  ;		(al) = 0
 39883                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 39884                                  ;
 39885                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 39886                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 39887                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 39888                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 39889                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 39890                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 39891                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 39892                                  ;
 39893                                  ;		(al) = 2
 39894                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 39895                                  ;
 39896                                  ;		(al) = 3
 39897                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 39898                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 39899                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 39900                                  ;
 39901                                  ;
 39902                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 39903                                  ;
 39904                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 39905                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 39906                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 39907                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 39908                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 39909                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 39910                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 39911                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 39912                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 39913                                  ;
 39914                                  ;		'C' set if error
 39915                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 39916                                  ;
 39917                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 39918                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 39919                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 39920                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 39921                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 39922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39923                                  
 39924                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 39925                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39926                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 39927                                  ;
 39928                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39929                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 39930                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 39931                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 39932                                  ;           INT     21h
 39933                                  ;
 39934                                  ;   Error return:
 39935                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 39936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39937                                  
 39938                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 39940                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 40102                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 40103                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40104                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 40105                                  ;
 40106                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 40107                                  ;
 40108                                  ;
 40109                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 40110                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 40111                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 40112                                  ;		   else
 40113                                  ;			DS = last arena
 40114                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 40115                                  ;
 40116                                  ;		   CY if error
 40117                                  ;
 40118                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 40119                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40120                                  
 40121                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40122                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 40123                                  
 40124                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40125                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 40126                                  	
 40127                                  GetLastArena:
 40128 0000709A 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 40129                                  
 40130 0000709B 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 40131 0000709F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 40132 000070A1 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 40133                                  
 40134 000070A3 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 40135                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 40136 000070A7 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 40137                                  					
 40138                                  GLA_next:
 40139 000070A9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 40140 000070AB E879FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 40141                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40142                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 40143                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40144 000070AE 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 40145                                  
 40146 000070B0 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 40147 000070B6 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 40148                                  					;    umb_head
 40149                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 40150                                  
 40151 000070B8 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 40152                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 40153 000070BC EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 40154                                  GLA_chkumb:
 40155 000070BE 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 40156                                  GLA_@f:
 40157 000070C0 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 40158                                  
 40159                                  GLA_done:
 40160                                  					; M061 - Start
 40161 000070C2 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 40162 000070C8 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 40163                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 40164                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 40165 000070CA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 40166 000070CC E858FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 40167                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 40168 000070CF 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 40169 000070D1 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 40170 000070D3 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 40171                                  					; M061 - End
 40172                                  GLA_ret:

 40245                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 40246                                  
 40247                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40248                                  ;
 40249                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 40250                                  ;
 40251                                  ; Inputs:
 40252                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 40253                                  ; Function:
 40254                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 40255                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 40256                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 40257                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 40258                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 40259                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 40260                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 40261                                  ;			CX User Index
 40262                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 40263                                  ;			BX = UID
 40264                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 40265                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 40266                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 40267                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 40268                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 40269                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 40270                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 40271                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 40272                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 40273                                  ;
 40274                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40275                                  
 40276                                  _$ServerCall:

 40588                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 40589                                  
 40590                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 40591                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40592                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 40593                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 40594                                  ;
 40595                                  ;	NOTE:
 40596                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 40597                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 40598                                  ;
 40599                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 40600                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 40601                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 40602                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40603                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 40604                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 40605                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40606                                  
 40607                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40608                                  
 40609                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 40610                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40611                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 40612 0000722D 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 40613                                  	
 40614                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 40615 00007232 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 40616                                  
 40617                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 40618 00007237 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 40619 0000723C 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 40620                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40621                                  	;mov	al,6
 40622 0000723E B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 40623                                  ReturnCarry:
 40624 00007240 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 40625 00007241 C3                      	retn				; go back
 40626                                  pjfn10: 
 40627                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 40628 00007242 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 40629 00007247 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 40630                                  	;clc
 40631                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 40632 00007249 C3                      	retn
 40633                                  
 40634                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 40635                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40636                                  ;
 40637                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 40638                                  ;
 40639                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 40640                                  ;
 40641                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 40642                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 40643                                  ;                   AX has error code
 40644                                  ;               Carry Reset
 40645                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 40646                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 40647                                  ; NOTE:
 40648                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 40649                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 40650                                  ;
 40651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40652                                  
 40653                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40654                                  
 40655                                  SFFromHandle:
 40656 0000724A E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 40657                                  	;retc				; return if error
 40658 0000724D 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 40659 0000724F 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 40660                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 40661                                  	;;mov	al,6
 40662                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 40663                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 40664                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40665                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40666 00007253 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 40667                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF

 40671                                  GetSF:

 40675 0000725B E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot

 40677 0000725F C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye

 40679                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 40680                                  
 40681                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 40682                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40683                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 40684                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 40685                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 40686                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 40687                                  ;
 40688                                  ;   NOTE:
 40689                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 40690                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 40691                                  ;
 40692                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 40693                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 40694                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 40695                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 40696                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 40697                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40698                                  
 40699                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40700                                  
 40701                                  SFFromSFN:
 40702                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40703                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 40704 00007260 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 40705                                  
 40706                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 40707 00007265 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 40708                                  sfsfn5:	
 40709                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 40710 0000726A 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 40711 0000726E 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 40712                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 40713 00007270 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 40714 00007274 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 40715                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 40716 00007277 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 40717 0000727A 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 40718 0000727C F9                      	STC
 40719 0000727D C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 40720                                  sfsfn7:
 40721 0000727E 50                      	push	ax
 40722                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 40723                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 40724                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 40725                                  	
 40726                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40727 0000727F B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 40728                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40729                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 40730                                  	
 40731 00007281 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 40732 00007283 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 40733 00007285 58                      	pop	ax
 40734                                  	;add	di,6
 40735 00007286 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 40736 00007289 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 40737                                  
 40738                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 40739                                  
 40740                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 40741                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40742                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 40743                                  ;
 40744                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 40745                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 40746                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 40747                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 40748                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40749                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 40750                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 40751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40752                                  
 40753                                  JFNFree:
 40754 0000728A 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 40755                                  jfnf1:	
 40756 0000728C E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 40757 0000728F 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 40758 00007291 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 40759 00007295 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 40760 00007297 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 40761 00007298 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 40762                                  
 40763                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 40764                                  jfnf5:	
 40765                                  	;mov	al,4
 40766 0000729A B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 40767                                  jfnfx:	
 40768 0000729C C3                      	retn				; bye
 40769                                  
 40770                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 40771                                  
 40772                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 40773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40774                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 40775                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 40776                                  ;
 40777                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 40778                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 40779                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 40780                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 40781                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 40782                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 40783                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 40784                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 40785                                  ;
 40786                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 40787                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 40788                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 40789                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 40790                                  ;
 40791                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 40792                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 40793                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 40794                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 40795                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 40796                                  ;		'C' set if error
 40797                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 40798                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 40799                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40800                                  
 40801                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40802                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40803                                  
 40804                                  SFNFree:
 40805                                  	; 12/08/2018
 40806                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40807                                  	;
 40808                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40809 0000729D 50                      	push	ax
 40810 0000729E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 40811                                  sfnf5:	
 40812 000072A0 53                      	push	bx
 40813 000072A1 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 40814 000072A4 5B                      	pop	bx
 40815 000072A5 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 40816 000072A7 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0

 40834

 40836 000072B6 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 40837                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 40838 000072BA 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 40839 000072BE 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 40840 000072C0 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]

 40842 000072C4 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 40843 000072C8 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 40844                                  
 40845                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 40846                                  ;
 40847                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 40848                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 40849                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 40850                                  
 40851                                  sfnf20:
 40852                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 40853                                  
 40854                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 40855 000072CA 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 40856                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 40857                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 40858                                  
 40859 000072CF 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]

 40861 000072D3 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax

 40894                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>

 40896                                  ;
 40897                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 40898                                  ;
 40899                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 40900                                  ;		path
 40901                                  ;
 40902                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 40903                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 40904                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 40905                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 40906                                  ;
 40907                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 40908                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 40909                                  ;	USES	all
 40910                                  ;
 40911                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40912                                  
 40913                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40914                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40915                                  
 40916                                  _$CLOSE:
 40917                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 40918                                  
 40919 000072E5 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 40920 000072E8 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 40921 000072EA 16                      	push	ss
 40922 000072EB 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 40923 000072EC 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 40924 000072F0 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 40925                                  
 40926                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 40927                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 40928                                  ;
 40929                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 40930                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 40931                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 40932                                  
 40933                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 40934 000072F4 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 40935 000072F8 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 40936                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 40937 000072FA 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 40938                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 40939 000072FE 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 40940                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 40941 00007300 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 40942 00007302 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 40943                                  
 40944                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 40945                                  ; -1.
 40946                                  
 40947                                  FreeJFN:

 40949 00007307 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 40950                                  PostFree:
 40951                                  
 40952                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 40953                                  
 40954 0000730B E819C4                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 40955                                  
 40956                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 40957                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!

 40963                                  CloseOk:
