 41646                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 41647                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41648                                  ;
 41649                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41650                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 41651                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 41652                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 41653                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 41654                                  ;   Errors:
 41655                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 41656                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 41657                                  ;
 41658                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41659                                  
 41660                                  _$DUP:
 41661 00007516 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; save away old handle in AX
 41662 00007518 E86FFD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX
 41663                                  DupErrorCheck:
 41664 0000751B 72A8                    	JC	short DupErr		; nope, bye
 41665 0000751D 06                      	push	es
 41666 0000751E 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 41667 0000751F 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 41668 00007520 1F                      	pop	ds
 41669 00007521 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 41670 00007522 E81D00                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 41671 00007525 729E                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 41672 00007527 E89BBB                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 41673 0000752A E800FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 41674 0000752D 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 41675 00007530 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT
 41676                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41677                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; and go home
 41678 00007532 EBD5                    	jmp	short ok_ret
 41679                                  
 41680                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41681                                  ;DupErr:
 41682                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41683                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 41684                                  	;jmp	short ft_error
 41685                                  
 41686                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 41687                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41688                                  ;
 41689                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41690                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 41691                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 41692                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 41693                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 41694                                  ;   Error returns:
 41695                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 41696                                  ;
 41697                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41698                                  
 41699                                  _$DUP2:
 41700 00007534 53                      	push	bx
 41701 00007535 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 41702 00007536 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 41703 00007538 E8AAFD                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 41704 0000753B 5B                      	pop	bx
 41705 0000753C 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 41706 0000753D E8EDFC                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 41707 00007540 EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 41708                                  
 41709                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 41710                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41711                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 41712                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 41713                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 41714                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 41715                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 41716                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 41717                                  ;
 41718                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 41719                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 41720                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 41721                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 41722                                  ;	USES	none
 41723                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41724                                  
 41725                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41726                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41727                                  CheckOwner:
 41728                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41729                                  
 41730 00007542 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 41731 00007545 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 41732                                  
 41733 00007547 50                      	push	ax
 41734                                  
 41735                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 41736

 41738                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 41742 00007550 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag

 41744

 41747                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 41748 00007558 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 41749                                  
 41750                                  _skip_win386:
 41751 0000755C 58                      	pop	ax

 41754 0000755D 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label

 41772                                  
 41773                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 41774                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 41775                                  
 41776                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 41777                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 41778                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 41779                                  
 41780                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 41781                                  ;
 41782                                  ;	$AssignOper
 41783                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 41784                                  ;	InitCDS
 41785                                  ;	$UserOper
 41786                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 41787                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 41788                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 41789                                  ;
 41790                                  ;   Revision history:
 41791                                  ;
 41792                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 41793                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 41794                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 41795                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 41796                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 41797                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 41798                                  ;				    aliasing.
 41799                                  ;
 41800                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 41801                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 41802                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 41803                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 41804                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 41805                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 41806                                  ;
 41807                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 41808                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 41809                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 41810                                  ;
 41811                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 41812                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 41813                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 41814                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 41815                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 41816                                  ;
 41817                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 41818                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 41819                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 41820                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 41821                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 41822                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 41823                                  ;
 41824                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 41825                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 41826                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 41827                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 41828                                  ;   number.
 41829                                  ;
 41830                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 41831                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 41832                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 41833                                  ;   TransPath.
 41834                                  ;
 41835                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 41836                                  
 41837                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 41838                                  
 41839                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 41840                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 41841                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 41842                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 41843                                  ;					; current drive)
 41844                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 41845                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 41846                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 41847                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 41848                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 41849                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 41850                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 41851                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 41852                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 41854                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 41855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41856                                  ; Inputs:
 41857                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 41858                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 41859                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 41860                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 41861                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 41862                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 41863                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 41864                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 41865                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 41866                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 41867                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 41868                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 41869                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 41870                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 41871                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 41872                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 41873                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 41874                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 41875                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 41876                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,

 41878                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 41879                                  ; Returns:
 41880                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return

 42050                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 42051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42052                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 42053                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 42054                                  ;
 42055                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 42056                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 42057                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 42058                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 42059                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 42060                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 42061                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 42062                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 42063                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 42064                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 42065                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word

 42326                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 42327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42328                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 42329                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 42330                                  ;
 42331                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 42332                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 42333                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 42334                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 42335                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 42336                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 42337                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 42338                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42339                                  
 42340                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42341                                  TransFCB:
 42342                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42343                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42344                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 42345                                  	;ENTER

 42351 000076EA 07                      	pop	es
 42352 000076EB 06                      	push	es

 42355                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp

 42420                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 42421                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42422                                  ;
 42423                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 42424                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 42425                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 42426                                  ;       exactly.
 42427                                  ;
 42428                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 42429                                  ;       matches splice.
 42430                                  ;
 42431                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 42432                                  ;
 42433                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 42434                                  ;
 42435                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 42436                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 42437                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 42438                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 42439                                  ;
 42440                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 42441                                  ;
 42442                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 42443                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 42444                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 42445                                  ;
 42446                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 42447                                  ;
 42448                                  ;       if fSharing then
 42449                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 42450                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 42451                                  ;           splice
 42452                                  ;           fatRead
 42453                                  ;           return
 42454                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 42455                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 42456                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 42457                                  ;           return
 42458                                  ;       if device then
 42459                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 42460                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 42461                                  ;           return
 42462                                  ;       if file then
 42463                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 42464                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 42465                                  ;           Copy current dir
 42466                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 42467                                  ;           splice
 42468                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 42469                                  ;           if local then
 42470                                  ;               fatread
 42471                                  ;           return
 42472                                  ;
 42473                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 42474                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 42475                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 42476                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 42477                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 42478                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 42479                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 42480                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 42481                                  ;
 42482                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42483                                  
 42484                                  ; 22/05/2019
 42485                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42486                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42487                                  
 42488                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42489                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42490                                  
 42491                                  TransPath:
 42492 00007745 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 42493 00007747 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 42494                                  TransPathSet:
 42495 00007749 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 42496                                  SetSplice:

 42499                                  TransPathNoSet:

 42501 00007755 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 42502 0000775B 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 42503 00007760 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 42504 00007767 16                      	push	ss
 42505 00007768 07                      	pop	es
 42506                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 42507 00007769 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 42508                                  ;
 42509                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 42510                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 42511                                  ;
 42512 0000776D 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 42513 00007773 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 42514                                  ;
 42515                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 42516                                  ;
 42517 00007775 E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 42518 00007778 E8F3FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 42519 0000777B 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 42520 0000777D E80A03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 42521 00007780 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 42522 00007783 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 42523 00007786 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 42524                                  ;
 42525                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 42526                                  ;
 42527 00007788 16                      	push	ss
 42528 00007789 1F                      	pop	ds
 42529 0000778A 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 42530 0000778E F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 42531 00007793 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 42532 00007795 E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 42533                                  NoServerSplice:
 42534 00007798 16                      	push	ss
 42535 00007799 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 42536 0000779A C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 42537 0000779E E848A1                  	call	ECritDisk
 42538 000077A1 E8CEEA                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 42539 000077A4 E86FA1                  	call	LCritDisk
 42540                                  NoPath:
 42541                                  	;mov	al,3
 42542 000077A7 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 42543 000077A9 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 42544                                  
 42545                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 42546                                  ; the name if so.
 42547                                  
 42548                                  CheckUNC:
 42549 000077AA 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 42550                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 42551 000077B1 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 42552 000077B4 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 42553                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 42554                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 42555                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 42556 000077B6 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 42557                                  
 42558                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 42559                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 42560                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 42561                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 42562                                  
 42563                                  NO_CHECK:
 42564 000077B8 E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 42565 000077BB 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 42566 000077BC 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 42567 000077BE E877E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 42568 000077C1 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 42569 000077C3 E872E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 42570 000077C6 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 42571 000077C8 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 42572 000077CA 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 42573                                  
 42574                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 42575                                  ; local machine root path

 42578 000077CD A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 42579                                  UNCCpy:
 42580 000077CE AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 42581 000077CF E811E4                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 42582 000077D2 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL

 42586 000077DB AA                      	STOSB

 42593                                  UNCTerm:

 42595 000077E5 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;

 42597                                  CheckDevice:
 42598                                  
 42599                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 42600                                  
 42601 000077E7 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 42602 000077E8 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 42603 000077EB 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 42604                                  	;mov	al,2 
 42605 000077ED B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 42606 000077EF F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 42607 000077F0 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 42608                                  CheckPath:
 42609 000077F1 50                      	push	ax
 42610 000077F2 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 42611                                  
 42612                                  
 42613                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42614                                  %if 0
 42615                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 42616                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 42617                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 42618                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 42619                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 42620                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 42621                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 42622                                  ;;;
 42623                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 42624                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 42625                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 42626                                  ;;;
 42627                                  ;;;More info:
 42628                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 42629                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 42630                                  ;;;
 42631                                  	call	no5Dshere
 42632                                  start5Dhack:
 42633                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 42634                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 42635                                  
 42636                                  %endif
 42637                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42638                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 42639 000077F3 E83AD6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 42640                                  
 42641 000077F6 5D                      	pop	bp
 42642 000077F7 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 42643 000077F8 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 42644                                  
 42645                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 42646                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 42647                                  ; call.
 42648                                  
 42649 000077FA 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 42650 00007800 E86BFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 42651 00007803 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 42652                                  
 42653                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 42654                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 42655                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 42656                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 42657                                  ; a device.
 42658                                  
 42659 00007809 E87E02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 42660 0000780C B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 42661 0000780E AA                      	STOSB
 42662 0000780F E89D9F                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 42663                                  
 42664 00007812 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 42665 00007813 16                      	push	ss
 42666 00007814 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 42667                                  DoFile_retn:
 42668 00007815 C3                      	retn
 42669                                  
 42670                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42671                                  %if 0
 42672                                  
 42673                                  no5Dshere:
 42674                                  	; 10/08/2018
 42675                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 42676                                  %endif
 42677                                  
 42678                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 42679                                  
 42680                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 42681                                  
 42682                                  DoFile:
 42683                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 42684                                  
 42685 00007816 E839FE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 42686                                  	;mov	al,3 
 42687 00007819 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 42688 0000781B 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 42689                                  
 42690                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 42691                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 42692                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 42693                                  
 42694                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 42695 0000781D 1E                      	push	ds
 42696 0000781E 56                      	push	si
 42697 0000781F 06                      	push	es
 42698 00007820 57                      	push	di
 42699 00007821 E850D5                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 42700                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 42701 00007824 5F                      	pop	di
 42702 00007825 07                      	pop	es
 42703 00007826 5E                      	pop	si
 42704 00007827 1F                      	pop	ds
 42705                                  	;mov	al,3
 42706 00007828 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 42707                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 42708 0000782A 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 42709                                  
 42710                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 42711                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 42712                                  
 42713 0000782C 1E                      	push	ds
 42714 0000782D 56                      	push	si
 42715 0000782E 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 42716 00007833 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 42717                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 42718 00007835 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 42719                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 42720 00007838 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 42721                                  					;AN000;
 42722 0000783C E87F9F                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 42723 0000783F 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 42724                                  
 42725                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 42726                                  
 42727 00007840 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 42728 00007842 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 42729 00007846 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 42730 00007848 AA                      	STOSB
 42731                                  
 42732                                  ; Now get original string.
 42733                                  
 42734                                  GetOrig:
 42735 00007849 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 42736 0000784A 5E                      	pop	si
 42737 0000784B 1F                      	pop	ds
 42738                                  
 42739                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 42740                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 42741                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 42743 0000784C E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 42744 0000784F 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 42745 00007851 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 42746 00007853 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 42747                                  ;
 42748                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 42749                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 42750                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 42751                                  ;
 42752 00007855 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 42753                                  SkipPath:
 42754 00007857 AC                      	LODSB
 42755 00007858 E8DDE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 42756 0000785B 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 42757 0000785D 4E                      	DEC     SI
 42758 0000785E 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 42759 00007860 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 42760                                  
 42761                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 42762                                  ; for yucks.
 42763                                  
 42764                                  PathAssure:
 42765 00007862 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 42766 00007864 AA                      	STOSB
 42767                                  
 42768                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 42769                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 42770                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 42771                                  
 42772                                  DoCanon:
 42773 00007865 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 42774                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 42775 00007868 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 42776                                  
 42777                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 42778                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 42779                                  ; buffer.
 42780                                  
 42781 0000786A 16                      	push	ss
 42782 0000786B 1F                      	pop	ds
 42783 0000786C 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 42784 00007870 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 42785 00007874 E81B02                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 42786 00007877 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 42787                                  
 42788                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 42789                                  
 42790 00007879 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 42791 0000787C E8B9E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 42792 0000787F 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 42793                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 42794 00007881 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 42795 00007885 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 42796 00007887 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 42797 00007888 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 42798                                  
 42799                                  ; Splice the result.
 42800                                  
 42801                                  DoSplice:
 42802 0000788D 16                      	push	ss
 42803 0000788E 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 42804 0000788F 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 42805 00007893 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 42806 00007895 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 42807 0000789A 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 42808 0000789C E82A01                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 42809                                  SkipSplice:
 42810                                  
 42811                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 42812                                  ; device.
 42813                                  
 42814 0000789F 16                      	push	ss
 42815 000078A0 1F                      	pop	ds
 42816 000078A1 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 42817                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 42818                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42819                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 42820 000078A5 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 42821                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 42822 000078AA 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 42823 000078AC E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 42824 000078AE E838A0                  	call	ECritDisk
 42825 000078B1 E8BEE9                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 42826 000078B4 E85FA0                  	call	LCritDisk
 42827                                  	;mov	al, 3
 42828 000078B7 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 42829                                  Done:   
 42830 000078B9 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 42831                                  
 42832                                  ; 13/07/2018
 42833                                  
 42834                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 42835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42836                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 42837                                  ;
 42838                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 42839                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 42840                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 42841                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 42842                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 42843                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 42844                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 42845                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 42846                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 42847                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 42848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42849                                  
 42850                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42851                                  
 42852                                  Canonicalize:
 42853                                  
 42854                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 42855                                  
 42856 000078BA AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 42857 000078BB E87AE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 42858 000078BE 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 42859 000078C0 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 42860 000078C2 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 42861 000078C4 AA                      	STOSB
 42862 000078C5 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 42863                                  CanonDec:
 42864 000078C7 4E                      	DEC     SI
 42865                                  
 42866                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 42867                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 42868                                  ; buffer.
 42869                                  
 42870                                  CanonLoop:
 42871                                  
 42872                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 42873                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 42874                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 42875                                  
 42876 000078C8 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 42877 000078CA 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 42878 000078CC 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 42879 000078CE 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 42880 000078D3 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 42881 000078D5 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 42882 000078D7 AA                      	STOSB
 42883 000078D8 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 42884                                  DoTerminate:
 42885 000078DA AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 42886 000078DB F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 42887 000078DC C3                      	retn
 42888                                  
 42889                                  CanonBad:
 42890 000078DD E8CB01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 42891                                  	;mov	al,3
 42892 000078E0 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 42893 000078E2 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 42894                                  	;mov	al,2
 42895 000078E4 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 42896                                  PathEnc:
 42897 000078E6 F9                      	STC
 42898                                  CanonBad_retn:
 42899 000078E7 C3                      	retn
 42900                                  
 42901                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 42902                                  ; it to 8.3
 42903                                  
 42904                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 42905 000078E8 E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 42906 000078EB 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 42907                                  
 42908                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases.  These will be backed up.
 42909                                  
 42910                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 42911 000078ED 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 42912 000078F1 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1
 42913                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'..'
 42914 000078F3 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 42915 000078F8 750A                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 42916 000078FA 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 42917                                  Skip1:  
 42918 000078FB E82A00                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 42919                                  	;mov	al,3
 42920 000078FE B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 42921 00007900 72E5                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn
 42922 00007902 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 42923                                  
 42924                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 42925                                  
 42926                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 42927 00007904 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 42928                                  
 42929                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 42930                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 42931                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 42932                                  
 42933                                  CanonPath:
 42934 00007906 E81600                  	CALL    PathSep
 42935 00007909 75D2                    	JNZ	short CanonBad		; something else...
 42936                                  
 42937                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 42938                                  
 42939 0000790B AC                      	LODSB                           ; get the char
 42940 0000790C E829E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it path char?
 42941 0000790F 75B6                    	JNZ	short CanonDec		; no, go test for nul
 42942 00007911 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ; beyond buffer end?
 42943 00007913 73C8                    	JAE	short CanonBad		; yep, error.

 43119                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 43120                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43121                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 43122                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 43123                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 43124                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 43125                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 43126                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 43127                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 43128                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 43129                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 43130                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise

 43132                                  ;                   left alone

 43210                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 43211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43212                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 43213                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 43214                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 43215                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 43216                                  ;

 43218                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer

 43222                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer

 43241                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 43242                                  ; and restore CX.
 43243

 43317                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 43318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43319                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 43320                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 43321                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 43322                                  ;
 43323                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 43324                                  ;               ES:DI string
 43325                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 43326                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 43327                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 43328                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 43329                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 43335 00007A98 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 43336 00007A9A 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 43337 00007A9B 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 43338 00007A9E E897E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 43339 00007AA1 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 43340                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 43342 00007AA6 E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 43343                                  Prefix:
 43344 00007AA9 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 43345 00007AAA C3                      	retn

 43378                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 43379                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 43380                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43381                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 43382                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 43383                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 43384                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 43385                                  ;           INT     int_command
 43386                                  ;
 43387                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 43388                                  ;       ------          --------
 43389                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 43390                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 43391                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 43392                                  ;
 43393                                  ;   Error returns:

 43401                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 43402                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43403                                  ;
 43404                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 43405                                  ;
 43406                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 43407                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 43408                                  ;
 43409                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 43410                                  ;		(AL) = open mode

 43412                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 43413                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43414                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43415                                  ;	USES	all
 43416                                  ;
 43417                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43418                                  
 43419                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43420                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 43422                                  _$OPEN:       
 43423 00007AB4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 43424                                  _$Open2:

 43426 00007AB6 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 43427 00007AB8 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib

 43430                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 43431                                  
 43432 00007ABE 50                      	push	ax
 43433                                  
 43434                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 43435                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 43436                                  ;
 43437                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 43438                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 43439                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 43440                                  ;
 43441                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 43442                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 43443                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 43444                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 43445                                  
 43446                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 43447                                  
 43448                                  AccessFile:

 43451 00007AC5 E84E9E                  	call	LCritSFT

 43453 00007ACA 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 43454 00007ACF 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 43455 00007AD4 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 43456                                  
 43457                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 43458

 43460 00007ADC 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN

 43463                                  
 43464                                  SaveJFN:

 43468                                  
 43469                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 43470                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 43471                                  
 43472 00007AF0 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override

 43479

 43896                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 43897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43898                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 43899                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 43900                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 43901                                  ;
 43902                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 43903                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 43904                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 43905                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 43906                                  ;		Carry Set:
 43907                                  ;		    AX has error code
 43908                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 43909                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43910                                  
 43911                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 43912 00007C74 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 43913 00007C75 B9[9831]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 43914 00007C78 E914FF                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 43915                                  
 43916                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 43917                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43918                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 43919                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 43920                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 43921                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 43922                                  ;
 43923                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 43924                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 43925                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 43926                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 43927                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43928                                  
 43929                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 43930                                  ;BinToAscii:
 43931                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 43932                                  ;bta5:
 43933                                  ;	push    cx
 43934                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 43935                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 43936                                  ;	push    ax
 43937                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 43938                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 43939                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 43940                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 43941                                  ;	add     al,7
 43942                                  ;bta6: 
 43943                                  ;	stosb
 43944                                  ;	pop     ax
 43945                                  ;	pop     cx
 43946                                  ;	loop    bta5
 43947                                  ;	retn
 43948                                  
 43949                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 43950                                  BinToAscii:
 43951 00007C7B B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 43952                                  bta5:	
 43953 00007C7E D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 43954 00007C80 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 43955 00007C81 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 43956 00007C83 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 43957 00007C85 AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 43958 00007C86 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 43959 00007C87 FECD                    	dec	ch
 43960 00007C89 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 43961 00007C8B C3                      	retn
 43962                                  
 43963                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 43964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43965                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 43966                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 43967                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 43968                                  ;
 43969                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 43970                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 43971                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 43972                                  ;		AX has handle
 43973                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 43974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43975                                  
 43976                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43977                                  
 43978                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 43979                                  	;Enter
 43980 00007C8C 55                      	push	bp
 43981 00007C8D 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 43982                                  
 43983                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 43984                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 43985                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 43986                                  
 43987 00007C8F 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 43988                                  
 43989                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 43990 00007C92 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 43991 00007C96 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 43992                                  
 43993                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 43994                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 43995                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 43996                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 43997                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 43998                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 43999                                  
 44000                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 44001 00007C98 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 44002 00007C9B EB69                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 44003                                  
 44004                                  OKatts:
 44005                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 44006 00007C9D 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 44007                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 44008 00007CA0 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 44009                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 44010 00007CA3 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 44011                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 44012 00007CA6 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 44013 00007CA9 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 44014 00007CAA 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 44015 00007CAB 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 44016 00007CAD 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 44017 00007CAF F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 44018                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44019 00007CB1 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 44020 00007CB3 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 44021                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 44022                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44023                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44024 00007CB5 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 44025                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 44026                                  okok:					;AN000;
 44027 00007CB6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 44028 00007CB8 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 44029                                  					;AN000;
 44030 00007CBA 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 44031 00007CBB 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 44032 00007CBF E876DF                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 44033 00007CC2 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 44034                                  STOREPTH:
 44035 00007CC4 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 44036 00007CC6 AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 44037                                  SETENDPTR:
 44038                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 44039 00007CC7 8856FC                  	mov	[bp-4],dl
 44040                                  CreateLoop:
 44041 00007CCA 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 44042 00007CCB 1F                      	pop	ds
 44043 00007CCC 55                      	push	bp
 44044 00007CCD E8BC8E                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 44045 00007CD0 5D                      	pop	bp
 44046                                  ;
 44047                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 44048                                  ;
 44049                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 44050 00007CD1 C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 44051 00007CD4 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 44052 00007CD6 E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 44053 00007CD9 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 44054 00007CDB E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word
 44055 00007CDE 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 44056 00007CE0 AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 44057                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 44058 00007CE1 C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]
 44059                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 44060 00007CE4 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 44061 00007CE7 55                      	push	bp
 44062 00007CE8 E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 44063 00007CEB 5D                      	pop	bp
 44064 00007CEC 7319                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 44065                                  
 44066                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 44067                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 44068                                  
 44069                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 44070                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 44071                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists

 44082 00007CF4 7510                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 44083                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 44084                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 44085                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 44086                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 44087                                  					;    so. 
 44088 00007CF6 36803E[2403]41          	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 44089                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 44090 00007CFC 7408                    	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 44091                                  ;M070
 44092                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 44093                                  ;

 44095                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 44096                                  
 44097                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 44098                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44099 00007D04 75C4                    	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 44100                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44101                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 44102                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 44103                                  
 44104                                  ;;	MOV	AL,error_access_denied	; Return this "extended" error
 44105                                  					; M049 - end
 44106                                  SETTMPERR:
 44107 00007D06 F9                      	STC
 44108                                  CreateDone:
 44109                                  	;Leave

 44111 00007D09 5D                      	pop	bp
 44112 00007D0A 7203                    	JC	short CreateFail
 44113 00007D0C E96189                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; success!
 44114                                  CreateFail:
 44115 00007D0F E96889                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 44116                                  
 44117                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 44118                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 44119                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 44120                                  ;
 44121                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 44122                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
