 46089                                  	; 28/12/2022
 46090                                  	;jmp	short ExePackPatch
 46091                                  
 46092                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 46093                                  ;
 46094                                  ; Procedure Name 	: ExePackPatch
 46095                                  ;
 46096                                  ; Inputs	 	: DS 			-> DOSDATA
 46097                                  ;			  ES:0 			-> read in image
 46098                                  ;			  ax:cx = start cs:ip of program
 46099                                  ; Output		:		
 46100                                  ;
 46101                                  ;	1. If ES <= 0fffh
 46102                                  ;	   2. if exepack signature ('RB') found
 46103                                  ;	      3. if common code to patch compares (for 3 diff. versions)
 46104                                  ;	       	 4. if rest of the code & checksum compares
 46105                                  ;	  	    5. overlay buggy code with code in 
 46106                                  ;		       doscode:str1.
 46107                                  ;		 6. endif
 46108                                  ;	      7. endif
 46109                                  ;	   8. endif
 46110                                  ;	9. endif
 46111                                  ;
 46112                                  ;
 46113                                  ; Uses			: NONE
 46114                                  ;
 46115                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 46116                                  		
 46117                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46118                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 46119                                  ExePackPatch:
 46120 00008121 53                      	push	bx
 46121 00008122 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; bx has load segment
 46122 00008124 81FBFF0F                	cmp	bx,0FFFh		; Q: is the load segment > 64K
 46123 00008128 7602                    	jbe	short ep_cont		; N: 
 46124 0000812A 5B                      	pop	bx			; Y: no need to patch
 46125 0000812B C3                      	retn
 46126                                  ep_cont:
 46127 0000812C 1E                      	push	ds
 46128 0000812D 06                      	push	es
 46129 0000812E 50                      	push	ax
 46130 0000812F 51                      	push	cx
 46131 00008130 56                      	push	si
 46132 00008131 57                      	push	di
 46133                                  	
 46134                                  		; M033 - start
 46135                                  		; exepacked programs have an IP of 12h (>=2)
 46136                                  
 46137 00008132 83E902                  	sub	cx,2			; Q: is IP >=2 
 46138 00008135 7303                    	jnb	short epp_1		; N: exit
 46139 00008137 E9C500                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 46140                                  					; ax:cx now points to location of
 46141                                  					; 'RB' if this is an exepacked file.
 46142                                  		; M033 - end
 46143                                  epp_1:
 46144 0000813A 89CF                    	mov	di,cx
 46145 0000813C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 46146 0000813E 36893E[8700]            	mov	[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET],di	; save pointer to 'RB' in 
 46147                                  					; unpack_offset
 46148                                  
 46149 00008143 26813D5242              	cmp	word [es:di],'RB' ; 4252h
 46150                                  	;ljne	ep_notpacked
 46151 00008148 7403                    	je	short epp_2
 46152 0000814A E9B200                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 46153                                  epp_2:
 46154 0000814D 0E                      	push	cs
 46155 0000814E 1F                      	pop	ds			; set ds to cs
 46156                                  
 46157                                  	;add	di,6Ch
 46158 0000814F 83C76C                  	add	di,PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	; es:di -> points to place in packed 
 46159                                  					;          file where we hope to find
 46160                                  					;	   scan string. 
 46161                                  
 46162 00008152 E8B200                  	call	chk_common_str		; check for match
 46163                                  
 46164 00008155 7524                    	jnz	short ep_chkpatch2	; Q: does the patch match
 46165                                  					; N: check at patch2_offset
 46166                                  					; Y: check for rest of patch string
 46167 00008157 BE[3780]                	mov	si,scan_patch1
 46168                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 46169 0000815A 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; restore di to point to 'RB'
 46170                                  
 46171                                  	;add	di,28h
 46172                                  	; 07/12/2022

 46306                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46307                                  ;
 46308                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: chk_common_str
 46309                                  ;
 46310                                  ;	Input		: DS = DOSCODE
 46311                                  ;			; ES:DI points to string in packed file
 46312                                  ;
 46313                                  ;	Output		; Z if match else NZ
 46314                                  ;
 46315                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46316                                  
 46317                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46318                                  chk_common_str:
 46319 00008207 BE[0181]                	mov	si,scan_com
 46320                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 46321                                  	;mov	cx,32
 46322 0000820A B92000                  	mov	cx,size_scan_com
 46323                                  
 46324 0000820D F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb	       
 46325                                  
 46326                                  					; M046 - start
 46327                                  	; a fourth possible version of these exepacked programs have a 
 46328                                  	; 056h instead of 06Bh. See scan_com above
 46329                                  	;
 46330                                  	; 	db  75h, 6Bh		;jne CorruptExe		
 46331                                  	;
 46332                                  	; If the mismatch at this point is due to a 56h instead of 6Bh 
 46333                                  	; we shall try to match the rest of the string
 46334                                  	;
 46335                                  
 46336 0000820F 7409                    	jz	short ccs_done
 46337 00008211 26807DFF56              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],56h
 46338 00008216 7502                    	jnz	short ccs_done
 46339                                  
 46340 00008218 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb	    
 46341                                  ccs_done:				; M046 - end
 46342 0000821A C3                      	retn
 46343                                  
 46344                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46345                                  ;
 46346                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 46347                                  ;
 46348                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 46349                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 46350                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 46351                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 46352                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 46353                                  ;
 46354                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 46355                                  ;				NC
 46356                                  ;			  else
 46357                                  ;				CY
 46358                                  ;
 46359                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 46360                                  ;
 46361                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46362                                  
 46363                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46364                                  chk_patchsum:
 46365 0000821B 57                      	push	di
 46366                                  
 46367 0000821C F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb			   
 46368                                  
 46369 0000821E 7518                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 46370                                  					; N: exit
 46371                                  					; Y:	
 46372                                  
 46373                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the 
 46374                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 46375                                  		; unpacking code.
 46376                                  
 46377 00008220 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 46378 00008225 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 46379                                  
 46380 00008227 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 46381 00008229 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 46382                                  ep_chksum:
 46383 0000822B 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 46384 0000822E 83C702                  	add	di,2
 46385 00008231 E2F8                    	loop	ep_chksum
 46386                                  
 46387 00008233 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 46388                                  
 46389 00008234 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 46390                                  	;jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 46391                                  					; Y: 
 46392                                  	; 25/09/2023
 46393                                  	;clc	
 46394                                  	;retn
 46395 00008236 74E2                    	je	short ccs_done ; cf=0
 46396                                  	
 46397                                  cp_fail:
 46398 00008238 F9                      	stc
 46399 00008239 C3                      	retn

 46405                                  
 46406                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 46407                                  ;
 46408                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46409                                  ;
 46410                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 46411                                  ;
 46412                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 46413                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 46414                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 46415                                  ;
 46416                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 46417                                  ;
 46418                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 46419                                  ;90		even				; word align
 46420                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 46421                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 46422                                  ;
 46423                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 46424                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 46425                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 46426                                  ; a mov & loop.
 46427                                  ;
 46428                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 46429                                  ; ====================================
 46430                                  ;
 46431                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 46432                                  ;
 46433                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 46434                                  ; ------				--------
 46435                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 46436                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 46437                                  ;
 46438                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 46439                                  ;
 46440                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 46441                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 46442                                  ;
 46443                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 46444                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 46445                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 46446                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 46447                                  ;
 46448                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 46449                                  ;				from the program image
 46450                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 46451                                  ;
 46452                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 46453                                  ;
 46454                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46455                                  
 46456                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46457                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46458                                  
 46459                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46460                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46461                                  
 46462                                  RScanPattern1:
 46463                                  	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 46464                                  
 46465                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 46466                                  
 46467                                  RScanPattern2:
 46468                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 46469                                  
 46470                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 46471                                  
 46472                                  RScanPattern3:
 46473                                  	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 46474                                  
 46475                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 46476                                  
 46477                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46478                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46479                                  
 46480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46481                                  ;
 46482                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 46483                                  ;
 46484                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46485                                  
 46486                                  RationalPatch:
 46487                                  	cld
 46488                                  	push	ax
 46489                                  	push	bx
 46490                                  	push	cx
 46491                                  	push	dx
 46492                                  	push	si
 46493                                  	push	di
 46494                                  	push	es
 46495                                  	push	ds			; we use all of them
 46496                                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 46497                                  	push	cs
 46498                                  	pop	ds
 46499                                  	
 46500                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 46501                                  	;mov	cx,10
 46502                                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 46503                                  	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 46504                                  	jne	short rpexit
 46505                                  	mov	ax,[es:0]
 46506                                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 46507                                  	jb	short rpexit
 46508                                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 46509                                  	ja	short rpexit
 46510                                  
 46511                                  	call	VerifyVersion
 46512                                  	jne	short rpexit
 46513                                  
 46514                                  	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 46515                                  	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 46516                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 46517                                  	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 46518                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 46519                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 46520                                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 46521                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 46522                                  	jz	short rpfound
 46523                                  
 46524                                  	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 46525                                  	;mov	dx,15
 46526                                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 46527                                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 46528                                  	jnz	short rpexit
 46529                                  
 46530                                  rpfound:
 46531                                  	
 46532                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 46533                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 46534                                  
 46535                                  	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 46536                                  	stosb
 46537                                  	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 46538                                  	stosw
 46539                                  	mov	ax,ss
 46540                                  	stosw
 46541                                  	mov	cx,dx
 46542                                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 46543                                  	mov	al,90h
 46544                                  	rep	stosb
 46545                                  rpexit:
 46546                                  	pop	ds
 46547                                  	pop	es
 46548                                  	pop	di
 46549                                  	pop	si
 46550                                  	pop	dx
 46551                                  	pop	cx
 46552                                  	pop	bx
 46553                                  	pop	ax
 46554                                  	retn
 46555                                  
 46556                                  ; M020 END
 46557                                  
 46558                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46559                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46560                                  
 46561                                  ; DOSCODE:B6D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46562                                  
 46563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46564                                  ;
 46565                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 46566                                  ;
 46567                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 46568                                  ;
 46569                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 46570                                  ;
 46571                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46572                                  
 46573                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 46574                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46575                                  	mov	di,200h
 46576                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 46577                                  	push	cx
 46578                                  	sub	cx,dx
 46579                                  	inc	cx
 46580                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46581                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46582                                  	;mov	di,200h
 46583                                  scsagain:
 46584                                  	push	si
 46585                                  	push	di
 46586                                  	push	cx
 46587                                  	mov	cx,dx
 46588                                  	rep	cmpsb
 46589                                  	pop	cx
 46590                                  	pop	di
 46591                                  	pop	si
 46592                                  	je	short scsfound
 46593                                  	inc	di
 46594                                  	loop	scsagain
 46595                                  scsfound:
 46596                                  	pop	cx
 46597                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 46598                                  	retn
 46599                                  
 46600                                  
 46601                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46602                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46603                                  
 46604                                  ; DOSCODE:B6F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46605                                  
 46606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46607                                  ;
 46608                                  ; VerifyVersion
 46609                                  ;
 46610                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 46611                                  ; from ES:2A.
 46612                                  ;
 46613                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 46614                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 46615                                  ;
 46616                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46617                                  
 46618                                  VerifyVersion:
 46619                                  	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 46620                                  					;  in ascii
 46621                                  	mov	bl,10
 46622                                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 46623                                  
 46624                                  	call	VVDigit
 46625                                  	jne	short vvexit
 46626                                  	call	VVDigit
 46627                                  	jne	short vvexit
 46628                                  	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 46629                                  	jne	short vvexit
 46630                                  	dec	si
 46631                                  	;call	VVDigit
 46632                                  	; 18/12/2022
 46633                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 46634                                  ;vvexit:
 46635                                  	;retn
 46636                                  VVDigit:
 46637                                  	div	bl
 46638                                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 46639                                  	dec	si
 46640                                  	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 46641                                  	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 46642                                  	retn
 46643                                  
 46644                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 46645                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 46646                                  
 46647                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46648                                  ;
 46649                                  ;	M068
 46650                                  ;
 46651                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 46652                                  ;
 46653                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 46654                                  ;
 46655                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 46656                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 46657                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 46658                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 46659                                  ;
 46660                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 46661                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 46662                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 46663                                  ;				to the user. 
 46664                                  ;
 46665                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 46666                                  ;
 46667                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46668                                  
 46669                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46670                                  
 46671                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 46672                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 46673                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 46674                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 46675                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 46676                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 46677                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 46678                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 46679                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 46680                                  
 46681                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46682                                  
 46683                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46684                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46685                                  
 46686                                  CPScanPattern:
 46687 0000823A 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 46688 0000823E 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 46689 00008242 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 46690 00008248 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 46691 0000824C B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 46692 0000824F BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 46693                                  
 46694                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 46695                                  
 46696                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 46697                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 46698                                  
 46699                                  IsCopyProt:
 46700 00008252 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1
 46701 00008258 752D                    	jne	short CP_done
 46702                                  
 46703 0000825A 813E73014450            	cmp	word [CPID2Offset],ID2
 46704 00008260 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 46705                                  
 46706 00008262 813E460113F4            	cmp	word [CPID3Offset],ID3
 46707 00008268 751D                    	jne	short CP_done
 46708

 47645                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 47646                                  ;
 47647                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 47648                                  ;
 47649 00008582 50                      	push	ax
 47650                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 47651 00008583 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 47652 00008586 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 47653                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 47654                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 47655                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 47656 00008588 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 47657 0000858A 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 47658                                  ;
 47659                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 47660                                  ; need to call it later.
 47661                                  ;
 47662 0000858C 53                      	push	bx
 47663 0000858D 52                      	push	dx
 47664 0000858E 1E                      	push	ds
 47665 0000858F 06                      	push	es
 47666                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 47667 00008590 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 47668 00008593 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 47669                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 47670                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 47671                                  
 47672 00008595 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 47673                                  
 47674 0000859A 891E[AD11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 47675 0000859E 8C06[AF11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 47676                                  cXMMexit:
 47677 000085A2 F8                      	clc
 47678 000085A3 07                      	pop	es
 47679 000085A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 47680 000085A5 5A                      	pop	dx
 47681 000085A6 5B                      	pop	bx
 47682 000085A7 58                      	pop	ax
 47683 000085A8 C3                      	retn				; done
 47684                                  ;
 47685                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 47686                                  ;
 47687                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 47688 000085A9 F9                      	stc
 47689 000085AA 58                      	pop	ax
 47690 000085AB C3                      	retn

 47692                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47693                                  ;
 47694                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 47695                                  ;
 47696                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 47697                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 47698                                  ;
 47699                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 47700                                  ;		   if AX =0
 47701                                  ;		      if first entry
 47702                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 47703                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 47704                                  ;		      else
 47705                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 47706                                  ;
 47707                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 47708                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 47709                                  ;
 47710                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 47711                                  ;
 47712                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 47713                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47714                                  
 47715 000085AC 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 47716                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 47717                                  
 47718                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 47719                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 47720                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 47721                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 47722                                  
 47723                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 47724 000085AD 1E                      	push	ds
 47725                                  
 47726 000085AE 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 47727                                  
 47728 000085B3 E88600                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 47729                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 47730                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47731                                  	; cx = 0
 47732 000085B6 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 47733                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 47734 000085B8 753D                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 47735                                  
 47736                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47737 000085BA 2E380E[AC85]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 47738                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
 47739 000085BF 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 47740                                  					;    segment in ES
 47741                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub
 47742 000085C1 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 47743 000085C3 E83E00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 47744 000085C6 E8BD00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 47745                                  					; with those in the stub.
 47746                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47747                                  	; cx = 0
 47748                                  second_entry:
 47749 000085C9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 47750                                  
 47751                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 47752                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 47753 000085CB BF[AC10]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 47754                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47755                                  	; cx = 0
 47756                                  	;mov	cx,9
 47757 000085CE B109                    	mov	cl,9
 47758 000085D0 1E                      	push	ds			
 47759 000085D1 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 47760                                  
 47761                                  dosinttabloop:
 47762                                  	;add	di,2
 47763                                  	; 19/06/2023
 47764 000085D2 47                      	inc	di
 47765 000085D3 47                      	inc	di
 47766 000085D4 AB                      	stosw
 47767 000085D5 E2FB                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 47768                                  
 47769                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 47770                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 47771                                  
 47772                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 47773 000085D7 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 47774 000085DA 7220                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 47775                                  ;endif
 47776 000085DC E8A3FF                  	call	check_XMM		; Y: set up the XMS entry point

 47778                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 47779                                  	; 17/12/2022

 47782                                  ; M021-

 47785

 47790                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine

 47792                                  					; M068: apps

 47795                                  
 47796                                  	; 19/09/2023
 47797 000085F5 EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done

 47832                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47833                                  ;
 47834                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 47835                                  ;
 47836                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 47837                                  ;
 47838                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 47839                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 47840                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 47841                                  ;
 47842                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 47843                                  ;
 47844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47845                                  
 47846                                  WhatCPUType:
 47847                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47848                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 47849                                  
 47850                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47851                                  
 47852                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 47853                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 47854                                  ;
 47855                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 47856                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 47857                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 47858                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 47859                                  
 47860                                  	; 04/11/2022
 47861                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 47862                                  
 47863                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 47864                                  	pushf
 47865                                  	push	bx			; preserve bx
 47866                                  	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 47867                                  
 47868                                  	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 47869                                  	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 47870                                  	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 47871                                  	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 47872                                  	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 47873                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 47874                                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 47875                                  	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 47876                                  
 47877                                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 47878                                  	push	ax
 47879                                  	popf
 47880                                  	pushf
 47881                                  	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 47882                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 47883                                  	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 47884                                  
 47885                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 47886                                  	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 47887                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 47888                                  	inc	bx
 47889                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 47890                                  	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 47891                                  	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 47892                                  	popf
 47893                                  	
 47894                                  	;endm
 47895                                  
 47896                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47897                                  	retn	; 19/09/2023
 47898                                  
 47899                                  ; 19/09/2023
 47900                                  ;	; 04/11/2022
 47901                                  ;	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 47902                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 47903                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 47904                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 47905                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 47906                                  
 47907                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47908                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 47909                                  
 47910                                  	; 19/09/2023
 47911                                  	;jmp	short sr_done
 47912

 47917                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 47918                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 47919                                  					; DOSINIT.

 48139                                  ;
 48140                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_offset
 48141                                  ;

 48143                                  ;

 48145                                  ;		   0,20-28,3a-3f, and 30,31

 48272                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48273                                  ;
 48274                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 48275                                  ;
 48276                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 48277                                  ;
 48278                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 48279                                  ;
 48280                                  ;	Description:
 48281                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 48282                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 48283                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 48284                                  ;
 48285                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48286                                  
 48287                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48288                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48289                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 48290                                  
 48291                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 48292                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 48293                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 48294                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 48295                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 48296                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 48297                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 48298                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 48299                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 48300 000086F1 [D410]                  	dw	i0patch
 48301 000086F3 [DE10]                  	dw	i20patch
 48302 000086F5 [E810]                  	dw	i21patch
 48303 000086F7 [F210]                  	dw	i25patch
 48304 000086F9 [FC10]                  	dw	i26patch
 48305 000086FB [0611]                  	dw	i27patch
 48306 000086FD [1011]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 48307 000086FF [1A11]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 48308                                  
 48309                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 48310                                  
 48311                                  patch_in_nops:
 48312 00008701 50                      	push	ax
 48313 00008702 56                      	push	si
 48314 00008703 BE[F186]                	mov	si,patch_table
 48315 00008706 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 48316                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48317                                  	; cx = 0
 48318                                  	;mov	cx,8
 48319                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 48320 00008709 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 48321                                  pin_loop:
 48322 0000870B 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 48323 0000870E AB                      	stosw
 48324                                  	;add	si,2
 48325                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48326 0000870F 46                      	inc	si
 48327 00008710 46                      	inc	si
 48328 00008711 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 48329 00008713 5E                      	pop	si
 48330 00008714 58                      	pop	ax
 48331 00008715 C3                      	retn

 48414                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 48415                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 48416                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.

 48517                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 48518                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 48519                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 48520                                  ;;
 48521                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 48522                                  ;;
 48523                                  ;;	on return:
 48524                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 48525                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 48526                                  ;;
 48527                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 48528                                  ;;
 48529                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 48530                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 48531                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 48532                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 48533                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 48534                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 48535                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 48536                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 48537                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 48538                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 48539                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 48540                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 48541                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 48542                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 48543                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 48544                                  ;;
 48545                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 48667                                  						; keep the size of this data 
 48668                                  						; block the same.;
 48669                                  ALLOCMSAVE:
 48670 00000084 00                      	db	0	; M063: temp var. used to 
 48671                                  			; M063: save alloc method in
 48672                                  			; M063: msproc.asm
 48673                                  A20OFF_COUNT:
 48674 00000085 00                      	db	0	; M068: indiactes the # of 
 48675                                  			; M068: int 21 calls for 
 48676                                  			; M068: which A20 is off
 48677                                  DOS_FLAG:
 48678 00000086 00                      	db	0	; see DOSSYM.INC for Bit 
 48679                                  			; definitions
 48680                                  UNPACK_OFFSET:
 48681 00000087 0000                    	dw	0	; saves pointer to the start
 48682                                  			; of unpack code in exepatch.
 48683                                  			; asm.
 48684                                  UMBFLAG:
 48685 00000089 00                      	db	0 	; M003: bit 0 indicates the 
 48686                                  			; M003: link state of the UMBs
 48687                                  			; M003: whether linked or not 
 48688                                  			; M003: to the DOS arena chain
 48689                                  SAVE_AX:
 48690 0000008A 0000                    	dw	0	; M000: temp varibale to store ax
 48691                                  			; M000: in msproc.asm
 48692                                  UMB_HEAD:
 48693 0000008C FFFF                    	dw	-1	; M000: this is initialized to  
 48694                                  			; M000: the first umb arena by 
 48695                                  			; M000: BIOS sysinit.
 48696                                  START_ARENA:
 48697 0000008E 0100                    	dw	1	; M000: this is the first arena 
 48698                                  			; M000: from which DOS will 
 48699                                  			; M000: start its scan for alloc.
 48700                                  
 48701                                  ; End of SYSINITVar block
 48702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 48753                                  ;============================================================================
 48754                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48755                                  ;============================================================================
 48756                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 48757                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 48758                                  
 48759                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 48760                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48761                                  
 48762                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 48763                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 48764                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 48765                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 48766                                  ;
 48767                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 48768                                  ; describing that data item.
 48769                                  
 48770                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 48771                                  
 48772                                  ;
 48773                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 48774                                  ;
 48775                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 48776                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 48777                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 48778                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 48779                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 48780                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 48781                                  ;
 48782                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 48783                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 48784                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 48785                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 48786                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 48787                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 48788                                  ;   as EOF).
 48789                                  
 48790                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 48791                                  
 48792                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 48793                                  
 48794                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 48795 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 48796 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 48797 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 48798                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 48799 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 48800                                  
 48801                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 48802                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 48803                                  ; console.
 48804                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 48805 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 48806 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 48807                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 48808 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 48809 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 48810                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 48811 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 48812 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 48813 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 48814                                  switch_character:
 48815 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 48816 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 48817 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 48818 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 48819 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 48820

 48822                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections

 48829

 48833                                  ;

 48837                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch

 48841                                  ;

 49020                                  ;============================================================================
 49021                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 49022                                  ;============================================================================
 49023                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 49024                                  
 49025                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 49026                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 49027                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 49028                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 49029                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 49030                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 49031                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 49032                                  ; **********************************************************
 49033                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 49034                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 49035                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 49036                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 49037                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 49038                                  ; **********************************************************	
 49039                                  
 49040                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 49041                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49042                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 49043                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 49044                                  
 49045                                  ; 	ORG     0
 49046                                  
 49047                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 49048                                  
 49049                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 49050                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 49051 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 49052 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 49053                                  
 49054                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 49055                                  
 49056                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 49057                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 49058 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 49059                                  RENBUF:	
 49060 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 49061                                  
 49062                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 49063                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 49064 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 49065                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 49066 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 49067                                  
 49068                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 49069                                   
 49070                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 49071                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 49072                                  
 49073                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 49074                                  
 49075                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 49076                                  
 49077                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 49078                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 49079                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 49080                                  
 49081                                  NAME1:	
 49082 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 49083                                  NAME2:
 49084 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 49085                                  DESTSTART:
 49086 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 49087                                          ;DB      ((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 49088                                  	;times	5  db	0
 49089 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 49090                                  
 49091                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 49092                                  
 49093 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 49094                                  EXTFCB:	
 49095 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 49096                                  SATTRIB:
 49097 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 49098                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 49099 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 49100                                  FOUNDDEL:
 49101 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 49102                                  FOUND_DEV:
 49103 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 49104                                  FSPLICE:
 49105 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 49106                                  FSHARING:
 49107 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 49108                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 49109 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 49110 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 49111 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 49112                                  THISDRV:
 49113 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 49114                                  CLUSFAC:
 49115 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 49116                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 49117 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 49118                                  INSMODE:
 49119 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 49120 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 49121 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 49122                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 49123 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...
 49124

 49537                                  ;		db	081h,09Fh	;  2/12/KK
 49538                                  ;		db	0E0h,0FCh	;  2/12/KK
 49539                                  ;		db	0,0		;  2/12/KK
 49540                                  ;
 49541                                  ;endif
 49542                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>----------------------
 49543                                  
 49544                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 49545                                  
 49546                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49547                                  ;
 49548                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 49549                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 49550                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 49551                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 49552                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 49553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49554                                  ; Example:
 49555                                  
 49556                                  MAP_CASE:
 49557                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 49558                                  
 49559 00000D49 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 49560 00000D4B 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 49561 00000D4D CB                      	RETF
 49562                                  Map1:
 49563 00000D4E 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 49564 00000D50 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 49565 00000D51 53                      	PUSH	BX
 49566 00000D52 BB[030B]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 49567                                  FINISH:
 49568 00000D55 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 49569 00000D56 1F                      	POP	DS
 49570 00000D57 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 49571 00000D58 5B                      	POP	BX
 49572 00000D59 1F                      	POP	DS
 49573                                  L_RET:	
 49574 00000D5A CB                      	RETF
 49575                                  
 49576                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 49577                                  
 49578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49579                                  
 49580                                  ; The variables for ECS version are moved here for the same data alignments
 49581                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.
 49582                                  
 49583                                  InterChar:
 49584 00000D5B 00                      	db	0	; Interim character flag ( 1= interim)  ;AN000;
 49585                                  ;------- NOTE: NEXT TWO BYTES SOMETIMES USED AS A WORD !! -------------------
 49586                                  DUMMY:	; LABEL   WORD
 49587                                  InterCon:  
 49588 00000D5C 00                      	db	0	; Console in Interim mode ( 1= interim) ;AN000;
 49589                                  SaveCurFlg:
 49590 00000D5D 00                      	db	0	; Print, do not advance cursor flag     ;AN000;

 49887                                  
 49888                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49889                                  ;
 49890                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 49891                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 49892                                  ;
 49893                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 49894                                  ;
 49895                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 49896                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 49897                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 49898                                  ;
 49899                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49900                                  
 49901                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 49902                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 49903                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 49904                                  ;ELSE
 49905                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 49906                                  ;ENDIF
 49907                                  ;ENDM

 50228                                  %if 0
 50229                                  
 50230                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50231                                  ; 04/11/2022
 50232                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50233                                  
 50234                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50235                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 50236                                  ;
 50237                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 50238                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 50239                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 50240                                  ;
 50241                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 50242                                  ;
 50243                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 50244                                  ;
 50245                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50246                                  
 50247                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 50248                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 50249                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 50250                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 50251                                  
 50252                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50253                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 50254                                  ;
 50255                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 50256                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 50257                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 50258                                  ;
 50259                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50260                                  
 50261                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 50262                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 50263                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 50264                                  
 50265                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022
 50266

 50273                                  ;the address of a local SFT that can be recycled for a regenerate operation
 50274

 50302                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDRD		, 0

 50306                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:CALL_ENTRY	, 0
 50307                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:IRETT		, 0
 50308                                  	
 50309 000010AC [225E]0000              	dw	DIVOV 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+0
 50310 000010B0 [C502]0000              	dw	QUIT 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+4	
 50311 000010B4 [F102]0000              	dw	COMMAND		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+8
 50312 000010B8 [2D05]0000              	dw	ABSDRD		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+12
 50313 000010BC [DC05]0000              	dw	ABSDWRT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+16
 50314 000010C0 [966D]0000              	dw	STAY_RESIDENT	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+20
 50315 000010C4 [3C07]0000              	dw	INT2F		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+24
 50316 000010C8 [CC02]0000              	dw	CALL_ENTRY	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+28
 50317 000010CC [CB02]0000              	dw	IRETT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+32
