 50321                                  
 50322                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50323                                  ;
 50324                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 50325                                  ;
 50326                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 50327                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 50328                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 50329                                  ;
 50330                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 50331                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 50332                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 50333                                  ;	   4. else 
 50334                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 50335                                  ;	   6. endif
 50336                                  ;	7. else
 50337                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 50338                                  ;	9. endif
 50339                                  ;
 50340                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50341                                  
 50342                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50343                                  
 50344                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50345                                  
 50346                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50347                                  ;
 50348                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 50349                                  ;
 50350                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50351                                  
 50352                                  ldivov:
 50353                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 50354                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 50355                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 50356                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 50357                                  i0patch:
 50358 000010D4 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 50359                                  
 50360 000010D6 E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50361                                  divov_cont:
 50362 000010D9 2EFF2E[AC10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 50363                                  
 50364                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50365                                  ;
 50366                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 50367                                  ;
 50368                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 50369                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 50370                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 50371                                  ; will be restored then.
 50372                                  ;
 50373                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50374                                  
 50375                                  lquit:
 50376                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 50377                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 50378                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 50379                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 50380                                  i20patch:
 50381 000010DE EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 50382                                  
 50383 000010E0 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50384                                  quit_cont:
 50385 000010E3 2EFF2E[B010]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 50386                                  
 50387                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50388                                  ;
 50389                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 50390                                  ;
 50391                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50392                                  
 50393                                  lcommand:
 50394                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 50395                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 50396                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 50397                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 50398                                  i21patch:
 50399 000010E8 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 50400                                  
 50401 000010EA E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50402                                  command_cont:
 50403 000010ED 2EFF2E[B410]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 50404                                  
 50405                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50406                                  ;
 50407                                  ; INT 25 
 50408                                  ;
 50409                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50410                                  
 50411                                  labsdrd:
 50412                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 50413                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 50414                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 50415                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 50416                                  i25patch:
 50417 000010F2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 50418                                  
 50419 000010F4 E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50420                                  absdrd_cont:
 50421 000010F7 2EFF2E[B810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 50422                                  
 50423                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50424                                  ;
 50425                                  ; INT 26
 50426                                  ;
 50427                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 50428                                  
 50429                                  labsdwrt:
 50430                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 50431                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 50445                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 50446

 50448                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 50449                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 50489 0000111A EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 50490                                  
 50491 0000111C E89200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50492                                  callentry_cont:
 50493 0000111F 2EFF2E[C810]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 50494                                  
 50495                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50496                                  
 50497                                  lirett:
 50498 00001124 CF                      	iret
 50499                                  
 50500                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50501                                  ;
 50502                                  ; LowIntXX:
 50503                                  ;
 50504                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 50505                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 50506                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 50507                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 50508                                  ;
 50509                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 50510                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 50511                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 50512                                  ;
 50513                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 50514                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 50515                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 50516                                  ;
 50517                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50518                                  
 50519 00001125 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 50520 00001129 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 50521 0000112D 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 50522                                  
 50523                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 50524                                  LowInt23:
 50525                                  					; save the return address that is on
 50526                                  					; the stack
 50527 00001131 2E8F06[2511]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 50528 00001136 2E8F06[2711]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 50529                                  
 50530 0000113B CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 50531                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 50532                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 50533                                  
 50534 0000113D E87100                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 50535                                  
 50536 00001140 2EFF2E[2511]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 50537                                  
 50538                                  
 50539                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 50540                                  LowInt24:
 50541                                  					; save the return address that is on
 50542                                  					; the stack
 50543 00001145 2E8F06[2911]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 50544 0000114A 2E8F06[2B11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 50545                                  
 50546 0000114F CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 50547                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 50548                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 50549                                  
 50550 00001151 E85D00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50551                                  
 50552 00001154 2EFF2E[2911]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 50553                                  
 50554                                  
 50555                                   
 50556                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 50557                                  LowInt28:
 50558 00001159 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 50559                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 50560                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 50561                                  
 50562 0000115B E85300                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 50563                                  
 50564 0000115E CB                      	retf
 50565                                  
 50566                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50567                                  
 50568                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50569                                  ;
 50570                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 50571                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 50572                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 50573                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 50574                                  ;
 50575                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 50576                                  
 50577                                  disa20_xfer:
 50578 0000115F E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 50579                                  
 50580                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 50581                                  
 50582                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 50583                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 50584                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 50585                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 50586                                  
 50587 00001162 FA                      	cli
 50588 00001163 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 50589                                  
 50590 00001169 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 50591 0000116B 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 50592 0000116D FB                      	sti
 50593                                  
 50594 0000116E 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 50595 0000116F 56                      	push	SI
 50596 00001170 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 50597 00001172 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 50598 00001174 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 50599 00001176 CB                      	retf
 50600                                  
 50601                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50602                                  ;
 50603                                  ; M003:
 50604                                  ;
 50605                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 50606                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 50607                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 50608                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 50609                                  ; more info.	
 50610                                  ;
 50611                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 50612                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 50613                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 50614                                  ;
 50615                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50616                                  
 50617                                  disa20_iret:
 50618 00001177 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 50619 0000117A FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 50620 0000117E 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 50621 00001182 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 50622 00001186 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 50623                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 50624 00001188 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 50625 0000118B A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 50626 0000118E A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 50627 00001191 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 50628 00001194 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 50629                                  
 50630 00001197 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 50631 00001198 5B                      	pop	BX
 50632 00001199 59                      	pop	CX
 50633 0000119A 5A                      	pop	DX
 50634 0000119B 5E                      	pop	SI
 50635 0000119C 5F                      	pop	DI
 50636 0000119D 5D                      	pop	BP
 50637 0000119E 1F                      	pop	DS
 50638 0000119F 07                      	pop	ES
 50639 000011A0 CF                      	iret
 50640                                  
 50641                                  ;**************************************************************************
 50642                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 50643                                  ;
 50644                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 50645                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 50646                                  ;
 50647                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 50648                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 50649                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 50650                                  ;
 50651                                  ;**************************************************************************
 50652                                  
 50653                                  XMMDisableA20:
 50654 000011A1 53                      	push	bx
 50655 000011A2 50                      	push	ax
 50656                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 50657 000011A3 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 50658 000011A5 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 50659 000011AA 58                      	pop	ax
 50660 000011AB 5B                      	pop	bx
 50661 000011AC C3                      	retn
 50662                                  
 50663                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 50664                                  
 50665                                  XMMcontrol:
 50666 000011AD 00000000                	dd	0
 50667                                  
 50668                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50669                                  ;
 50670                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 50671                                  ;
 50672                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 50673                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 50674                                  ;
 50675                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 50676                                  ;
 50677                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 50678                                  ;		
 50679                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 50680                                  ;
 50681                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50682                                  
 50683                                  ; 19/09/2023
 50684                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 50685                                  ;	dw	00080h
 50686                                  ;	dw	00000h
 50687                                  ;
 50688                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 50689                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 50690                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 50691                                  
 50692                                  EnsureA20ON:
 50693 000011B1 9C                      	pushf
 50694 000011B2 1E                      	push    ds
 50695 000011B3 06                      	push	es
 50696 000011B4 51                      	push	cx
 50697 000011B5 56                      	push	si
 50698 000011B6 57                      	push	di
 50699                                  
 50700                                  	; 19/09/2023
 50701                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 50702                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 50703                                  
 50704 000011B7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 50705 000011B9 8EC7                    	mov	es,di
 50706 000011BB 4F                      	dec	di
 50707 000011BC BE9000                  	mov	si,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 50708 000011BF 8EDF                    	mov	ds,di
 50709 000011C1 BF8000                  	mov	di,80h ; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 50710                                  	
 50711 000011C4 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 50712 000011C7 FC                      	cld
 50713 000011C8 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 50714                                  
 50715 000011CA 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 50716                                  EA20_RET:
 50717 000011CC 5F                      	pop	di
 50718 000011CD 5E                      	pop	si
 50719 000011CE 59                      	pop	cx
 50720 000011CF 07                      	pop	es
 50721 000011D0 1F                      	pop	ds
 50722 000011D1 9D                      	popf
 50723 000011D2 C3                      	retn
 50724                                  
 50725                                  EA20_OFF:
 50726                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 50727                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 50728                                  
 50729 000011D3 53                      	push	bx
 50730 000011D4 50                      	push	ax
 50731                                  
 50732 000011D5 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 50733 000011D7 2EA3[D010]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 50734 000011DB 2E8926[D210]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 50735 000011E0 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 50736 000011E2 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 50737 000011E4 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 50738                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 50739                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 50740 000011E7 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 50741 000011E9 2EFF1E[AD11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 50742 000011EE 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 50743 000011F0 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 50744                                  
 50745 000011F2 2EA1[D010]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 50746 000011F6 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 50747 000011F8 2E8B26[D210]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 50748                                  
 50749 000011FD 58                      	pop	ax
 50750 000011FE 5B                      	pop	bx
 50751                                  
 50752 000011FF EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 50753                                  
 50754                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 50755 00001201 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 50756 00001203 CD10                    	int	10h
 50757 00001205 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 50758 00001207 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 50759 00001209 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 50760 0000120B B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 50761 0000120D CD10                    	int	10h
 50762                                  XMMcont:
 50763 0000120F B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 50764 00001211 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 50765 00001213 CD10                    	int	10h
 50766                                  	
 50767 00001215 BE[3A13]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 50768 00001218 0E                      	push	cs
 50769 00001219 1F                      	pop	ds
 50770 0000121A FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 50771                                  XMMprnt:
 50772 0000121B AC                      	lodsb
 50773 0000121C 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 50774 0000121E 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 50775 00001220 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 50776 00001222 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 50777 00001225 CD10                    	int	10h
 50778 00001227 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 50779                                  
 50780                                  XMMStall:
 50781 00001229 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 50782 0000122A EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 50783

 51005                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 51006                                  
 51007                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 51008                                  ;
 51009                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 51010                                  ;
 51011                                  ;
 51012                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 51013                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 51014                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 51015                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 51016                                  ;	inc [indos]
 51017                                  ;	xor ax,ax

 51057                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.

 51476                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 51477                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 51478                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 51479                                  
 51480                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 51481                                  
 51482                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 51483                                  ;
 51484                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 51485                                  ;
 51486                                  ;
 51487                                  ;
 51488                                  ;	push	ax
 51489                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 51490                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 51491                                  ;	pop	ax
 51492                                  ;	jz	????
 51493                                  
 51494                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 51495                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 51496                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 51497                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 51498                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 51499                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 51500                                  
 51501                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 51502                                  
 51503                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 51504                                  ;
 51505                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 51506                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 51507                                  ;
 51508                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 51509                                  ;
 51510                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 51511                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 51512                                  ;	    POP     DS
 51513                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 51514                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 51515                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 51516                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 51517                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 51518                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 51519                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 51520                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 51521                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 51522                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 51523                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 51524                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 51525                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 51526                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 51527                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 51528                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 51529                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 51530                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 51531                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 51532                                  ;	    POP     DS
 51533                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 51534                                  ;
 51535                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 51536                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 51537                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 51538                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 51539                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 51540                                  ;
 51541                                  ;   CRDROK:
 51542                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 51543                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 51544                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 51545                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 51546                                  
 51547                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 51548                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 51549                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 51550                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 51551                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 51552                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 51553                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 51554                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 51555                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 51556                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 51557                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 51558                                  			db	009H,003H
 51559                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 51560                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 51561                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 51562                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 51563                                  			db	05FH
 51564                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 51565                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 51566                                  
 51567                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 51568                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 51569                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 51570                                  
 51571                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 51572                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 51573                                  ;
 51574                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 51575                                  ;
 51576                                  ;
 51577                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 51578                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 51579                                  ;	    je l1
 51580                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 51581                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 51582                                  ;	    int 10h
 51583                                  ;	    jmp l0
 51584                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 51585                                  
 51586                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 51587                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 51588                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 51589                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 51590                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 51591                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 51592                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 51593                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 51594                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 51595                                  
 51596                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 51597                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 51598                                  
 51599                                  ; 06/12/2022
 51600                                  ;DOSDATASIZE	equ  $ - DOSDATASTART ; 4962 bytes (1362h)
 51601                                  
 51602                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 51603

 51606                                  
 51607                                  ;============================================================================
 51608                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 51609                                  ;============================================================================
 51610                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 51611                                  
 51612                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 51613                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 51614                                  ;
 51615                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 51616                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 51617                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 51618                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 51619                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 51620                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 51621                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 51622                                  ; to call out here.
 51623                                  ;
 51624                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 51625                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 51626                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 51627                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 51628                                  ;       
 51629                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 51630                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 51631                                  ;
 51632                                  ;Exported Functions
 51633                                  ;==================
 51634                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 51635                                  
 51636                                  ; DosData Segment
 51637                                  
 51638                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51639                                  
 51640                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51641                                  
 51642                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 51643                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 51644                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 51645                                  ; 'patch' related.
 51646                                  
 51647                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 51648 00001465 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 51649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51650                                  
 51651                                  MagicPatch:
 51652                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 51653 00001467 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 51654 00001468 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 51655 00001469 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 51656 0000146A 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 51657 0000146B 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 51658 0000146C 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 51659                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 51660                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 51661                                  
 51662                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51663                                  
 51664                                  ;DosData Ends
 51665                                  
 51666                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 51667                                  
 51668                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51669                                  
 51670                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 51671                                  
 51672                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51673                                  
 51674                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51675                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 51676                                  
 51677                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 51678                                  
 51679                                  ;align 16
 51680                                  
 51681                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 51682                                  
 51683                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51684                                  
 51685                                  ; 05/01/2024
 51686                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 51687                                  
 51688                                  ; 05/12/2022
 51689                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 51690                                  
 51691                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 51692                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 51693                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 51694                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART
